-njnSAwcsztC3kTPtUOstg.text: For that price I expected a way better steak. Tried the filet and it was ok, not the best.  Service was good people were nice but I was underwhelmed.

BMOD0o2DC7zfkhVvwc_XLQ.text: My sister and her husband spent thousands of dollars here for their rehearsal dinner. (Like steak and open bar for 50 people kind of money).  Tonight they returned to announce to our family that my sister is pregnant. We made a reservation for 8:30 and showed up an HOUR early. When 8:45 came around we were told we'd have an additional 30 minute wait (as we proceeded to see multiple parties of the same size be sat in front of us).  My newly pregnant sister couldn't wait until after 9pm to eat and we left.  We ended up leaving and walking to another steak restaurant, completely ruining the surprise for my parents.   I understand that the PGA is in town and it was busy but when someone has spent five figures at your restaurant and notes that they're spending another special occasion at your restaurant, I'd make sure to take care of that customer.

Aemtc0y1Gt3KzbiFK22A2A.text: This is by far the WORST STEAKHOUSE in Charlotte NC as it relates to customer service. I placed a to-go order on something as simple as their desserts last night. I placed my order at 8:50 p.m. 1 lemon cake, 1 chocolate mousse, and 1 pineapple upside down cake. My order was not brought out until 9:34 p.m. ALL of the deserts were horrible!!! Lemon cake was wet as if it had been defrosted inside of a microwave, the pineapple upside down cake was their butter cake with crushed pineapples smashed into it, and the chocolate mousse was disgusting. I threw every dessert into the garbage as they were unfit for human consumption. Additionally, as I stood patiently waiting for my order near the bar, I observed waiters, waitresses, and the bartender scratching their faces, picking their noses, wiping sweat from their brows, and scratching their scalps ALL without washing their hands as they continued to make drinks and bus tables after using their bare hands to make drinks and add garnish to those drinks. Nasty! NASTY!!! NASTY!!! Customer beware!!!

20GyK71u2y11lP7gANLJmQ.text: Let me start by saying  I am NOT a steak person. I'm a simple girl, a burger will usually do and I do enjoy seafood from time to time. For my birthday this year my sig other opted for me to try a change and made reservations for Del Friscos. I was definitly pleasantly suprised! I ordered the filet, medium and it came out hot, fresh, seasoned well and juicy. The butter and chive sauce that accompanied the baked potato left no room for sour cream or any other additive. The service was impeccable and the wine suggestions were on par. I would definitly recommend and will be returning in the future :)

L8O3hr7TfNhkyjc2WEMhAA.text: Great service, upscale atmosphere, nice bars, very impressive.  Food was also very good.  Booth seating with high ceilings was perfect for my 20th anniversary dinner.  There was a Happy Anniversary card signed by the staff on our table  and were were greeted by many of the staff which was a nice personal touch.  The manager also stopped by our table  which also made it personal and special.  Everything was awesome, but it is definitely a $$$$ restaurant, well worth it for a special occasion.

cjC_LDRDNKfX91g99UHdKQ.text: Del frisco's is so hit or miss.  We have had great meals there but also epic fails.  Here are my tips if your going there.      -Don't go with a group of more than four.    -Request a table downstairs, the upstairs area is more like a sports bar than the opulent dining room downstairs.  Also, we  have ALWAYS had bad service up there, don't know why.     -Try sitting at a bar table if you can, during happy hour they have great food specials that are more inventive than the appetizers on the regular menu.    We really do love this place when it's on, but when they are off its a really expensive long off.  The last time we were there it was a party of 8.  My fish was served cold, we had to get up and get the waiter to come to back to our table to actually take our order.  Several peoples steaks were't cooked right.  The waiter also upsold us on the sides.  He told us for the amount of people we had we needed two of each side we ordered, seriously we had so much left overs it required to multiple bags to take home.

43pnGyoXuY0BtLQmaHfYEQ.text: Excellent food! Excellent service! Excellent wine! I'm so impressed with this place that I cannot wait to go back. Highly recommend if you are looking for an awesome steak; the ribeye is by far one of the best steaks I have ever had, it's delicious!

JxTaJBIxiO1QjS5YGR224w.text: Amazing, It's expensive but soooo worth it. I'm in love with there lobster cake appetizer.

OS1H7QW_Qahchiz1cNI_cg.text: Amazing amazing amazing is all I can say my steak was delicious and our server Erika was probably the best one I have had in years! The Manger came to the table and was very nice as well! It is pricey but I will gladly pay it again for what we recieved!

AQ9MQxYDiRagVpp7UNk1VA.text: Growing up in the restaurant industry, I know a good restaurant when I see it, and I KNOW the importance of service in making your meal a great experience. My parents had been here before and they had never raved about it, but when my friend group suggested to try it for restaurant week, I was up for it. I understand restaurant week may mean a lower price point, especially for steak houses, but with the volume that they get in reservations, I am sure it all evens out. Our reservation was at 8:45 and since the entire party did not get there until 9, we were seated around 9:10. We were led all the way downstairs to the basement wine cellar where there were about 5 other tables. A really confusing part of our evening was the fact that we had about 4 different people attending our table - only one of them was nice. We asked for bread, and one of the waiters THREW it on the table in front of the person who had asked. So incredibly rude, appalling and horrifying!   With the 3 course menu & 2 glasses of wine and tip it was almost 80 dollars - which I will happily pay at Ruth's Chris or The Palm where the service is always flawless and outstanding. The food was good - not going to lie, but it was overshadowed by the terrible way we were treated. I have never experienced such horrible service and rudeness from waiters! I can understand their stress for restaurant week, but it truly ruined our night. Please Del Frisco's - do not participate in restaurant week if you do not have the proper staff for it. Our night would have been a great night if we had just been treated with respect.

lKzKo0AznIJsoBS5WeMCwQ.text: Great service, good food.  There are other places to get just as good of a steak for $25 less per person but we knew what we were getting into on the price

L9MLuD5zauLmea2ez70sSw.text: If you want a great meal, Del Friscos does not disappoint.  There are some great "off menu" items.  The longbone is a giant ribeye that is a must have.  The seafood platter appetizer is excellent.  Ask for the VIP (a special off-menu pineapple martini).  The wait staff is friendly and the sommelier is very knowledgeable and has great wine recommendations.  The atmosphere is quite interesting.  Rick Flair always seems to be at chilling at the bar there.  It's also fairly common to see star athletes dine there.  Their Wednesday happy hour seems to attract a lot of good looking women for some reason.  All these things makes for an interesting people watching scene.

qQgOxVVDMSELw65LGYaMsw.text: Steaks are very good. Side dishes were delicious.  The calamari appetizer was the best I ever had.  Lightly fried, then seasoned with a sweet & sour sauce.  Au Gratin potatoes have bacon flavoring. Very tasty. Lobster Mac & Cheese very good too.  The soups are average.  I had the chicken & sausage. My wife had the seafood soup. Nothing special.  This place is rather noisy.  We had 8 people at our table. Hard to hear people at the other end of the table.  And yes, this place is very expensive. Bring your trust fund.

kC3GA6qNkNMkwgrzbyU1sg.text: MONTES WINE DINNER  We all have fantasies and one of mine FINALLY came True!  I have always wanted to have a menage a trois!  I will set the scene for you--me, Montes Wine and Del Frisco's--two of my loves coming together for one night in Charlotte.  A girl just simply couldn't ask for more.  When I first learned about the dinner I had to get a sneak peek of the pairings.  One has to be prepared for such things.  I was willing to starve myself for a full week in preparation for all the eating and drinking I intended to do.  A mouth watering four course dinner along with an appetizing reception was set for the Montes Winery Dinner at the Charlotte location of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse.  If you have not gone to a wine dinner at Del Frisco's you really don't know what you are missing!  You are missing a lot.

j5de1e7gmA09HZfvZQITFQ.text: Just got back from anniversary dinner with my husband and toddler. I am very pleased with the experience from start to finish! This place is gorgeous and we were seAted in a lovely booth. We started off with their plate of sesame bread and smooth butter and their succulent crab cake with tons of lump meat. I also had the del salad with creamy avocado dressing, bacon, and tomatoes. My son had lobster Mac which was one of their sides. It was very rich and creamy, just how you would imagine it to be, son loved it, but too rich for my blood. Hubby ordered the 12 oz filet with peppercorn sauce cooked medium rare. Looked beautiful, tasted heavenly, a little on the seasoned side though but melted in your mouth. The sauce was overpowering though, although on the side, a little dab will do you.    I ordered their special, sea bass with pesto fingerling potatoes and balsamic cherry tomatoes. The fish was cooked perfectly! Skin was left on for crunch And seAled in flavor but I don't prefer eating the skin so I peeled it off. It was a juicy buttery fish with cooked center how I like it.  For dessert we had creme brulee and took home their lemon layer cake. The creme brulee is Belgian white chocolate with some hint of cinnamon to it, nice and creamy but I have had better. The lemon cake is just right. Not too heavy, not too sweet. The icing is like glaze on a lemon bundt cake, the cake isn't too rich. Very good!  Service was great! We had a cute young waitress and this place was popping for a Thursday night at 5:45!  Def recommend!

7pYdR6TIB86s3siax9BIWQ.text: I went here for my Birthday on Saturday and was absolutely impressed by the restaurant.  In terms of appearance this place is grand and absolutely beautiful. High ceilings, rich woods, classy well-dressed staff.  We arrived a little late unfortunately but only had to wait for a few minutes - some of our party arrived earlier but they were told they only seat everyone once the entire party arrives. They were able to sit out on the patio area until the entire group showed up. It was a beautiful evening so no worries in that department.   We ordered the "Power Couple" for $99 you had your choice of the Del's salad (with amazing avocado dressing and thick sliced bacon), or a Caesar. I went with the Del's which was delicious and very big - definitely larger than your average side salad. The main entree was an 8oz filet mignon and a huge lump crab cake. The filet was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious, and the crab cake was rich and filled with tons of crab (the least amount of filler I've had in a cake). Next we had our choice of sides which were served family style (our whole table had some of each of the sides). I loved the chateau potatoes served with white pepper and whole sauteed mushrooms. Finally we ended the deal with a choice of amazing desserts. Luckily my group all likes to share and the portions are HUGE so I tried the cheesecake (wow), bread pudding, and chocolate mousse.  We went with their featured wine selection which was a Benziger Cabernet. I loved the wine and it went perfect with my steak!   For $50 per person you absolutely cannot beat this deal - the portions alone are worth coming as you easily can make two meals out of this.   I cannot say enough about the service- fantastic! Everyone was so attentive and went out of their way to make my day great. I swear I was wished a happy birthday by six different staff members! They serve at a slower relaxed pace which was perfect for our group as we are talkers. When they cleared the first round of plates I honestly heard "be our guest" playing in my head - five servers clearing plates at once is a sight to behold !  I will absolutely be back as this has been one of the nicest dining experiences I have ever had. Thank you Del Friscos !

R3QwVnB33hVQusUu44tC-Q.text: What's not to like?  After hearing rave reviews about Del Frisco's it was about time I tried this place out for myself.  Let's start with the scenery the restaurant is beautiful two floors in a wide open space and a great bar area.  We lucked out with a really great corner booth and a great waitress. For me it's not an every night dinner kind of place only because I could never afford it, but for a great date this is the place to go.   I ordered the filet and au gratin potatoes each plate came out hot and were cooked perfectly.  A dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives oh yeah.   Del Frisco's is a great treat if your looking for somewhere really nice for dinner I would put this place in my top 5.

4f5INlBSvI8-50Afu_wGpg.text: BOOM, baby...big ol' slab o' red meat, washed down with a double Kettel One...what else do you need?   If I feel like wasting ALOT of money, this is where it's going to get done. However, it isn't so much wasting it as it is enjoying the finer things in life...or just seeing, even for a brief fleeting moment, how the other half lives.   Might I suggest the Prime PorterHouse? 24 ounces baby...Go big or go home...what, you thought I was gonna recommend the chicken breast in a place like this? Get real. Any of their sides that include cheese in the name, whether it is spelled in French or English, are winners (Mac N' Cheese and Potatoes Au Gratin). Ok, so I just googled "gratin" and it doesn't mean cheese; it means "with pan scrapings, or gratings". Sounds better than cheese, right? Basically, load up on starches and red meat, doctor's orders. I'm just kidding...I'm not a real doctor. But my dad is a cardiologist, so my future inheritance will thank you for taking my menu recommendations to heart....literally.   Let's be honest, this is a high end steakhouse, and with that label comes the typical smattering of schmucks who think they are better than the rest of the world, but for some reason, every time I've come here, whether it be for drinks, dinner, what-have-you, I have always had a great time dealing with down-to-earth servers, bartenders, and management.  Far better than some of the other high end joints in town.  Maybe I just got lucky?   Ah Del Friscos...you actually get 4.5 stars in my book...you lose half a star due to the fact that I get jealous that I can't enjoy you as much as some folks in the world, and I don't like feelings of jealousy towards my fellow man. Bad Karma.

m1Lb0YRi_gPMfm-OzvxjBg.text: I wasn't very impressed with Del Friscos. For the price you pay I expected a much better dining experience. My family and I went on a Sunday. We had a reservation but when we got there we still had to wait 5-10 minutes for our table. I was really shocked the manager walked by us several times and didn't even say hi. When we got out table it was completely unstable. When any amount of wait was put on it the table would drastically tilt to that side. Our waiter was nice but other than the steak being cooked right the food wasn't that impressive. The creamed spinach was pretty flavorless and the onion rings were unmanageable do to their size. It's cool that they are huge but from a eating perspective it makes that hard to do. We ended up barely touching them. Sadly, we didn't get to mention any of our concerns because while the manager did walk by several times, he failed to stop by our table even once.

CfGqiw9psrXUXGZAaG9nZQ.text: For the price you pay for a meal at Del Frisco's, it had better be absolutely top notch.  Overall, though, meh.  Like my rating.    Honestly, for my money I'd rather go to Ruth's Chris, which is right across the street.  This is just my opinion, but I think the steaks are better, and the price is better.  They're both high end steak houses, but there's a certain pretentiousness that I feel at Del Frisco's that I just don't get at other steak houses, almost like if you don't order pre-dinner cocktails, good wine, a large steak and a few sides then you're not doing your reservation justice.  Don't get me wrong, Del Frisco's was a more than adequate meal.  Service was on the ball, the food was very good.  But for me?  I'd take my steak dollars elsewhere.

xUSqEGqSFZP1jPV083pTww.text: We went to Del Frisco's this past weekend with a friend from Boston this was on our bucket list of restaurant's to go to. My friend and client was in town looking to purchase a property in Charlotte, and wanted to go to Del Frisco's because he had a great experience in the one in Philadelphia. The ambience was beautiful with a great wine room the service was great as for the food. I had the veal which was over seasoned we were a little disappointed more so I was expecting a lot better.

MSso99YOK25yiqwVzD6FHg.text: Ridiculously overpriced in comparison to other good steakhouses in the area. The salt used in their dishes is disturbing.   Let's be honest, the rent on the space they occupy is enormously high, and the only way they are breaking even is by charging astronomical prices for very mediocre food.  I can't fault them, and they have a great atmosphere and customer base, so more power to them. But do not come here if you want good food. Come here if you want to wine and dine or impress, as that is the only thing that is worth the price tag of the bill at the end of the night.

qm-uopdfd_Xhd-ARtcqs7w.text: The one fancy place I can only to without feeling like I've been ripped off. Great service, great food, well worth the price!

kvd25ZbTAqejOMoyTeR6rQ.text: Good atmosphere but a bit loud. Excellent service that makes the price you pay worth it.

KPMV4QZrkyj-WRyV3T5n2g.text: We eat here wire often and must say that we are pretty happy. Food here is good! Especially coming from a Miami where my go to steakhouse was Prime 112. The service here is excellent, they took me in on a Saturday night at 11:00 p.m. And still offered great service and food. The shrimp cocktail is very good. Must try the pan roasted chicken with the lime rice! The steaks are cooked very well! The banana bread pudding is a must have!

k2Bjfx2WqhgTo_G2mlBttQ.text: My husband and I finally took a trip here for Valentine's Day after hearing so many great reviews from our friends and co-workers. The steak was hands down delicious! The most flavored steak I ever had. We also ordered the calamari and crab cakes for appetizers. They did not disappoint. For dessert we ordered the warm banana pudding and it was off the chain delicious! We will definitely go here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crabcake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribeye steak
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Warm banana pudding

Dd5Ldl3J6787DkUQErRSbw.text: You absolutely can't go wrong with anything here. Great Happy Hour and weekday specials.   The steak, the wine, the desert it is all fabulous.

X9RZruhQoU3sfMr0QDx-PQ.text: This place is great! One of the best steaks in town. We go here every Christmas Eve and they always deliver. The service is on point and the food is always cooked to perfection. After saying all of this I must add one small complaint.. I arrived a little earlier than the rest of my party this year and ordered a sweet tea at the bar for the wait. The bartender handed me the tea and then told me it was $4.32!! Haha!! I quickly asked if there was alcohol in it, which there was not. I paid the man under the impression that I was about to have a glass of perfection, the nectar of the gods, at the very least the best damn sweet tea known to man!! Sadly it wasn't even homemade. Hopefully they can fix this little hiccup. I figure when they know you are about to spend a lot on dinner they can swing the price of a fountain drink.  Now to end on a positive note I would recommend this place to everyone who is looking for fantastic food and a great dining experience.

lsq2swM0yQ8L3SdfjPFbiw.text: It's gotta be special to be 5 stars and Del Frisco's delivered.  Bar atmosphere is great, down to earth and had our first manager "stop-by" here.  After explaining what I do and how I supply companies like his with information about their social media performance, he was all over me.  Sent up another manager, the Wine Sommelier and revisited our table one last time for good measure.    Steak was delicious, as was the spinach.  Had a delicious bottle of wine and enjoyed our meal thoroughly.  It was expensive as all hell, and don't expect to spend less than a $150 if you're drinking (our bill was considerably more than that).  If the manager does swing by your table and you get to chat, ask him to show you their private wine cellar in the basement.  Millions to put this bad boy in, and it's nice!  a very ooh lah lah moment, especially if you're on a date!

9mdJHPewYTGc_rDtKsOIOw.text: I saved my 100th review for del Frisco's for a reason! This place is so special to me and my husband. Our first experience was at the DF in NYC and we haven't been able to stop since then. When we moved to Charlotte, we were beyond thrilled when we found out there was a DF here. We weren't sure if it would live up to our expectations. NYC was beautiful and grand and the food was fantastic, as usual. We had a completely different experience at the DF in Las Vegas. Don't get me wrong, the food was great, but the restaurant itself was seriously lacking the DF grandeur with it's low tiled ceiling and lack of windows. Then came Charlotte and we were not disappointed! It's just like the one in NYC, but facing Fairview and Piedmont Row instead of 6th Ave.  We've been to this location a lot and the service here is excellent. The hostess are always really friendly and accommodating. We normally get there before our reservation to start out the bar for a cocktail then head to our table once it's ready. Again, the service is excellent. When we were here during our Charlotte scouting trip, our service went above and beyond to sing praises of Charlotte and even wrote out a list of things we should check out once we moved to Charlotte. Very sweet. As usual, he food is delicious. The wine list is extensive and impressive. I always find something that I like. We usually start out with the crab cake appetizer or we each get salads. The crab cake is one of the best I've ever had and my favorite salad is the Del's Salad. Our entrees always vary. Sometimes steak, sometimes fish, sometimes I'll even have the crab cakes again for my entree (they're that good). We'll normally order two sides - a carb and a vegetable. One thing I really really wish they had was the cauliflower gratin that, I think, they only serve at the DF in NYC. No matter what, we save room for lemon cake for dessert. Even if it means we take a slice to go. We've been known to even have a slice at the restaurant and have one to go for the following day. Neither one of us are huge lemon flavored dessert fans, but this cake has us singing a different tune.   This restaurant is one of our favorites and I'm so glad we have one in the city in which we now live!

yBeK15ueQ4l_FKRFWSHtZA.text: We came to the restaurant for my birthday.  We had a super waitress.  Not too pushy but very attentive.  The steaks were seasoned to perfection and the side dishes were great.  We saved room for dessert- totally yummy. This is one of my favorite restaurants for a special occasion.

waaKYSFb56lya3Yqygbg8g.text: Unfortunately the service I received was poor at best.    The wine steward was too busy to help us, a 96 dollar lobster had to be returned because it wasn't fully cooked am went back tongue table tough. No followed up to see if the lobster was better, the manager never stopped by.   I wanted to like the restaurant however I can't.    Very disappointed.   My bill for 2 people was 280.00.  I expected better

auXNKnc9zriPVk-6wokyzw.text: "The service was rushed. They interrupted us constantly to rush us through the meal. The team didn't talk to each other so they didn't bring the food out in the right order. Then they stopped coming by at all and we had to ask for more water and to order more drinks. I had called for a special table. They put us by the kitchen and then said they couldn't move us. We got to listen to the waitstaff yell back and forth at each other. I called the next day. Spoke to a manager who said her colleague would call me back. No call. The atmosphere is like Cheesecake Factory, not of a restaurant where we spent $400 for 2 to have dinner. Spend your money elsewhere. It's not worth it."

jmgGKQzEQX8dotRpfILT6A.text: As a newcomer to the area, Del Frisco's was recommended by work colleagues. I took friends visiting from Denver and the food and service were both outstanding. I returned with visiting family two weeks later and the staff and kitchen delivered again.

XZKLHT6jl1mW2HaagY0bfA.text: Date night with flair !  Enjoyed a fabulously seasoned and prepared filet with garlic mashed and asparagus. Not even a crumb left. Even the cheesecake was some of the best I've had.Best wine selection this side of Pluto !  Dined in the wine cellar, which I didn't even know existed (tucked away with an escalator in the corner) Was very quiet, and intimate as there are only about ten tables downstairs. The wine cellar wraps around three walls of the entire room, and private restrooms downstairs as well. Also much quieter than the main large upstairs open dining room with a large bar and  nice view (huge floor to ceiling windows) of the Piedmont Row neighborhood adjacent to Southpark Mall (great shopping) and a mezzanine level with bar also I believe (was crowded on a Friday evening) Recommend reservations or there will be a significant wait(thus the large bars...lol)   Valet parking available, but huge parking deck across the driveway always has ample spaces available. There is usually a celeb or two in the house, so, dress to impress...   In summary, food , wine , ambiance and service spectacular !  Pricey, but you get what you pay for these days.. Bon Appetit !  PS: Got a Thank You card from the waiter a few days later.. That's a first !       Do you think the sixty dollar tip was too much ?          Woooooooo

mORfuVGG9DHSj9de2kr32w.text: Delicious food and a very long wine list. I had the blackberry bourbon drink and it was delicious, much like a mint julep. Staff was very friendly and knowledgable. Beautiful view from the second floor.

u79NgTajjPUGhbK4Q0_npA.text: Went on a Sunday during restaurant week. Delicious steak, ordered lobster Mac and cheese which was so so so good. It's creamy, gooey, rich and delicious. Service was a tag team effort, which was fine everything was prompt and professional but lacked the friendliness that you get from conversing with a sever throughout the night

DrmmzaCYb2YYhcob7K2lzg.text: Del fiscos is our to go to Friday night dinner date spot in Charlotte. We sit in the bar and take advantage of the half price wine selections and great bar menu. The steak and cheese egg rolls and skillet chips are out of this world. The best deal on the bar menu is the burger which is made from their ground filets and during happy hour (until 7) it is only $8 you can't go wrong.

LKfOMMXRPdFvFJCYquhvIw.text: Beautiful place!!!  The building is impressive, service too.  Rich uncle took me and the family, he frequents the place.  We were there on a Tuesday evening and it's clearly a business kinda place.  While all the tables were filled , we were 1 of a few 'families' out to dine.  80% were clearly people on business.  I had the filet trio - It was presented quite well.  The veggies were all served on  plates alone and set in the middle , family style dining - we liked that very much.  I was most impressed with the temp. of the food, I am quite particular about my food ( and plate if I can get it) being hot as possible when served.  I suppose all 6 people are brought their plates at the exact same time by a 'team' , it helps ; ) ............. I am always impressed by that performance the few times I've been fortunate enough to receive it. ; )    The toppings of my trio were ALL expertly prepared, shrimp, foie gras, and the reduction.  The actual meat was not my favorite part of the meal.  It was good, chewy ( not tough at all) , but chewy. It was not the aged beef taste I expected from such an expensive restaurant.  BUT - I am far from an expert on red meat as I eat it on rare occasions.  While being a $$$$ place it was quite relaxed atmosphere and  service, you don't feel like you should whisper and keep your napkin folded perfectly in your lap at all times.  great dining experience - would definitely return but only when that 'rich uncle' treats.

LHbeDsO7ylTFgOvwgD3xZA.text: Excellent service. We went in and it was slam packed & backed up w reservations. The manager squeezed in a table for us upstairs. So many servers & managers came to check on us. It felt like we were the only 2 people in the restaurant. I got the seafood tower platter for 2 & BF got steak. Delicious! $$ but you know that going in. Not a better spot in Charlotte for sure.

Dr9LAagXGWB0pxYc5G1DCQ.text: A disappointment.  Maybe they're too big.  For the money you should go to Capital Grill or Ruth's Chris.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Restaurant week

3L3DHuae3vBFsAvLMxsc_A.text: My husband & I have visited twice for a reason. The food is really great and we enjoy the atmosphere. I've had the scallops & a filet. The scallops were cooked perfectly, topped with minced ginger which got to be a bit much after a while, even though I love ginger. The filet was also wonderful. No frills & I love that. Their bread pudding is outstanding, I love it so much.

iTdRZI9Hppbl4fW_qNOM8A.text: Last night I had the best experience I've ever had at ANY restaurant.  The night before I had called around to different places trying to find a restaurant that provided birthday menus to do something special for my boyfriend.  I called Del Frisco's to make a reservation and spoke with Charlie, who was so pleasant on the phone!  I asked about the birthday menu and she let me know that they wouldn't be able to create one but they could give him a birthday card and a complimentary dessert.  She told me to call in the morning to see if they could maybe make an exception.  I asked her if she could put the birthday card on the table before we arrived and she said sure.  The night of our dining experience, I called to push the reservation back half an hour because I was running late and they made the change with no problem.  When I arrived to the restaurant, I was greeted by the two ladies at the front desk, and I asked if one of them were Charlie, the young lady told me Charlie had gone to place the card on our table. **all smiles**  They seat us and a gentleman poured our water and said our server would be out.  We didn't wait long before Kristin came to greet us and take our drink orders.  Our drinks came back in less than 5 minutes which made me immediately feel good about the service we would receive.  Now, it was hardly busy in there on a Tuesday night, but I've been to small, inexpensive chain restaurants that have been dead and waited 10-15 minutes for a server and another 10-20 minutes for my drink.  Kristin came back, helped us decide on what we wanted to order.  She brought the bread out, our appetizer came, and the food shortly after... She checked on us throughout dinner... Everything was great.  We ordered the marinated shrimp appetizer, I had the crab cakes and brussel sprouts, and he had the lamb chops and spinach, our food was delicious!!!!  We were at the table taking a selfie when a server walked by and offered to take our picture which I thought was nice. Kristin came back out with the complimentary dessert and took a few more pictures of us... and when we were leaving Charlie told us goodbye, remembering our names... All in all, I had a great experience from the time I called until the time I left and I would like to thank everyone I came in contact with that evening.  They definitely helped make my boyfriend's birthday special.  Special thanks to Charlie and Kristin!!!

LwUbh7RwOnz4wfOeNSFr_Q.text: While visiting Charlotte tonight I heard rave reviews about Del Frisco's. I made a reservation for 10:00 on opentable. We arrive at a less than busy room. While being seating at a table that looked like it had just been eaten at with a wrinkled dirty table cloth and candle not lit. I asked we be seated at a table that was clean and set up. The hostess said to stay where we were and she would ask the waiter but it shouldn't be a problem. My wife leaves to use the restroom, upon her return I am still waiting to see someone. No help, no water, no nothing. Finally a gentleman arrives to help, after conversation he leaves to get the hostess back who seated us and she now moves us. Now, after a new table we are waiting nearly another 10 minutes before getting up and walking out without seeing a sole. This isn't the service I was looking for from a del Frisco's.

jg9V4JiJgtg0AfNq2nr2nQ.text: Awesome food...Awesome service..definitely returning to see my man Bobby...he took good care of us!

NPk3Kl7CTOp1p76RwHYgWw.text: Ok tonight I was invited back to Del Frisco's for dinner and it was wonderful . The Service was Great from Pam and the food was delicious and we were treated so nicely.  It truly can be a wonderful experience but I feel that the staff and their professional manner is very important .  I retract my prior feel for Del Frisco's and I will dine there again but unless I'm invited to a private party they will never get me to the basement again I give this restaurant-excellent tonight  . Thanks Pam for making our evening a great one.

ZNNS7ld3R_dluvM1Vn1ljA.text: Great steak house w good service and a variety menu f food.  Great place to entertain clients.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Besides the steak there r great desserts. We had butter cake, lemon cake, and cheese cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the bacon appetizer. Getting to sample a wide variety of appetizers w a large group. Highly recommend

QXtbuks4Wf-xGvsPzMhcrg.text: Hands down the best steak I've had in my life. It was so amazing I won't try to describe it, I'll let you experience it yourself. The server Chris was super friendly and the seating in the basement section was beautiful. The brussel sprouts, mushrooms, and onions and complimented the filet mignon perfectly. I have to mention that the oysters came with a vinegarette that had fresh ground peppercorns and that was a first for me which I will ask other places to do in the future. Thank you Chris and other staff. Bravo Zulu!

Joc09SJ4riG8EqnhT8xcDA.text: Either DF has plummeted in the customer service department or all the staff were just having a really bad night.  A friend and I went last night for cocktails.  As we walked in, I asked the hostess if the tables in the bar area were open for seating and she said absolutely.  So, we sat ourselves and then proceeded to wait for about 10 minutes.  Wait staff and the hostess walked by us multiple times with no attention given whatsoever to our presence.  I was prepared to leave, but my friend said we should move over to the bar itself.  So, we did.  As we tried to make eye contact with either of the 2 bartenders, they waited on patrons on both sides of us with no attention given whatsoever to our presence.  OMG.  After a few long minutes, I said, "Excuse me," as the female bartender walked by.  She glanced back and said, "I'll be with you in a moment," and kept on moving.  The male bartender returned a minute later and asked what we wanted.  We noticed a male patron walk in, sit down at the bar, await service for 5-10 minutes, never received any acknowledgement, and then walked out and left.  We finally received drinks and an appetizer, but the experience was less than stellar.  We won't be back.

9TiklgYIUBJWWr9YqzTiPA.text: There for Restaurant Week.  Filet was served room temp, steaks should arrive sizzling hot.  Potatoes were. Excellent.  Service was sub par.  Waitress  did not pick up dirty plates until we asked(she walked by a lot but never offered).  The couple across from us were drunk, loud and demanding.  They yelled at a manager who came over and got them whatever they were in need of.  He should have asked them to leave.  Before they left on their own they spilled a glass of red wine on the white tablecloth.    For the upscale pricey restaurant that it is, I expected more.

bP1JiArSvkFGkqlXaCGsRA.text: Let me start by saying we went here because of the movie with Sully who landed the plane in the Hudson River. We went during restaurant week and I don't know if that's why our service was so bad or if it was because our server, (a black man), didn't like the fact that I'm white and my wife is black. He had an attitude and was not attentive at all our other sever, yes we had 2 servers was much better. She at least checked on us one smiled and was friendly. But service was slow, not very attentive and we were packed in to where we had no privacy. Food was ok not the best we've had. Maybe if we go not during restaurant week it would be better. It shouldn't matter though that is there chance to shine and gain new customers however they lost us.

KJYcw64xmG2brN_OkEOiHA.text: Once again this restaurant far exceeded my expectations.  I went with a friend on a Friday night which happened to be the first night of Restaurant Week. When we arrived, there was quite a long line to check in with the hostess. The line went quickly, and the hostess was very friendly and welcoming. We were seated within 5 minutes. The dining room is a mix of regular tables and booths. Our table was a round booth in the corner, very intimate. Our waiter was knowledgeable and professional - top-notch.  Food wise, the meal was fantastic. We decided to order from the Restaurant Week menu. We started with a salad, followed by the filet and mashed potatoes. Our waiter defined the doneness of the meat when I ordered it and ask me to verify the grill work by slicing into the steaks once they were brought to the table. The tender filet was spot-on medium rare...perfection. The mashed potatoes were buttery and melted in my mouth. For dessert I got the chocolate mousse. A satisfying end to the meal. It was creamy and smooth.  I look forward to my next dining experience at Del Frisco's.

0HOijdeGFlme3hIcMOOtJQ.text: I've heard wonders about Del Frisco's, but regretfully ignored the hype. I assumed Del Frisco's would mimic other chain restaurants as far as replicated food and mediocre service with a luxury price tag. Boy was I wrong (minus the price tag)!   A group of about 12 of us came to Del Frisco's for a friend's birthday dinner. We were politely greeted by the hostess and led to our table. There was a personal birthday card on the table from the Del Frisco family. It was a little, but very sweet gesture! I ordered steak (of course), rare. Best steak I've ever had the pleasure of encountering.. Hands down! Who knew this is how steak is supposed to taste?! Sides? The corn, the potatoes and spinach = all amazing! Again, how do you make these simple veggies so devine? The meal only made me wish I could frequent Del Frisco more often. The price tag is definitely worth every penny, but boy is it a luxurious one! Will be back soon DF!

YhDZieoOXLdsA8wt0PPT8A.text: Went for my birthday celebration and overall everything was good. Service was "ok".... our appetizer came before our first drink arrived... even though our drink order was taken 10-15 mins before we ordered our appetizer.....then I didn't have a napkin or silverware and had to ask twice. The food however was excellent..... Crab Cake appetizer was great (if not a little small) packed full lump crab meat,   12oz Filet (Pittsburgh style) for entree was delicious as were the sides. All in all a good experience, though probably wouldn't return anytime

aRS5Vxv2oNeO3QzbhhILTQ.text: Look, we had a really nice time celebrating a landmark birthday. The ambience is great, service abundant and attentive (though the head waiter somewhat mocking the gift we got my mom was overly familiar and unprofessional). But the food is just ok. My steak was very salty, and for that price it really needs to be perfect. The sides were all fine but most of the flavor seemed to derive from an overdose of butter. The whole vibe kind of sweeps you up and envelops you in the swirl. It's fun and intoxicating. It may be that the food being of the utmost highest quality isn't entirely the point. But it should be.

1ujyjgw0bdMGtoNcUbmD5Q.text: Went here for our friends anniversary. The parking is pretty convenient. They have valet or you can self park. We had a reservation and we were seated immediately. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly. He gave us the run down on the special courses not in the menu. He handed us each our menus individually. He then helped us make an excellent wine selection and informed us of the by the glass deal on Friday nights, wines by the glass were half off! When we ordered our tomahawk steak, my husband and I informed him that we had intentions of sharing and that we liked our steaks medium. He stated that there medium is red and we might consider going medium well. And he was right! Medium well was a perfect pink all the way through and unlike most steakhouses, it was seasoned perfectly. We never once had to ask for anything. The break was amazing and hot also served with hot butter. For sides we ordered Brussel sprouts and lobster Mac and cheese. The Brussels were prepared with bacon and grilled perfectly. The lobster Mac and cheese was rich and the lobster was fresh. Every time I took a sip of my water, someone walked by and refilled it.  From the atmosphere, to the service, to the food, there was nothing lacking.  Lastly we informed the restaurant when making a reservation that we were celebrating an anniversary. Our waiter brought out complimentary dessert. Not just one thing, but a chocolate mousse, butter cake and vanilla ice cream with four plates and four spoons, enough for all of us to share. It was an awesome experience and you will not be disappointed when looking for a nice dinner or to celebrate.

X5tFfhVs1sXlTUoKscnOfQ.text: This was supposed to be a special dinner for my wife and I's 30th anniversary dinner. I asked for a table that would be quiet so we could talk and spend this time together. We arrived early and had a drink the bar with Michael the bartender. The drinks where excellent and the service was good.   We decided to go to our table and this is where it went down hill. We went to the hostess stand and we where greeted with hey GUYS. They then showed us our table right on a main walk way. I was shocked as I asked for a quite table. The waiter seemed to rush us thru the entire dinner and we had to wait for senecal items.  We always go to Capital Grill for special events and I decided to try something different. I will go back to a place where they always have treated us special on our holidays.

NCH6156oSrs9g8vfuikiKA.text: Outstanding dinner and service.  By far one of the best meals in town.  It is pricey but worth every penny.  Had the crab cakes and the desserts are to die for. - try the lemon cake or the butter cake.

fGvEX2LhAu0_6c_1y1_35g.text: This place was sooooooo GOOD! Pricy yes! But we went during restaurant week. I had the crab cakes. AND WAS SOOO SOO GOOD! They only have unsweetened tea but they will bring you sugar. And I had to get hot tea because it was SOO COLD, I like cold but had a hard enjoying myself because it was too cold! I almost felt as if they had it that cold so people could hurry up eat and leave due to restaurant week and they was busy ....WELL IT WORKED!!! I did not even eat my dessert there because I was just soooo ready to go and warm up! So bring a jacket with you. The waiter was really nice!

sPrr0oVT8TuV74Tvs7Spvg.text: I was in Del Friscos about 3 weeks ago with my date visiting North Carolina. We heard great things about this place so we couldn't wait to enjoy dinner here. It started out a good night the drinks (some pineapple cocktail) was awesome and we ordered apps they were ok. We ordered dinner as a couple came in and sat next to us they were clearly regulars with the attention they were being shown even a manager came over and talked to the couple next to us. We sat there and sat there and finally asked the bartender about our order (we dined at the bar) she said it was up next. After the couple next to us who came in over 30 mins after us was half way through their meal, We asked the waitress 2 more times and she says "oh they got there food first because you guys wanted your steaks medium well.... "are you serious? After waiting an hour after appetizers for our food my date asked to speak to the manager. The manager who I guess was briefed comes right over and says oh guys some how the kitchen forgot about you I'll comp you for an appetizer.... APPETIZER after we sat there 2 hours almost. How the hell did the kitchen FORGET our order???   So we sat there watching everyone around us eating for another 15 mins when finally our pricey steaks come out. We both cut into the steaks and BOTH of them were raw on the inside not how we ordered it at all. The bartender looks at me and said "you look pissed you ok?" No I'm not ok!  I've never been treated like this at an establishment before. Where everyone just forgets you exists when you're literally in their faces. Not a lot of people happen to look like us when I looked around either so it made me feel like this was done on purpose. We paid the bill and left extremely disappointed. This could have been handled so much better and it might of been with different people who knows. We travel Often and dine in amazing restaurants so this was shocking to me. I will not return.

BzAaoW-7eWRJGa9NMAvhyg.text: I was just there and totally enjoyed my experience once again. It is always a treat going here. The food is impeccable as usual.

vUbmwO0fli9eC7vMAk46cw.text: Our sever Thomas was awesome. But what was best, was our awesome female sommelier Nicole!!she was absolutely knowledgeable and beautiful l!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

POEtbm4Tc5glSAw3EQHQYQ.text: Loved this place, I loved the food, the service, and free valet parking. We have only been twice, but we plan to keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Celebrating
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Their stake and mashed potatoes
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious strawberry cheesecake

eBFJIO3rg2rbc44AESAWHg.text: Always a pleasure dining here! The service can't be beat & the food is delicious. We've dined here numerous times & I hosted a birthday party for my husband in the wine cellar downstairs.  The quality of the food is always consistent (if not they'll surely make it up to you).   My husbands fav is the bone in rib-eye. I'm actually not a big steak fan so I always order the crabcakes. They're delicious!    For dessert their banana bread pudding is the best in the city.  We also like to hang out at the bar. For a casual dining experience or something quick check out their bar menu. The portions are generous & very reasonable compared to the main dining room menu. The sliders & fish tacos are really good!

mi1bQpoovyh0uJWrKkt4Eg.text: Food is great, service is good, atmosphere is good. But it is a tad too pricy for what you get in my opinion. Worth a visit though when you feel like splurging.

2qOynrtjXtM1M5HyHTeAuw.text: This is absolutely awesome - we went during Restaurant Week and can't say enough good things about this place.  The service is amazing, the food is even better, and it is by far the best steak you can find in Charlotte - just outstanding.

io_ma4rvCONg3eBZmWzibA.text: Probably the best start-to-finish experience I've had in Charlotte.    First off, our server was great.  She was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  She had the perfect presence, was on top of everything we needed all night without being over bearing.  The food was also fantastic.  We had a crab cake appetizer that was amazing.  The steaks were cooked perfectly and the baked potato I had was also probably one of the best I've had in a restaurant.     Their wine list is also very large and overwhelming.  However I would comfortably trust their staff to pick one out for you based on your tastes.  Overall it was a great experience, you really can't go wrong here.

YUMM2nGcxsz7CTs-U6HXkw.text: Service, timing and most importantly the food was great.  I ordered the filet and it was cooked perfectly the way i like it.  The asparagus and potatoes au grautin were awesome.  A must if you dine out regularly!

3FdRKVo5RbrejUUTnsbmMQ.text: A while ago, I had been to a few other Del Frisco's around the country, but this go around stands out in my mind.  Before I had never thought of Del Friscos as being better than any other upscale steakhouse, but this time I had pretty much the best filet.  It was perfectly charred and the medium rare, was actually medium rare.  Even the asparagus was perfect, not a single one being mushy.    I was slightly disappointed by the upcharge for the wine.. our bottle of the Frog's Leap cab was $100.. yea exactly.  Thankfully the staff was nice enough to deal with our slightly rowdy and inappropriately dressed table.  They overlooked the fact that I was wearing shorts (I had no idea we were going here.. thus the lack of appropriate dress).  I never thought I'd do this, but 5 stars for the best filet I've had in recent memory.

yvdHYXAZNw7SOB3aV-mOGw.text: This is one of the best steakhouses I have been to!  Not until halfway through did the waiter tell us this was owned by Sullivan's which is also one of my favorite steak houses. Our table shared the ahi tuna, a salad and lobster mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was the BEST I have ever had!  We also shared the filet and crab cakes.  Steak cut like butter and the crab cakes might have been close to the best too which is a strong statement seeing how I live close to MD. Our third party had chicken which I didn't taste and the broccolini (this is what happens when you bring a health nut to a steak house)  but he enjoyed both.  No room for dessert!  I am happy they have a location in Philly!

MTAqTD_j8U3NwkmhFt-igw.text: Oh how I love Del Frisco's! I come here every Charlotte Restaurant Week and for special occasions. The food here is delicious, never overcooked and always fresh! My favorite entree is the beef medallions and my favorite appetizer is the turtle soup. I would recommend this place to anyone. It is expensive, but worth it!

S4B8r0KRLN4_7kg0B0wWeQ.text: This is the best Steak house I've been to in Charlotte. Excellent food, amazing wine list, and great service.

MaAQfSn8BzJ7-lwksxye8g.text: Of course it's high priced but you expect that going in and you get what you pay for... The food and service are amazing ..   The only reason for my 4 stars is due to their Mothers Day brunch .. I don't think they have the brunch thing down too well.. We had to send my fiance's steak back as it was under cooked a little but they left the rest of his food on the table to get cold and he kind of wanted to eat it all together. For dessert I ordered the Bananas Foster French Toast which would have been amazing if it was not cold when they brought it out. I think it had sat in the window a while. The Bloody Mary bar was amazing and the service and staff were great as always .. I had an incredible birthday dinner there with oysters, steak and wines and was very impressed.. Just a little disappointed with the brunch as I expect a little more when I go out to spend some money ... We will be back though (:

pTdBNZVexWYSOB5TcdCqDg.text: A little pricey BUT the food was great and the service was outstanding. Our steak entrees were delicious  and we loved the calamari and the lobster Mac and cheese.

N_TaUj1mPuLo378AxsdqnQ.text: Every year we celebrate joint birthdays with our best friends at a SPECIAL restaurant. Over the years, we have always enjoyed our dining  experiences- that is until we went to Del Frisco this year. My friend and I always order a rib eye or NY strip. Every so often, we'll have prime rib. Our wives invariably order lobster, etc. This evening, the waitress convicted us to order their special 12oz. Rib eye and crab cake including veggies and dessert. We thought it strange when she told us we could get the promotion for only $99 per couple. We questioned her about the quality of the meat and amount of filler in the crab cakes. She assured our every skepticism, so we agreed to the special. The steak was thin and so over seasoned that my wife, who never complains, called for the waitress. An assistant manager came over and was very apologetic, replaced her steak, and sent over the manager. When we questioned him about the steak quality, he began to explain about butchering. Since we weren't interested in his explanation, he  comped the meal. We thought that was the right thing to do under the circumstances.  When I go to a highly touted Restaurant, the last thing I was is to be comped because the steak is not top quality. It is an admission of their failure to live up to the billing.

xKR-BoyKhXl4HEcsG_-kPw.text: The food was wonderful, but there is nothIng worse than going out for dinner to have a good time and end up having to deal with horrible and rude service. During Restaurant Week we decided to try a new restaurant and I am glad we did Del Frisco's because their steak was delicious. Unfortunately, our waiter was horrible!! My friend ordered some extra bread for the table and the rude waiter came and placed it right in front of her in a rude way without even saying a word and walking away. Why place it right in front of her as if she was going to eat it all. She just ordered it for everyone? Is everyone going to get a loaf of bread chubbed in our face too? Everyone in the table felt offended by his attitude and made it very unconfortable. He never came to check on us and we had to keep asking other waiters to fill up our cups. He was rude and made our dinner experience not enjoyable at all! He made us not want to come back on a regular day to pay regular price and get BAD SERVICE!!!

zOdE5e4DGfJ60Xn8C4ghqg.text: Enjoyed a special night out at Del Friscos tonight; wonderful dinner! They are offering a special price fix menu until 9/5 that is absolutely amazing!!! For 49.95 per person, you get a full size Del's salad (huge portion, house made dressing and bacon), an 8 oz filet with crab cake, a choice of side, and a full size dessert. ( cheesecake, chocolate mousse or bread pudding). There is absolutely no way you can find better value at a restaurant in Charlotte...the food quality is exceptional and the portions are significant...seriously, two people could share one meal and be full. For those curious about this restaurant, but apprehensive about the price, go try this special....best deal in town by far. I will definitely be back!

TJIRCfD9LHTBIlI0uPMjPA.text: Awsome place, great vibe and very attentive staff. The lower bar area can get a little crowded and can be a wonderful place to mingle but if your looking for a little more room the upsatirs bar is the place to go.  Dinner can be quite expensive but also well worth it. Great selection of steaks and sides. They also have nightly specials that have never let us down.   By far the best deal at Del Frisco's is the bar menu where everything is $7 from 4:30pm-7:00pm. I suggest the burger and popcorn shrimp with a couple drinks and you can walk out for about $30 after a great time.

NZ2329oDYBml2uNw3_PEEA.text: If you want a good meal and king-like service, eat here.

SuXwyA0AaO6zbj0oIa3sWQ.text: Great food (filet), but service was a little off the mark. Had a somewhat confusing team of servers that dropped the ball on some little things. But I'm comparing the service against their previous high standard.

NWqHmu0yTy2RJh6trWqTXw.text: Best steak place in Charlotte, hands down.. service is excellent. .. can be pricey.. Try the VIP drink and the Long bone steak.

Jbs7QM5gmDCL0qsOqmbVHg.text: Had an unbelievable meal last night. Fantastic personal service, steaks special (one with blue cheese, one with crab and hollandaise, one with mushroom teriyaki sauce) was amazing, the Del salad is phenomenal and the au gratin potato's were do die for.  it was all great. Top shelf dining for sure and the bartenders were attentive and great.  Yes it's expensive but somebody's got to fuel this economy!!

EZYDZAddiHrSi4VQOqnF3A.text: This place never seems to miss a beat. I know it a chain and all, but I have never felt it here. The decor is perfect and beautiful, food is excellent and Rick (manager) goes out of his way to make it a great experience. The service Is top notch and they have a wine deal on Fridays that is hard to beat. I have been meaning to write one up for them for a while, but better late than never. I never regret money spent here and be sure to get the lemon cake to take with you. It makes getting up early the next day quite worth it!

zV3wFltf8jxPtEgVjfPppw.text: I love eating dinner here on Sunday nights. The service is incredible. The food is delicious. I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. The steaks are amazing. The best Ceasar salad I've ever had. The cheesecake is so light fluffy.  I suggest eating on the first floor or up top. On Valentine's Day, we tried the bottom floor seating, I guess you would call it the Wine Cellar area. It was crowded and noisy. You get a more romantic feel if you go upstairs. The scenery is especially nice with the large windows.

30or7E_L173L_mS4I0y3Lw.text: This place was amazing! I can't wait to go back. Normally when I get a steak well done it's super dry & chewy but I got my prime ribeye well done & it was perfect! Also, the lobster mac & cheese was delicious. The sides are family style so they can feed up to 2 to 3 people. It's definitely pricey but when you try the food it'll be worth it. Our server Megan was super helpful & friendly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Prime ribeye, lobster Mac &amp; cheese, &amp; mashed potatoes!

dmpb3gJcHweLUYpBOgv7wQ.text: I started my night very reluctant about going to a steak house. My wife and I sat at the red light trying to decide between Del Frisco's and Ruth's Chris. We decided on Frisco's. I absolutely loved the atmosphere and our server was very inviting and helpful on making a decision on our meal. Our service was excellent. Our food was excellent, and it capped off a great weekend getaway. If you have a chance and willing to treat yourself please put this on your list.

it1Y_ZZq8JbUqURdKF433g.text: Based on later dining experiences I have to rate this place a 1 Star. This is the only restaurant I've been to that gives your food to the others at the table without asking

OCTwuWk6vn0XZjLqCVk5kA.text: As usual, Del Frisco's delivers.  I regularly eat at the ones in NYC and Boston.  The one in Charlotte is every bit as good, if not better, actually.  The decor and layout definitely beats the one in Boston.  No need to get into the menu as it's pretty standard and alike the other locations.  However, I do highly recommend you have the Thick Cut Bacon Au Poivre.  Holy cow, this is one of the best bacon dishes I have ever had in my life, no joke.  Service here is phenomenal, us usual.  All the stars were aligned.  Just one tiny thing bothered me and made me take away one star: it was my father's birthday celebration dinner.  They were really kind and gave my Dad a greeting card signed by a number of staff.  However, they did not sing him happy birthday or offer any birthday desert.  We saw another table that night get sung happy birthday to and offered a small desert.  I found this very bizarre, and I was somewhat disappointed, because Del Frisco's usually doesn't make slip ups like that.  Oh well.  So if you are there for a birthday, make sure you remind them to do what should be done for a birthday :-)

9Y0K5INZuqprCNTP1_zpmw.text: Went there last night. For a Resteraunt of this so called caliber service was fair, food was fair, and the "ambiance was " horrible ". You would think this place and the prices they charge would have a dress code. We sat upstairs I and thought we were at the chicken ranch. There was a couple of woman who were so scantily dressed it was embarrassing. All they did was take selfies of themselves with flashes all during dinner. The management should have asked them to stop. If your going to charge prices you charge you should be more responsible and considerate to your patrons.

pOHMIeR7NbczWRbxU8l-bA.text: Well, we had a party of seven  very slow to get drinks!  Thanks to the bar where we got our first round. Service was very slow. But drinks and apps were delicious and apps came out fast. About 45 min after the apps were finished our steaks came out. Finally???? Cam you say,"salt!!  OMG. This was the saltiest piece of meat ever.   Every steak at our table was loaded with  SALT! When I said that to my table, everyone agreed!   Not pleased but taking it hone and I will fix it!  No $1000 tab and the salty ruined the entire night!

3_LWI8ijpaU8zuMRnbbRrA.text: Best steakhouse ever!!!! I've been here a couple of times and the service is exceptional the food is as well I love the calamari and the Philly cheesesteak egg rolls the salmon is very good and of course the steak

vGhouP7MvxM5GDGX0yBWLw.text: Do not go to Del Frisco's on the weekend during Queen's Feast or Restaurant Week. John Miller over books the restaurant so you will not get your reservation time, the hostess station area at the front of the restaurant will be slammed and the food quality will suffer as a result of too many people. We dined on Saturday evening (1/20) and the restaurant was way too busy to enjoy your meal. We had to wait 30-45 minutes after our reservation time to be seated. The bar was slammed and the waiting are is non-existent so we waited among a crowd of people at the front. We ordered off the regular menu and were disappointed in our meals. The kitchen is simply to busy. I have eaten here over 10 times and it is completely different restaurant on a normal Saturday. Again if you want a nice steak dinner avoid during Queen's Feast.

W0kWjGPIKMLwnID1v26EsQ.text: Tiffany is the absolute best server ever. She went above and beyond for incredible customer service. We love her!   Pax also is the man- he is so knowledgable, friendly and efficient!! Wonderful experience every time.

wJk2XPeVrizArVSF3GyBMA.text: Went to celebrate a birthday so we were perhaps setting expectations too high.  One person in our group had dined before and thought it was good.  I had the 8 oz filet and it was too peppery.  The prime rib cut was very tough and had the marbling that was actually too tough, even difficult to cut thru.  The scallops were good but my with started to get a bit overwhelmed with the sweetness in the mushrooms that had too much Asian teriyaki sweetness.

102Ic382akYZcjiiIWFbvQ.text: One of the better steakhouses in Charlotte! Great for business dinners or a fancy night out.   Start out with their VIP cocktail (Vodka infused Pineapple). I ask for it in an old fashioned glass because let's face it, it's a girly drink everyone can enjoy...just not in a martini glass. The appetizers and salads are solid, I'm a blue cheese wedge fan.   While the other protein in this place is ok (fish, chicken, seafood...) you are here for the steaks... and they are good. Every time I've come here they have been well prepared! The stakes are a little on the expensive side, but not astronomical.   What you save on the steaks they will take on the wine. They have a very impressive wine list, with a very impressive price tag. Finding something decent less than $80 takes a little bit of effort. The sides are not to be forgotten. I particularly like the lobster mac&cheese, mushrooms and spinach. The service in this place of above average, good wait staff.   Overall, solid choice any day of the week... or everyday of the week depending on your budget.

28hocW9UgEil3f9bahuoAg.text: We went to Del Frisco's for 2 reasons. 1. Queens Feast (their menu selection). 2. Our daughter's birthday.   Due to the promotion I couldn't place a favorable reservation for over a week. Upon arrival I still had to wait an additional 15 mins past my reservation time to be seated. I found this very annoying.   We already knew what we wanted to sample from the menu (which is why we chose DF); however, it took extra long for the each course of the meal to be brought to the table. I also noticed that all the surrounding tables were on the same time frame as us (think of cruise ship dining).   We were highly disappointed with our meal. None of our steaks were cooked appropriately. From the long wait we didn't want to send them back.  The food runner did suggest that since our plates were 500 degrees that if we cut our steaks and place them face down on the plate they will continue to cook to our desired temperature.   Needless to say, after finishing this meal, I came to the conclusion that - I'm glad I didn't pay full price for this meal. It was on par to Outback IMO. Second, I'm glad my parents decided not to join us for their first experience to DF.  Third, my last meal there was my best and DF made MY b day special and since they didn't even acknowledge my daughters b day though mentioned in the reservation, I doubt highly I will be going back in the near future.   Lastly, I feel that Queens Feast is a time for local Charlotte restaurants to shine. Not feed the herd like cruise ships. Also, they should make the same impression as they would on during a full price meal so that the patron will come back and spend the money for your meal and price point.  Every experience should count.

cOolE3BuMZ71i6Tue-f94w.text: This is my first negative Yelp review. I brought my parents here for my mom's birthday...big regret. We've recently been sampling high end steak houses in the Charlotte area and Del Frisco's disappointed. Service was extremely slow, waiter was inattentive and uninformed.  My mom asked the waiter if they had a peppercorn sauce for her steak, in which he immediately replied "yes" and that it would "come on the steak", which I thought was weird since the menu said it would have a "red wine demi-glace. I figured he knew what he was talking about. Once we received our food, there was no peppercorn sauce. The steaks were way too salty and chewy, making it hard to eat. My mom also had multiple pieces of gristle in her medallions, which she had to spit out. We tried to eat what we could of our meals. When the waiter finally came by to check on how are meals were, my dad complained about the amount of salt and we showed him all the gristle. The response was that "we do use lots of salt in our restaurant and should expect gristle in a filet medallion". He also said "we should have told him sooner and  he would've brought a new steak". The problem was this was the first time he checked on us the entire meal. After complaining, never did a manager or kitchen staff come by. Stick to the sister company, Sullivan's in South End. Their service and food are great. Del Frisco's was a big disappointment.

uIhFWBvIvpqt48AAwJGvUg.text: I came here for the first time during restaurant week. I was here on a Saturday night, the ambiance was great and the restaurant was packed. My favorite beer was on tap so that was definitely a plus (Wicked Weed - Pernicious). Our service was great, it was the main course that I was not impressed with. I had the Caesar salad (excellent!) Filet Oscar style with mashed potatoes. I personally, do not like RED steaks. Some people believe that anything more than medium ruins a steak, but there are those of us who prefer a steak to be cooked more. At a restaurant like this, I should be able to get my steak however I offer it. With that being said I was previously warned that the steaks are undercooked so I ordered mine medium well, hoping to get medium. What I received was medium rare, so my first steak was sent back. Second one that came was cooked a little more so I kept it. It was still not med-well like I ordered but luckily it was so dark in there I couldn't see if there was red leaking on my plate. Potatoes were very peppery. For someone who doesn't love pepper, they were just okay. Not as great as I was expecting. Desert, I had the bread pudding and it was fantastic! Only downfall here was the main course, and to me that is the most important. I probably won't return, there are other places I can get a steak of the same quality and have cooked the way I order.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. My &#34;medium well&#34; steak.

bQPCLwwSmAvqqm4i_ea9Sw.text: I had an excellent dinner here last night. The steak was cooked to perfection and almost fell apart when I cut into it. The Demi glaze was also delicious. I enjoyed my Bloody Mary mix. It tasted homemade the service was excellent.

R4ZrYBVbluQvUJfftWwDGg.text: We are at Del Frisco's for our third anniversary. The wait staff was incredible and they made the entire experience a pure pleasure dinner.  I had noted it was our anniversary when I made the reservation. We had an excellent table and when we were seated, an anniversary card signed by the staff was on the table!  Our server, Thomas, was wonderful.  He was attentive but not interruptive. He was happy to answer any questions or make suggestions.  He guided me to a good value delicious Cabernet.  The food was fantastic. The crab cake was delicious - not so much a cake as a lot of top quality crab meat mixed with some vegetables and sauce, mounded together.  The sauce for the crab cake was amazing.  Lobster bisque was rich with large chunks of lobster. Loved it.  We ordered two steaks - the prime ribeye and he bone in ribeye. Top notch. They are salted and seasoned, if you are sensitive to the taste of salt it might be a bit much. They will not salt it at your request it. Regardless, they were cooked to perfection and delicious. The truffle butter crab topping put the bone in ribeye over the top.  We had a couple sides - potatoes at gratin which were fine (a slight smoky flavor due to the bacon) and lobster mac & cheese, which was a bit sweeter than expected but still quite good.  Lastly, they surprised us with a complimentary cheesecake dessert. Heaven on a plate, with strawberry sauce.  All in all, a wonderful experience. The cost can get up there quite quickly, but definitely an excellent special occasion choice.

3rEZlnO1NeHnjIFHGmOmRg.text: Del Friscos is a nice place to go while in South Park and looking for good food and service. We sat at the bar and they have a bar menu, however it lacks any healthy choices. Everything is pretty heavy. It would be nice if they put a few healthy items in their menu at the bar, and even on their regular menu. Their food is fantastic, I will give them that! However it would be nice to be able to go and not have to modify the menu for a healthy meal.

Cdu9sKTFWzY0jY_hb18p3Q.text: Went to Del Friscos Charlotte for a birthday celebration for a party of 4 in January 2018 . For starters we had a reservation and had to wait 15 minutes to be seated, no problem.. It is very noisy here I might add.  Once seated we were given the menu and drink specials. Only 2 of us ordered alcohol from the drink menu which were very good although they took quite a while to come out maybe 20 minutes and we sat across from the bar... The appetizers we ordered about 4 items took almost an hour to arrive so we filled up on bread. The main courses took almost as long and were not even hot when they arrived and still we tried not to complain. Even as a table across from us got their food before us and arrived after us.. Started to feel a little personal at that point.. My food was tasty. I had fish, and the other 3 people in my party had steaks and they were very dry and overly cooked. The manager did come over and apologize and comped us for our appetizers and dessert. I appreciated that. This is the reason for the 3rd star. (I almost wanted to give it 3 1/2) I liked food choice I made  but I don't know if I will return. For these prices the service and wait staff needs some improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sorry I ate a piece before taking pic I hate when people do that... Charred Octopus
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. I think this is called the Plum Rose And the Charred Octopus

LoxXPCXhoKAYMrMOvxANMQ.text: Anyone who has read any of my reviews will know I rarely give any establishment 5 stars.  There are some reviewers that will give any place including McDonald's five .  I only give five  reviews when the food and service is truly amazing.  I've been here once and I must say I waddled out the door completely satisfied. The crab cake appetizer was better than many of the main course of crab cakes at other restaurants, the ribeye I ordered was perfectly cooked and seasoned, and the cheesecake for desert was equal to what you get at the Cheesecake Factory.  The service was excellent and the food a cut above Ruth Chris.  It is rather expensive, but I didn't care because corporate paid for my meal!

buUsnqMfGxbpafaQNNdD9A.text: Kudos to Buddy Edwards and Ashleigh R for following up so quickly.  Buddy took ownership of the issue, immediately addressed it with his staff and chef, and assured me that the next time we visit it will be better.  To be clear, I think this is one of the best steaks I have had since we lived in West Texas, I enjoy visiting, and look forward to the improvements.

vzrj7Y4RWK5jUDSkpevTnA.text: This is my husband and I favorite steak house in town! We are always impressed by the customer service. It is best to have a reservation during the busy holiday season. The night we went it was busy. Our reservations were for 7:30. We met at the restaurant and my husband arrived before me. The restaurant offers valet parking which is nice. When I arrived I approached the hostess desk. My husband told me to tell them to point me in the direction of where he was seated. All he could tell me was that he was downstairs. I told the hostess that we had reservations and I need to know how to get downstairs. The hostess said okay we will have someone to take you there. I waited and waited. Even tried calling my husband for him to come and get me because I was still waiting. Cellphone service was not good downstairs. Needless to say, I waited until the hostess says oh can you take her to the cellar. So my rating is based on the initial customer service. Everything else was beautiful. We will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

eS7YMcG3_9rn7sddHJ-o_w.text: I absolutely LOVE Del Frisco's. The atmosphere is amazing. My husband and I went on a Sat night for an impromptu date. We waited a bit for a table but were seated after about 20/25 min. Our waitress was very pleasant and knowledgeable about everything on the menu. Since we were not truly hungry (hence the impromptu), we opted to order just desserts. Our waitress spoke highly of everything but we opted to try the butter cake and cheesecake! Holy coy, I kid you not, these had to be the best desserts I tasted it years. My husband had the the butter cake, which was topped with butter pecan ice cream and was simply Devine! I had the cheesecake which tasted like Heaven on a Plate!!!! I mean it just melted in my mouth. The dessert wine she recommended was delicious as well. Overall, I'd give our desserts a 10/10!!!!

bDf9DyvrNn7hFcTrhSMjOw.text: Rushed service. My steak was barely warm. In fact, the plate on which it was served was far hotter-- so much so that had I not been paying attention I would have been burned. My guest's steak was served nearly raw, and after being refired, it was returned the same way. Asparagus also undercooked. No trace of lobster in the lobster mac and cheese. Mashed potatoes had the consistency of paste. I was given the weekly wine list at the bar. They were out of my selection. During dinner they informed me that the bottle I selected was the last of their stock and that I'd need to select another if we wanted a 2nd bottle. I selected another bottle and was soon thereafter told that they were out of stock of that as well.

WIzmUoGoUKpFOcC68mGYMQ.text: This is a gem in charlotte. I decided to go here for dinner on a week night and was pleasantly surprised. This place was recommended and highly spoken of so I finally ventured to the place. There are two free parking lots and they have valet in front. I made a reservation and they would not seat my party until everyone was there. We were seated soon after everyone was there. The waiter was knowledgeable. I had the VIP martini which I couldn't taste the vodka. It goes down smooth. I was told it was infused with pineapples for 14 days. It tasted like pineapple juice. It creeps up on you. I had the lobster bisque for appetizer and it was yummy now the best lobster bisque I have ever had, but hit the spot. The 8 ounce steak and potatoes were delicious. I absolutely loved the cheesecake. It was light and fluffy it was some really good cheesecake. I had another martini the pomegranate martini. It was strong and you can taste the alcohol with a bit after bite to it. I feel the customer service was the best I have had in a long time and really value and appreciate that. It wasn't fake, but genuine. I will definitely return and recommend.
