kfQ_hAzZokdpu29owfv2kQ.text: Went on a date night here with my boyfriend on a Friday night. Everything from valet to the service to the food was amazing. Kevin was our server and was absolutely incredible. Not only was he so kind, he was very attentive to us as well. We will definitely be coming back!

OlwtfyLZK3wfVHTjRgJS7A.text: Very disappointing!  Went with my husband last night (Sunday) and ordered the chicken entree.  I have ordered it previously and really liked it.  This time not only was it a very small portion (half the size of last time), but it was dry.  I told the waitress and she brought it back to the kitchen and it took quite a while to get the replacement.  The chicken, although still a very small portion, was at least not dry.  However, my husband had finished his dinner (I didn't want it to get cold).  I thought they would have at least offered a complimentary dessert, but they did not.  Not a pleasant experience for such a high end restaurant.

mgwRHTu01Fgspz1vUZDfuA.text: I have been told about Del Frisco's from someone who visits there just about every week, so I thought this would be a great place to have my Dad's 65th Birthday Dinner. I was wrong and I definitely should've went elsewhere. On Friday, 6/29, my family and I visited Del Frisco's for dinner, to start off, I noticed that majority of the melanated races were asked to sit upstairs, while very few were able to sit downstairs. That caught my attention immediately. Once we were seated we were greeted by an amazing waitress, Kim. Kim was the best part of my experience and I truly appreciate her for everything she did that evening. My unpleasant feeling towards the restaurant and the staff came in when we started to receive our food. I noticed that customers who sat down after us had quick and hot food, while our food was continuously cold. To start, the appetizer, we ordered the Calamari, while the flavor was amazing, it was cold. I let Kim know it was cold and that we ate it because we had already split it up and were hungry, however, we just wanted her to know for the next time it was ordered. She came to let us know that the manager removed the Calamari from our meal, I advised her,  thank you but not necessary. I immediately did not want the waitress or staff to feel like, we purposely ate it and complained to get a free app, it was simply an for your information. However, we were appreciative that they did take it off. The issue was that Kim's manager asked her "Did she not check on us after she brought it out", which implies to me from my previous restaurant experience, why did they not tell you that before they ate it. I advised Kim, I did not see her after the food was dropped off but she was very busy and that's okay. Secondly, we did not receive any bread as other tables immediately recieved bread upon sitting and our salads took forever to come to our table. The drinks were not worth it and very watered down and It only goes downhill from there. My family and I noticed that a particular manager would go to every single table around us to check on them, but he never stopped by our table to ask. We watched him walk towards us on multiple occasions and once complete, turn around and walk back to where he met his counterpart. This was completely unprofessional and very disturbing in a restaurant that you are spending close to $400 on a meal. Not only was he rude, our actual food for dinner was also cold. The plates were hot as though they were sitting on a warmer, but the food was cold and unpleasant. The spinach and lobster mac was cold, so this time, we sent this back. We received another plate of both, and they were both a little warmer than the last, but not hot as though we continuously received sitting plates. This infuriated me and I was completely against coming back to the restaurant. To have your food cold 3 times and you are spending the amount of money to eat at a restaurant of that caliber, I would expect a little more courtesy from management. I will not go back to this restaurant and I encourage this restaurant to engage in anti-discrimination classes on how to treat their guests and understand that melanated skin doesn't mean you have to all sit upstairs, this is 2019, not the 40s-50s. I was very disappointed as I had hoped to have an amazing experience there that would become a regular visit for me, but with the experience I received I wouldn't even recommend anyone I know of caliber to eat there. The only reason for a 2 star is because Kim was the best part of the visit.

B_ri64DANwfAID5wB24tIg.text: Complaints? Let's see.....NONE!   It's all been written about before. The service from beginning to end, phenomenal. Both servers were attentive and friendly. The food- top notch. I've been wanting to compare Capital Grille to this establishment for a while, in case anyone was wondering which was 'better'. I preferred CG's calamari with the peppers, but both of them are delicious. DF's calamari is fried and comes sans marinara sauce, but there is some sauce on the coating. It was fried slightly crunchier than I prefer, but my date and I ate every piece- actions speak louder than (written) words.  The Chilean Sea Bass and crab cake entree was delicious. At Capital Grille I had crab and shrimp cakes. While that was also good, it paled in comparison to the half of crab cake I ate here (my friend and I split since she couldn't finish it all). This is the bar by which all crab cakes should be judged. Seriously, I think back to some I've had in the past and feel ashamed that I enjoyed them that much.  The lobster bisque......deliciously smooth with chunks of lobster. It can't get much better there. I can't wait to return.

6vhxpmlPgE3MGsWTIKW3oA.text: I had a fabulous girl's night with 6 of my closest friends and it was so great in part by general manager Buddy Edwards, who was fun and personable and really great at his job. My table had the dinner salmon, lamb, cobb salad, and the bar burger. Everything was amazing and cooked to perfection, and these are a hard group of ladies to impress! The butter cake for dessert was so delicious, I'll probably stop in just for that if I'm anywhere near the vicinity. I would definitely return. The restaurant would be great if you are trying to impress anyone, the ambience is perfect for a date night, girl's night, or even a business meeting. I would choose dressy/business casual attire, due to the upscale nature of the establishment, complimentary valet is available, and although there are no rules regarding the kiddos, I'd leave them at home with the sitter and enjoy a grown up night!

AvvEjMkMawKSBE4o046DBA.text: Tonight was my first time dining at any Del Frisco's location.  I have been looking forward to trying it and thought I'd give it a whirl during restaurant week so I made reservations.  They have valet available curbside.  We arrived at 6:45 for our 7 pm reservation for three people. We were seated at 7:05.  Unfortunately, they seated us at a table upstairs which did not work for us as one of the diners in our group cannot walk long distances or climb stairs due to health reasons.  This isn't the restaurants fault and I didn't know there were two floors or I would have asked for a table downstairs upon making the reservation.  They have an elevator but unfortunately, in order to get to the elevator you have to walk all the way through the restaurant.  Wasn't a big deal for me personally but was for one member in our party and could be for others in the future if you aren't aware.  We dined during Restaurant Week and ordered from the special menu. I ordered the seasonal salad, 8 oz filet Oscar style with potatoes, and cheesecake.  They brought complimentary bread after we waited for service at the table for 15 minutes.  It was a loaf of white bread covered in sesame seeds. Basically a glorified sesame seed bagel.  It was a Monday night and they were busy because of restaurant week but the service was ridiculously slow. It should not have taken 2.5 hours for three people to eat.  It was a 30 minute wait from the time we ordered to receive our soup/salad.  The salad was very dry.  The lobster bisque was extremely salty.  I've had better off the hot bar at Harris teeter down the street for a lot less.  It had exactly two small pieces of lobster in it. It was another long wait for our entrees to arrive.  The chateau potatoes were delicious and the steak was cooked perfectly.  I ordered mine Oscar style like I have many other times at other dining establishments.  I think it ruined the steak at Del Frisco's.  You couldn't taste any crab and the asparagus was extremely undercooked.  All I could taste for the remainder of the meal was the undercooked asparagus unfortunately.  Hours later and I can still taste it.  Waited another 20 minutes for our deserts even though we ordered them at the beginning of the meal.  Don't get me wrong, the cheesecake was delicious but it didn't taste like any cheesecake I had ever had before.  It was light and airy.  I really enjoyed it.   I've heard such amazing things about this chain and how I have to check it out.  All three of us were very disappointed in the experience.  The food was we subpar, the service was slow, it was extremely loud and crowded.  I have read that they have good happy hour specials so I might give them another chance and try those out one night.  It's nothing special and especially once you take into account how expensive the meal is.

s--wR71oG-V-fTtzfrGp4Q.text: This is hands down the best place in Charlotte to get a steak from a "chain" restaurant. rPegwOBD0yGupGjOtfgrQQ.text: I eat at Del Frisco's on average 3 or 4 times a year.  They have a solid menu.  The house salad with avocado dressing is amazing, especially with cracked pepper.  It is my favorite item on the menu but the lobster mac and cheese is a close second.    To be perfectly honest the steak was very good but not amazing as it didn't seem to be seasoned at all.  Almost like they forgot, but the temperature was perfect. I ordered my steak medium.    All the seafood on the menu is very delicious.  I do plan to try the steak again at some point to see if they were just having an off day.  Everything else has been so good there, I think it may have just been a one off experience.  I have to give them 4/5 stars because they are a steakhouse and the steak was the one thing that I wasn't in love with.

v3Q5bc2vPj8NxLKGZc6ngA.text: Went for a team dinner.service was excellent so was the food. The steak was done as per my expectations and the dessert selection was good too.

QsVnwpidY8X9J_GnxjYeJA.text: I think Del Friscos may have perfected "the steak".  At least Filet Mignon.  Crisp outer, tender buttery throughout, great flavor, and seasoned correctly.  I also tried my fiancee's crab cakes and I have to say they were the best crab cakes I have ever had.  True "JUMBO LUMP crab cakes".  The service was good, but a little slow, and maybe not to the level of professionalism you would expect.  If you want to way overpay for a fantastic bottle of wine and get the whole 5 star sommelier experience; that option is available.  The brussel sprouts had a unique smoky flavor I have not tasted before and were cooked perfectly.   I highly recommend he Butter Cake dessert--it tastes so much better than just a buttery pound cake--it's probably not on the Keto diet though.

Pj2u4lvvwGSwTWQ4iyKdrA.text: Went for Happy Hour, sat at the bar.  Friends told us about the Happy Hour deals, and they were on the money!  They have a great bar menu, and a really great value. I had a burger cooked perfect and delicious.  Started with a Manhattan, then went to beer. My friend had wine--half price wine for Happy Hour!  She had Filet Tips Au  Poivre -- also very good and perfect portion. Met some regulars, very fun.  Want to go to a place where everyone is friendly, you have to check out.  Liked it so much, reserved a table for dinner tomorrow night.  Give their steaks a try.

q99RCMdFV_-PeC2MJe_Odg.text: Amazing food. April is a fabulous server and all the staff were outstanding. Our dinner was very memorable.

CNKJvIlfWzamlXET8DOpiQ.text: We showed up for a reservation well before the reservation time! They suggested the upstairs bar until our table was ready. 30 minutes later they were unable to provide us with an estimate of the seating time. Therefore, we asked to speak to the manager. He danced around the question and finally stated "it would be another 20 minutes or so before we can get to seated but if you can wait I would be happy to send you some appetizers on the house" !!! I wish some one had notified of the excessive wait time even with a reservation at the beginning rather than waiting! I would not recommend at all!!!

lc2BcbQBP6A6F-6xuqjdUA.text: We dined at Del Frisco's in NYC earlier this year, and enjoyed our meal enough to dine with them again in Charlotte. Let me set the scene for you. A sudden thunderstorm popped up, making our journey to the restaurant difficult- then upon arriving and seeing there was no awning, we waited in the car as the storm raged around us, hoping it would let up. Then the Maitre'D comes out, with an umbrella to escort us in. He got completely soaked. The valet must have been held up by the rain, and noticing this, he stepped in to help. That is above and beyond. It would not be the last of the great service we had at Del Frisco's.   Food  Appetizers- We had the calamari and the shrimp cocktail. The calamari were VERY spicy. No one had a problem with it, and it was certainly different that what we normally get elsewhere. The shrimp cocktail were indeed JUMBO, and everyone was happy with them.   Entrees- We had 3 bone in filets- this is one of the best cuts of steak on the planet. If you dine in a steakhouse that offers one of these, you should get it. We also had a regular filet, and a filet trio. The filet was very good. My Dad was not however totally sold on his trio once it arrived and he got started on it. It included filet Oscar, a filet with a mushroom topping, and one other, that I cannot remember. His favorite was the filet Oscar- I'm not sure that he liked the flavor of the topping on the other two.  All of the steaks were cooked perfectly.   Sides- We had the Mac and Cheese, sweet potatoes, asparagus and creamed corn. The mac and cheese was the STAR side in NYC when we dined there. So we were expecting the same greatness. Nope. The Charlotte mac and cheese had jalapenos in it!! We were shocked. I have terrible heartburn and cannot eat spicy food- but our incredible waiter discovered this, and brought us another mac and cheese sans the peppers. Even then, it still wasn't quite as good as we remembered. The sweet potatoes were fine, and bit runny actually, and not quite sweet enough. The asparagus was good, and everyone enjoyed the creamed corn. I am sorry to say I cannot make a GREAT side recommendation for this Del Frisco's.   Dessert- Incredible. They had some really fantastic items. I had the Lemon doberge cake- which was HUGE, and AMAZING. The cake was moist, the filling was the perfect balance of sweet and tart, and the frosting/glaze was delicious. We also had the cheesecake- which was very good, and much lighter in texture than your average cheesecake. It was whipped. I thought it was a great take on the dessert. We also had the chocolate lava cake, the chocolate mousse, and the mango sorbet. Both of the chocolate desserts were very good. We were a little disappointed that all the restaurant had left was the mango sorbet, as the other flavors were something we had really enjoyed in NYC. I would certainly advise that you save room for dessert.   Service- I already mentioned the Maitre 'D. The waiter or waitress you have can really make or break an experience in a restaurant. We had a great dinner, and it was only enhanced by our INCREDIBLE waiter, John. He was very knowledgeable about the menu, and wine list. He was friendly, witty and funny. Should you choose to dine here, you would be so lucky to have him as your server.   Overall the service was a 5 star experience. I am going with 4 stars since we were a little disappointed in a few of the items we ordered. We would go here again if we were in the area.

ozQAXCIs57k9Um-XzrLMog.text: In a town where steakhouses have traditionally ruled, this SouthPark staple is king. A sweeping staircase, dramatically dim lighting, and an excess of mahogany make this gorgeous steakhouse the most elegant in town. And while its grandeur may evoke nostalgia for the city's boom days of dining, Del Frisco's retains its status as a place to spot the city's most powerful with steak knives in hand.  What to get: The filet, rib eye, prime strip, or porterhouse. This menu is a beef lover's dream, and beautifully marbled slabs of meat are perfectly cooked and simply served.  Don't skip: The first course. The fried calamari comes in a slightly spicy Asian glaze and the steak tartare is served in a cool mound alongside slivers of crisp potato chips.  Best bargain: On Sunday nights Del Frisco's offers its Restaurant Week menu--and therefore the chance to sample without breaking the bank--with three courses for just $30.

5T7RVtH4Yxl_Fb-YbG0-BQ.text: Absolutely love this place I always have to get the crab cakes and my boyfriend loves the wagyu! You can't go wrong here... Ever-

wExVhGEqhIwXRmS4HDc-eg.text: Best steakhouse in Charlotte. Tried them all. My work involved entertaining and meeting a lot of clients, and this location never disappoints. My suggestion is the salmon, sirloin, or Ribeye.

1yTe-jAKg82Z70RRqtLjaA.text: No hype just Hugh end dining,  service is great . Perfect set up for first date impression, anniversary, birthday, business dinner. My fave filet mignon and wagu steak. For a steak house they should have Wellington  steak, this is why I give this place 4 stars. And by the way more options on sides and surf and turf would be nice. This place also have a dictionary book 9f wine and champagne list.  Price per bottle minimum is 60 but it is embarrassing to ask for that one,  so it's safe to spend a 100  dollar bottle of wine. Enjoy and I'll be posting a pic next time I go back.

rJ7R6iyT_KcyYhgOP7Jk9g.text: I have had some good steaks in my life. Holy f*^k this wagu bone in ribeye is better than sex. Way better than papas brothers or the palm. Crab cakes are amazing and the staff don't try to rush anything and aren't spread to thin. Good service and great atmosphere. Ask for Terrell there isn't s dish he can't pair perfectly.

v9V2I3YCm-BtE6JyArb4Pw.text: We had an incredible experience celebrating my wife's 50th Birthday at Del Frisco's with family and friends. She loved every aspect of the night to include the venue, food and staff.  If you have never seen the Wine Cellar on the lower level of Del Frisco's ...let me tell you ....it is an absolutely gorgeous setting.  We preset a menu, from which guests could choose their meals. They were all pleased with their food, including lemon cake for dessert.  What really set the night apart was the staff. Natalie the event planner was great with offering suggestions that fit our style and budget...never trying to push one item over another.  Bobby the service lead for our event expertly guided the staff throughout the night. The whole service team was friendly, engaging and responsive to our guests' needs and requests.  We were happy that all of our guests felt like VIPs throughout the evening.  I would definitely recommend Del Frisco's for an exceptional private event.

_UVC5z3M8onpJKIxAdUztg.text: This was my 3rd or 4th visit to Del Frisco's. I have always had a great meal.  The steak was perfectly prepared, the oysters were delish and the sides were great! It's always a treat!

ckFo5XxDfAz0uSAukTVrVQ.text: Probably one of my top favorite steakhouses in Charlotte. I love the atmosphere - it's warm and inviting and comfortable. The steaks are absolutely delicious. The filet is charred on the outside and slives like butter. Not to mention I guiltly like their bread too. Their asparagus and potatoes au gratin are delicious. Give this a place a try!

-MlCSTo-h4WkYV2qdZ1UDQ.text: Love the atmosphere here! The Crab Cakes, Creamed Spinach and the Del's Salad was delicious!

CCAPwII-TZJrb8PfZr_yPw.text: Am a little late on this update as it's about our Fathers Day Brunch experience and that was a few weeks ago but, still felt compelled to type.  Went to brunch with my wife, her sister, and their parents.  The brunch menu was pretty extensive and covered an App, Entree and Dessert for $35.    First good news.  Not being a dessert person, I asked if I could sub two apps instead of one app and one dessert.  "It's fathers day sir, absolutely no problem".    Second good news.  Just the quality of the food.  From the giant, delicious bacon slabs that adorn that house salad with the sinfully good Green Goddess dressing (Quick Tip... go at night, order the house chips, a side of the GG dressing, a side of the Blue Cheese dressing and go to town. O-M-G), to the steak which my father in law decreed, "the best steak I've had in 10 years", to the Shrimp Scampi.  Yes, I ordered Shrimp Scampi at a steak joint.  Why?  Cause I love it and its hard to find done well around here and I knew it would be great here.  And...... It was.  SHOCK!!!  Third good news.  The service.  Extensive knowledge of the menu, the aforementioned flexibility on the brunch items, the way they team up at just the right moment, swoop in and clear everything away.  One really feels well taken care of here.  Final good news?  The check.  At $35 per for all that food, I've never gotten out of Del Frisco's that cheap before. OK, they aren't perfect...  They need to go fresh squeezed on the Mimosa OJ.  131 Main does it, I know they can too.  But, Tropicana in my drink pales in comparison to all that is wonderful here.  We'll be back...

ImLtVvbCGmuV1YnlYNc2Zw.text: 3 stars and may continue downward. First let me state that I have been here over a dozen times. For some reason my customers love to go here also, this and Sullivans.  Service: 4 stars. Ok, it is a chain but a very expensive chain. Sorry to sound uppity, but I expect nothing but long term, tenured wait staff. You know these folks, they make top dollar and are True pros. We had good service, but does not compare to what we had in Greensboro at Flemings.  Direction: 1 Star. I reserve a week in advance as I mostly have groups. In this case 18 people. Requested a private room, ended up with a "Sorry, but upstairs is now booked (Thanks for Calling!) but we will sit you in the crowded corner. So much for the private business dinner meeting.   Food: What is happening? Down to 2 stars. Had 8 dishes sent back. Mine was really a disappointment. How to begin, ok the beginning. We ordered starters, which one item was crab cakes. Ok, that was fine but I do not eat red meat. I like it, it don't like me. So for my main course I ordered the crab cake dinner. Yes, three time the price of the starter! Expect something dinnerish? Yes. What was delivered? Two crab starter cakes with a blob of slaw in the middle. Hyper inflation anyone?  Overall: We are down to 3 Stars folks. Must be why the restaurant was only about 50% full and even had open bar stools at prime time.   Del! Oh Del! Your lemon cake is still the bomb!!! Please work so the rest of the menu don't turn into a bomb :-( Frankly, I have had better at Chic-Fil-A at a whole lot less.   BTW, 4 of my customers stated the same and being Charlotte residents the comment was made "Nevermind taking me back here, save your money"  I will return Del, but your on probation. I think it is the Lemon cake!

5lGdzu7bpAl1yon4TeWfhQ.text: I've been to DF quite a few times either for drinks or dinner and the experiences have been....meh.  We went there last night (it's been at least a year since a mediocre experience there) and that was the best dining experience I've had in a looooong time.   The service was insane - the sommelier came over to explain the wines twice, the waiter was constantly checking in (not obnoxiously) and had in depth explanations of the menu as well as items that we could get that weren't on the menu.  When we were finished, about 5 people swooped in and cleaned up our table in less than 5 seconds.    To drink we had the VIP martini (pineapple infused vodka) which was frothy and VERY tasty (and strong).  I ordered the shrimp cocktail, which you can get with a bunch of different sauces but I got the traditional cocktail sauce and asked them to make it extra spicy and it was great. Got the scallops which were succulent and there were plenty of them with the perfect amount of a delicious sauce; we ordered the 3 fillet medallions and the petite fillet, baked potato, and mac and cheese (we brought the kids) and they were deeeelicious.  They were very accomodating in terms of providing the kids with a "vanilla"/not to spicey version of the sides.  And we ended with one of those molten chocolate cakes with vanilla bean ice cream which we ordered for the kids, but I ate almost the whole thing.  And I don't even like chocolate that much.  They knew it was my birthday, so maybe that's why the service was exceptional, but I doubt it.  Looking forward to going back after a long break from this place!

Txil5g9TfQS9kx-W6nRJcQ.text: Another Perfect meal at Del Frisco's!!  Got a table for 2 right away by booking on Open Table, Perfect Filet Mignon and Crab Cake and Scallops were excellent also!!  Sides just as good and the Del Salad with Avocado dressing is my favorite salad anywhere!!  Didn't have room for dessert but the Lemon 7 layer cake is a must!!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chopped Salad and Steak

yB7inoJ3_sjM70VJiVuXNw.text: So awesome!  The food was fantastic,  great wine , best ever server, Kaeli she knew her wines and help us choose the perfect bottle.The place is so beautiful.  The bartender was really helpful with choosing our shots

bsTwPSGkxzRdGt0c7R1qpg.text: Always top notch. Eaten there 4 times. Never a miss. Always spot on 5 star experience in every area.

zAVMwyZkaboNQIZdZre1jg.text: This place is always welcoming. I really do enjoy being in here, mostly for the happy hour they offer. I believe it goes until 7 every day, but friday they have half price wine all day. If you can time it right to get there for the appetizers and wine, you can go crazy and not spend much at all. They had one of the best burgers in Charlotte on the menu, but sometime this year they did change the bar menu and altered the burger and it mad me sad. Now its a double burger and they changed the quality of the meat. I will still go because the service is outstanding and the ambiance and wine are great, but come on Del Frisco's! Bring back my burger.

mJ7o8oZtEVEqg9YhSdCA0Q.text: Decided to try a new place for Restaurant Week and could've have been happier with my choice of Del Frisco's!  The service staff was very friendly and professional - from check in to during the meal to our way out the door.  Tried a couple of red wines which were both delicious.  Got great recommendations from our excellent server and was very pleased with my meal (Filet with mushroom sauce).  The desserts were ah-mazing - both the Bread Pudding & the Cheesecake.  This restaurant will definitely go on my favorites & I will be back!

DIWXcsawVUW0uYOu6WybJQ.text: Love this place! Great stake and ambiance. My daughter also went she's 6 so I didn't buy her a personal steak. But the entre and sides are large enough to share . She really loved the maccaroni

0IBVg_6VpztJnCYERLC6Lg.text: I've been here about a half dozen times. And been to the one on NYC. They're both very similar in that the interiors are so lavish and huge that they have no choice but to charge the highest prices in the area for anything (everything) on their menu.   And that would be fine if everything on the menu was of the best quality and flavor.  Unfortunately my experience has shown me that is not the case.   For some reason, they just can't serve a good ribeye. I've sent back about half the rib eyes I've ordered here. Either not cooked to right temperature, overly tough and fatty, or someone didn't hear me say Pittsburgh style. Or maybe it's so loud in there I just wasn't speaking loud enough.   Have enjoyed better steaks at Beef n Bottle, Capital Grille, The Palm and even Ruth's Chris.   If spending too much on average food doesn't bother you than this is is great place to visit for the healthy bar scene, people watching and great service.   Yes. The service is great. Personal. Real. Friendly. And the people working here look like they're having fun. And I may have a crush on Sandy the bartender.  But honestly, I'm happy they all love their jobs. And that many people are probably so hammered they don't realize they're eating average food.   I'll be back. Largely to flirt with Sandy. But I may just settle for a few drinks at the bar and take an uber across the street for a steak at Ruth's Chris after.

GhbrAOIBC8FkFjj4jaGLxA.text: One of the most horrible dinning experiences I've ever had. A friend of a friend who is a 5 star chef ate with us.he confirmed my thoughts at once, saying he thought it was the most over salted piece of meat he ever ate. A 50 dollar steak should be eatable, 5 of them were not. Don't waste your time or money here. Go to Capital Grill downtown instead.very nice food

TprICWz6UUIlsM6XPJFGNg.text: Great steak, cooked just as I requested and service was spectacular.  Wine list is listed in alphabetical order and not by price which was a little frustrating.

Tvb764GEiNi4hi5eps8KYA.text: My boyfriend and I had a wonderful evening here yesterday. Our server was great and the food was delicious. My boyfriend loved his ribeye. I had the Chicken Provencal and it was good. Our sides were mashed potatoes and lobster Mac &  cheese. Mash potatoes at other restaurant are usually plain but the mash potatoes here had flavor and was good. I'm not a fan of lobster or Mac & cheese but it was delicious. I would definitely recommend that as a side dish. This restaurant definitely met my expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Provençal. Mash potatoes
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Mac &amp; cheese. Ribeye

nqf3t_t4Rke_fcJRZiQ2gQ.text: When you go to an upscale place like this and pay the prices they demand you have high expectations. Our group of four had dinner on Christmas Eve. The wine selection, ambiance, Brussels sprouts, bread, and water were excellent. I had the medallions and they were good. My wife, daughter and son-in-law all had fillets. We went through the somewhat silly ordeal with the server, cutting our meat at his insistence to determine if it was cooked properly. Well, this is fine if they are going to do something about it if not cooked as ordered. My daughter ordered medium well and it was served red in the middle. Due to medical reasons, she cannot eat RED meat. She explained this to the server and he took it back for another try. In the mean time, everyone else is eating while their food is warm. Eventually her steak returns and low and behold it's still not right. Half of it was better but the other half still red. She showed the server again and his response was that medium well was pink in the middle, blah, blah, blah. Well his flashlight (obviously a necessary tool to show customers how smart they are) revealed it was RED! He offered to have it recooked again but of course by that time everyone else was almost done eating. My daughter said no, she would just eat what she could. Then, to add insult to injury he offered to give her something she could take the red meat home in. The worst part about the whole ordeal was the waiter actually insisted the customer was wrong in front of everyone else that could see my daughter was correct. I have been in restaurants that have had issues before and they most always attempt to make sure the customers leaves happy, one way or another. We all just left disappointed with the service and paid way too much for food that couldn't be eaten. Kind of put a damper on our Christmas Eve family dinner experience. Not likely to return. I am amazed at some of the reviews for this place.

rG3SYJ-dt4qsTxBKNaPH7A.text: Made a celebratory trip to Del Frisco's with my parents and wife.  Unbelievably good meal and service.  We arrived at 6pm on a Sunday night, but the place was fairly empty.  By 7pm, however, it was packed.    $99 power couple meal is an absolute steal when the food and service are this good:  one salad per person, steak and crabcake per person, one side dish per person but large enough to share across 4 people, and one dessert per person for $99.  The steak literally melted in my mouth.  We added stone crab claws as an appetizer, but that was a mistake.  They're ridiculously delicious but really expensive and you get so much food with the Power Couple meal, it just wasn't a wise decision.    Highly recommend this place for a swanky once in a while dinner location.  I

fCK9ANOG6QNkl8KIrgIGNQ.text: Everyone makes mistakes, but Del Frisco falls short on the 2nd chance.  Not what I expected from Del Frisco.  Their service is amateur.  Their management is all talk and no action.   If you're dining alone, it may be ok, but if you have a large group and/or a special occasion, I suggest you go to somewhere else if you're spending this kind of money.

0O0igDy__bOzxah9JBxFgQ.text: By far the best food I have ever eaten. Service was outstanding as well. Will definitely check them out again when in the Charlotte area!

Q9eff8qU4I1IHXxP4mCNow.text: This was the most fantastic dinner we had on our business trip.  We had a no chain rule, and did not know this was an upscale to Sullivan's until the waiter told us.  No matter, it was worth the trip and every penny.  I really wanted stone crab claws but the waiter told us they were out do to a shortage. We shared an ahi tuna salad with the tuna cooked just perfectly rare, and the most amazing lobster macaroni and cheese I have ever tasted.  My friend and I shared an 8 oz  filet and crab cakes with Jicama Slaw & Cajun Lobster Sauce. Our 3rd friend ordered chicken and broccolini because he only eats healthy, unlike Nicole B and me! The filet literally melted in our mouths, and the crab cake was all crab and no filler. I had a $15 A Breath of Fresh Pear, Grey Goose La Poire Vodka, Cointreau, white cranberry juice which was pricey but very good. This meal ruined several others because nothing could compare to the deliciousness we experienced at Del Frisco's!

VLeQk0BeowWI5ZsEFNzWEg.text: My wife and I came here to celebrate my birthday, and enjoyed one of the best meals we've had in a long time. We both had the petite fillet, which were cooked and seasoned to perfection! Our waitress recommended a fantastic wine pairing, and topped off the meal with a complimentary banana bread pudding. The setting was also wonderful, with high ceilings and tables spaced comfortably apart for privacy. A little on the pricey side, but no more expensive than any other top-ranked steakhouse chain I've been to. Their Friday Night wine special knocked a $95 bottle of Cab down to around $60 -- a great value. All in all, Del Frisco's made for an outstanding meal and a very special birthday celebration. We'll DEFINITELY be back.

z7KjXKkm78hSBeSNb0BILA.text: We snagged an early reservation here on Valentine's evening & had a lovely evening.  The background music was Motown & that was different, but not unpleasant.  The hostesses and our server Tava were very nice.    We ordered a Contempo Reisling which had a nice, clean taste.  Since this was our first time we went with the 8oz & 12oz filet, rare & medium rare.  Bread came to the table & it was AHSOME! Delicious & yeasty - I had two pieces (eek!);  A dinner salad, caesar salad & shared the ala carte mac & cheese w/bacon & creamed corn.  We finished the evening with the Lemon Doberge Cake (a huge piece).    It was all cooked perfectly & it was all delicious.  It's definitely a splurge, but more genteel than Flemings at Epicentre.

UkD4rUsWFAu46LAb70sT8A.text: If I could give six stars I would. Took my boyfriend here for his birthday and made reservations online. The staff had prepared and all signed a card for him when we arrived. The waitstaff were exceptional from start to finish, checking in multiple times and patiently answering all questions we had. The food was mouthwatering, from the crabcakes to the salmon to dessert. Everything was expertly prepared and absolutely delicious. Highly, highly recommend.

TfqauvTqB7g5lH9Zm8z7ZA.text: I visited Del Frisco's a few months ago with some friends of mine. We opted to sit in the bar area, and just order some appetizers and drinks. The menu is quite pricey, but this restaurant is upscale along the lines of Morton's or Ruth's Chris. Dress nicely when you show up here.  The service was attentive, professional and polite. It's exactly as great as you'd expect for a high end restaurant. The food was also a highlight. The appetizers we ordered were delicious. The fried calamari looked and smelled so delicious that I broke my "I'll never eat *squid*" rule and tried it. It tasted fantastic.   Shockingly, I discovered at 40 that apparently I am incredibly allergic to calamari, as I went into mild anaphylaxis (it was my first exposure ever to calamari or any mollusc). Nevermind that, it was delicious! However, I've been informed that I am to never eat calamari or any other mollusc again. So sad. I'll say this, fried calamari was never tempting enough to even try until I it was in front of me at Del Frisco's, so there's that.  All in all, a wonderful dining experience. Just a little pricey for my wallet at the moment. Highly recommended!

GhCxlMsOg-s7MJXQvx6ykA.text: Not as fine dining as they think they are.  The $40 steak was good, but I've had much better at half the price!   The service was good when we were attended to, but our server wasn't very  attentive.  Disappointing.

BWL7JQDa-txyoyvaZwd4Wg.text: An excellent experience all around! I was a regular at Del Frisco's when I lived in Fort Worth, so I was excited to give the Charlotte location a try. Our group was very happy that we did. After some fantastic appetizers consisting of crab cakes and oysters on the half shell, I went with the long bone wagyu ribeye. Fantastic! The sides disappeared quickly too among the group. Au gratin potatoes, loaded creamed spinach, mushrooms, and lobster mac were all amazing. Dessert? Yes please! I think we ordered at least one of everything and shared. Overall, give Del Frisco's a try for a nice group dinner or special occasion. Service was excellent and attentive. It took a team effort for our group and they were great.

F7CzjkzOzbps9A9W0fY4OA.text: Everything from the appetizers to the incredible banana dessert was amazing.  I had the prime rib and lobster mac and cheese and was extremely happy with it.

vjelxTjxr-dC0imAu6uPCg.text: The food is good but you have to wait forever between each course, the staff is very friendly. Do not order the potato skillet because it is the same as having potato chips with onion on top.

-XNBnKF9K2OqGhCv-B9dmg.text: Love this place! The seafood appetizer platter is the best! Great service and great food.

zi0FjIEtlF8GNg2JMgJZ3Q.text: Everything was delicious- the salad, steak and scallops, corn is amazing, potatoes are delicious, and the banana bread pudding melts in your mouth. I can't wait to go back to this restaurant. Yes, it's pricey but worth it. Any time I can eat a steak without needing steak sauce, it is the perfect steak!!!

C2Opj1bcrINYJaA1ggkYmQ.text: I'll admit, the only time I get to venture to $$$$ restaurants is during Queen's Feast.  However, I won't let that deter my future dining experiences at this gem of a steak house.  The decor is absolutely striking!  The bar is well stocked and the service is impeccable.  I ordered the grapefruit habanero margarita...strong and sweet at first, but then the flavor of the habanero comes in with a pleasant, yet not overpowering spice.  My dinner guest and I ordered different first courses: I requested the classic Caesar salad and she ordered the lobster bisque.  Thankfully, I was able to sample the lobster bisque and it was phenomenal.  The creaminess of the soup and flavor was exquisite.  We both ordered the filet with the mashed potatoes.  The steak was cooked to perfection.  I noticed the crispness of the sear and the seasoning made this filet absolutely wonderful!  Cutting into this filet was a soft pink center...just the way I like it.  The rest period allowed the steak to be juicy and tasty.   Our final course was dessert.  I selected chocolate mousse and my friend ordered the cheesecake.  The chocolate mousse won me over, because there was a salted caramel sauce spooned over top.  Chocolate + caramel = a very happy me!  The cheesecake was no-bake, so it was very light and fluffy.  Not too sweet and not as dense as you would find in a baked cheesecake.  On a side note, I have disdain for people that order steaks well-done and/or have the audacity to ask for steak sauce!  You will only receive the best quality piece of meat at this restaurant.  They are the experts at cooking, why would you be steered wrong?  The lady at the next table ordered her filet well done.  The waiter suggested that it wouldn't be a good decision, but alas, the customer is always right.  When her steak was brought out, she complained that it was tough!  Really, lady??? They tried to tell you!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grapefruit habañero margarita...sweet, strong &amp; spicy!

EWYqAPoNgOPdd7kwHIXx0g.text: So, you know me, I'm pretty particular about experiences.  We stopped into Del Frisco's on the second Saturday night of Restaurant Week.  Some restaurants really struggle with service during Restaurant Week and that's ok, I can actually understand that because they're slammed for 10 days straight.  Del Frisco's, however, not only didn't struggle, they did a really impressive job for such a busy night.  We stopped in about 60 minutes early in hopes of getting bar seats and having a drink.  Check in at the hostess stand was easy and I was told we'd get a text closer to our reservation time.  We went to the bar to find a couple available seats peppered here and there.  Some nice guy at the bar changed his seat so at least the girls could sit down together.  I was pleasantly pleased.    We ordered a Pomegranate Martini, $15 (360 vodka, pomegranate liquor and splash of cranberry) and The V.I.P. $14 (Svedka clementine vodka infused with Hawaiian pineapple.)  Glasses are large, the VIP tasted of pineapple only, the martini had some bite though.  The bartenders didn't really engage with us but we were a group of 4, we were happy talking to each other.  The couple next to us got up to leave and offered the men their seats as well.  A couple my parents age got up when their table was called and patted an arm of one of our group and told us young folk to have a good dinner.  Gotta say, the clientele here is great.  (She called us "young folk"!!)  We were texted 10 minutes before our reservation and walked to a very desirable banquette table on the lower floor overlooking the floor to ceiling windows.  The hostess pulled the table out for us to get in the back and offered to come back later for pictures if we wanted, after we'd commented on how much we liked our table.  The floor under the table needed a good sweeping, but it was a busy Saturday, no biggie.  Water was quickly filled and we had a few minutes to look at the menu before we were approached by our front waiter Khaleel.  Personality plus, he confidently walked us through the menu and offered time for questions or explanations of the menu, refills on the drinks (recognizing at a glance what each of us were drinking).  He mentioned his back waiter was Courtney and that they'd be serving us as a pair.  Piping hot sesame bread arrived from another person (oddly uncut, guests had to either rip or cut their bread with their table knives) with some whipped butter.  It was mentioned online that all the sauces, salad dressings and breads are house-made every day.  We all opted for the $35 Restaurant Week menus (how could you not?  The filet alone was $42.95 on the regular menu!) with the men opting for the $15 upcharge to get Prime Ribeye. Our starters were the deconstructed Caesar salad or the spring salad.  Both were nice small salads with homemade dressings.  The Caesar dressing had a snappy anchovy taste and I LOVE that.  Don't be afraid of anchovies in Caesar dressing, it's the secret behind it's delicious taste. I tasted my husbands Spring Mix salad and his Balsamic Vinaigrette was delicious, too.  Our entrees arrived and the server invited the three steak eaters to cut into their steaks to check temperatures.  All three (2 Prime Ribeyes, 1 filet) had been ordered med-rare.  One ribeye and one filet went back to the kitchen because they were still rather cold and blue inside.  The server (I guess his job was to serve entrees) was surprised and not happy, not unhappy with us, but unhappy the guests weren't happy.  He took them back and we had them back on our table in about 5 minutes.  The manager and Khaleel both had been told that two steaks went back and both came over to our table to check on them.  I like the service here. !!    I had ordered crabcakes and I'm iffy about them.  I guess I'd have to say the freshly handcut veggies sprinkled within them were a little too large and ended up overpowering the taste of the delicate crab, as did the Cajun lobster sauce.  But the crabmeat was silky and chunky and these lovely, hand-formed, un-uniform patties showed they were made in-house.  My one complaint of the night is the heavy hand on the salt shaker in the kitchen.  I'd read numerous reviews about how salty dishes are here.  I had opted for the housemade Chateau potatoes as my side because of how chunky they were and had skins .  They were yummy but had a lot of salt, my salt headache before I'd finished the entree was testament to that.  Same complaint from the other 3 diners.  Dessert was a choice of a lovely, light, airy cheesecake with strawberry sauce or a salted caramel chocolate mousse.  I'd asked Khaleel for his opinion earlier and he firmly said the mousse.  We got two and two and I actually was much more a fan of the cheesecake.  Checks were brought promptly.  Service for the most part was impeccable on a very busy Saturday night Restaurant Week.  I look forward to going back on a more traditional night because I imagine it's even better.

9fB_e9wP-ZtZLDGNpZzeaw.text: I am spoiled ...not a chain guy but have had amazing experiences in major cities and decided to try the Queen City location...  Not a crowning achievement... I had to clutch pearls when the bartender filled a nice glass of water---for HIMSELF!!! I eventually asked for one for myself after it became abundantly clear he was clueless.    The look of dismay tipped off the co-bartender who actually introduced himself! Wow...way to go Michael!!! Michael is the only reason I did not reach out to management...  So as others around me are enjoying bread...I just chill---mine never came and finally my sea bass arrived and justifies enduring this foolishness!  Amazing!!! So in a nutshell---lower your expectations if you've had the privilege of experiencing  Del Frisco's  in larger cities ... they can but for whatever reason choose not to  represent the brand to its fullest potential.    I finally figured it out---co bartender had something else to do and only was there to tolerate diners on his shift and disappeared towards the conclusion of my meal. Hence the lackluster delivery...

K3Bk-1jrusZSWiRPTeKk4Q.text: A couple friends and I made reservations to eat here for CIAA weekend because she is a chef at the Del Frisco's in Philadelphia.  The place is exceptionally beautiful!!!  Was pretty busy when we arrived. Reservation was at 8:30PM didn't get seated till 9ish (no biggie) the place was clearly busy.  Once seated we ordered the charred Octopus DELICIOUS!!! I specifically told our waitress I DO NOT EAT MEAT/PORK I ordered the Lobster tail w/mashed potatoes she also recommended the spinach (I didn't know the spinach had pork in it, I'm guessing the waitress didn't know the menu or she was rushing to take our order) thank goodness I didn't get to taste the spinach but some friends I came with that do not eat pork either were less fortunate,we asked for the manager & he substituted it with asparagus & corn that we STILL PAYED FOR! My friend said something & they gave us a free dessert (Cheesecake is definitely recommended, very moist) The manager was more pleasant than the waitress & interactive because our waitress never came back to see if everything was alright.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster tail

N9HPmzVXGlwGaoGwg3kMJg.text: Wow .....amazing service attention to detail food is 100% 5 star last week was my first visit and I can promise you it won't be my last and please if you go is a must to order the bacon as an appetizer is delicious....cheers and enjoy a great place !!!!

LQ-tEfUBCJohA8DOnGo3iA.text: DRINKS Kettle One & Don Julio - really good! They make it perfectly strong.   Sesame bread & butter- yummy!   SALADS Cesar salad- scrumptious!!!  Romaine & cheddar cheese- so good, nice and crisp. Next time I'll ask for them to cut my pieces.  -Cesar dressing & avocado ranch- omg, fabulous!!!   MAIN ENTREE  I ordered: Shell noodles with white sauce - I wish I could say it was great, but it was way too salty. Mac-n-cheese light salt - Rich, very good. Dense, I'm not sure I'd order it again & I love cheesy pasta.   Sides: Creamed Corn with no peppers- incredible!! Loved!!  Spaghetti squash - Amazing, next time I'll ask for no pistachio nuts.  Tower of Onion Rings- too Salty, unbelievable to look at. The presentation was incredible.  Mashed Potatoes- way too spicy & salty. They also had chunks of potatoes and skins.  My friend ordered: Scallops- 9 out of 10. Good. Sesame Tuna- 8 out of 10. Not the best, not the worst.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac-n-cheese light salt - Rich, very good. Dense, I&#39;m not sure I&#39;d order it again &amp; I love cheesy pasta.

9dABXTfYV5vN7KAwxAoSKw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the City. Sadly I am going to give them an overdue break.This particular experience is now the third consecutive in which the food preparation or service were far beneath this restaurant's stated standards and certainly well beneath one the cost of dining here demands. No longer isolated incidents I brought my family here for an a Sunday brunch; it was not busy and relatively quiet. Our waiter was a train wreck; shockingly. Not well trained, ignorant to daily features and fine dining norms and struggled to have a conversation in English longer than a couple sentences. I could honestly go on about the service but just assume there was no aspect of his contribution that was on the level. At one point my wife and I became disappointed as we listened to a waiter present daily features to a neighboring table and there was a dish I would have definitely ordered had a known about it. When our appetizer arrived it could not immediately be placed because our waiter pre-placed a dish setting that didn't belong with our order and the delivering staff had to stand there with our food for a bit while a colleague ran to get something appropriate. When our meals arrived they were cold. Cold. Not "I wish this a bit hotter" cold; I mean 'left in the heat lamp window at Denny's while the wait staff finishes there cigarette by the dumpster' cold. One of the meals was an aged prime strip! Boiling hot sides and cold entrees. Frustrated I asked for a manager, who ended up being one I am not familiar with, and he creepily stared at me from an uncomfortable close distance while I explained our issue. Could have just been me at this point except my 9 year old daughter remarked on the man's behavior. They recooked my wife's Benedict and I simply asked them to put mine on the grill for a minute to get it hot. To recompense they comped our appetizer, which unfortunately felt hollow as I can't remember a single apology from our waiter or the manager.

RN7uRGqfSD2DiVYkuFrApQ.text: My first time visiting the southpark location & I must say my expectations were exceeded! From the apps to the entree...everything that came out of the kitchen was on point! My absolute favorite thing was the crab cake. Great restaurant, with an awesome ambience and delicious steaks!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent wine selection
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Prime ribeye, au gratin potatoes, and cream corn.

Kr2kC9ZGsKWrGMvoOW0RPg.text: It was hands down, the best crab cakes and steak we've ever had! We were treated like royalty. Our server, was absolutely amazing. The food was absolutely incredible, the drinks were top notch, and the service we received was more than 5 Stars. We will absolutely be back in the near future. They offered to walk us through the wine cellar, after I was amazed that their wine menu had a table of contents, but they were busy so we declined. Thank you for making our Anniversary one we will definitely remember!

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

5Gegp29sikmHomIlvNtmlA.text: Del Frisco's is the bar to measure all other restaurants by. From the moment you enter your experience will be of fine dining in a rich but friendly environment. Professional and attentive staff will guide you through the extensive wine list. The pepper bacon appetizer is memorable and everything I have ever had here has been perfect. Really, treat yourself and come here, if only for the happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Onion rings could be their own meal!

rJLTJ_fiG5XoWYVlQLaWwg.text: If I could give 0 stars I would. The staff is extremely rude, especially the GM Buddy. Honestly they are the most pretentious group of people I have ever met and I have visited steak houses all over the world. The food is over priced, over rated, and over salted! I will never be back to this establishment. Would highly recommend Morton's or Ruth Chris any day.

_QyL-ihu0GS7oVvF279qDA.text: I've gone to Del Frisco's for many years now. The experience has always been nice and the food has been good. The only reason I am giving Del Frisco's 4-Stars is because of their pricing. Their steaks are fantastic and definitely worth the price but their are a few items that are not worth the price. For example, the lobster tail at MP was $120 for the night I attended; the lobster was decent but slightly over cooked and the flavor was not wowing. Most recently I had the Sesame-Seared Tuna, the presentation was nice and the Tuna was well prepared, needed approximately 30 seconds long on the grill. The sauces on top of the Tuna was very good but not enough to get the full effect of the thick piece of Tuna. I also think they could come up with a few creative specials for the night/week. Overall I do enjoy Del Frisco's and would recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sesame - Seared Tuna

C3JOLt2du3g4NZwSbOguXQ.text: I will preface this with "It was Restaurant Week..."  The service and food last night were exceptionally mediocre. We'll start with the Chilled Shrimp Sampler the shrimp themselves were amazing, the sauces that the shrimp were pre-dipped in not so much, namely the cocktail sauce which was really nothing more that Hunts Ketchup... 40 minutes later our salads and soups (lobster bisque) came, the soup had a great flavor and a large amount of lobster, would have unfortunately been the highlight of the meal had it been hot, soup was lukewarm at best.   For my entree I ordered the 45day dry aged ribeye, which I was pretty excited about, however we waited over an hour from the time we finished our cold soups for our entrees to arrive, 30mins of which we spent with no drinks. So here we are 2 hours and 20 minutes after being seated the food finally arrives,. I ordered the ribeye medium rare and this steak was less than rare(purple no juices), and completely cold to the touch, but the 2hour wait killed my appetite as well as my motivation to eat, let alone complain and wait another 45min for the new steak to arrive.  So $194.00 and 3hrs and 10min later I finally got out of there. But then again... It Was Restaurant Week, so really this is all my fault. #sarcasm

r1wBJQpDIbOg_MN-mjrAfQ.text: Hand down best steakhouse in Charlotte!! I ordered bone-in ribeye and lobster Mac and cheese! What can I say! After eating here and Oak steakhouse and other places. I wouldn't waste my hard earn money elsewhere. Del Frisco got my wife loving steak again! My wife order crab cakes and corn (which my waitress Amy recommended) was delicious. Amy was very attentive and recommendation made me just want to have her serve us again and just order for us next time!! Thank you Del Frisco's

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. DEL&#39;S JUMBO LUMP CRAB CAKE
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BONE-IN PRIME RIBEYE*
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tomahawk

v9RXG98wc7yMu3WJ9lYpaw.text: As always Del Frisco's was amazing. My bf and I were late for our reservation and had to wait a minute but ended up finding seats at the bar right away. Lucked out and the Warriors game was on TV right in front of us which made this California transplant super happy. We ordered a few drinks and food off the restaurant week menu. Loved the habanero grapefruit margarita, I'm a big tequila fan. We ordered the salads to start which were lovely and basic and done well. For entrees I had the crab cakes and he had the filet medallions. Love love love both, filets were cooked perfectly and crab cakes were so much crab and not filler and delish. Took our dessert to go, after a bite, the cheesecake, yum! A great meal but really great service to go with. Michael at the bar was very attentive and personable even when they were packed earlier in the night so props to him. Manager even came over to apologize about the reservation which was so nice since it was 100% our fault. Phenomenal food and great people, love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cakes

vL_OBDv__-Jd8bGUi5wjGA.text: A top notch steak house with very fancy feel. Treated a large group of my clients and we all enjoyed the food, ambiance, and service very much. Arrived early and hung out the bar, where the girls were fantastic! They were very attentive and carried awesome conversations. All drinks we ordered were great.   Once we were seated the great service and drinks continued. The tables were elegantly decorated and the service was even better.   Decor-very fancy and elegant. Dark mahogany wood adorned the walls and they had subtle lighting throughout. Two stories of tables and even have additional bar upstairs.   Service-Fantastic! It's definitely amount the best I've ever experience. Waiter was polite, helpful, and had a smile on his face. They served us promptly and continued to bring what was asked of them.   Food-again, amount the best out there. Rid eye was perfectly cooked and seasoned just right. Meat was tender and juicy and packed with flavor. Lobster Mac and Cheese was rich and creamy. Everyone was extremely pleased with what they ordered.   Tip-enjoy the bar before being seated and engage in great conversation.

ZvclIKSuG9Oosgo-DEzHkg.text: Visited on a Saturday for Charlotte's Queen's Feast.  Just a small wait before being seated in the wine cellar.  First time sitting in the area.  Would be great for a date night. Lots of low lighting. Server and additional staff were good. Ordered: spring mix salad w/green goddess dressing.  Very good & large portion,did not finish it all. (May have been full on bread) The Filet Duo - one filet medallion had Bearnaise sauce (tender and delicious) the other had mushroom sauce (rather dry and required a litter extra chewing, accompanied w/chateau potatoes and sauteed green beans. Dessert (to go)- the banana bread pudding - outside crust one step above burned, was glad I had my own ice cream at home because it along with the Carmel drizzle was definitely needed. Slightly taken aback at the $4 unsweetened tea.  This was my second visit during Queen's Feast.  Last year was definitely a better experience as far as my taste buds were considered.  (Should have gone with the crab cakes as before).

Jm0Gh8Uv9puIK0KonJmPpw.text: A great dining experience. The steak is cooked to absolute perfection, the sides are delicious, and the desert is to die for. Every waiter is your waiter so you are given excellent service. I recommend making a reservation. They have a beautiful outside dining area as well as indoors.

Xs7StggV69pQG_j1kDW68Q.text: I know every great restaurant can't hit it out of the park with every customer.  I know this is a great place.  My experience was less than stellar.  I was dinning with my boss in June of 2017.  I ordered a special that night and when it arrived, it was horribly over seasoned (salty!).  I wanted to be sure it wasn't me and my boss took a taste and agreed with me.  By the time it got resolved, my boss had already eaten most of his meal.  I thought I'd just get a bowl of lobster bisque.  When that arrived it was cold.  My boss had finished, I was fine with what I had already eaten.  I'm sure they took care of the check as I wasn't paying and didn't look.  All in all, that night, at our table, the food was not what I expected and I'm sure not up to Del Frisco's standards.  Again, I know they are an amazing place, I just happened to be one of the unlucky that night.

aNIQgo32tUizAYxOPzptog.text: We had the chance to have a family dinner there while visiting our son who live in Charlotte. All I can say is this is the BEST place to eat if you're looking for a great steakhouse. I fell in love with the King crabs legs for appetizer that I asked for another order. Foods is phenomenal, service is great. Charie and Pam were the best servers from the time we walked in including others that served us as well. We thank the Manager for giving us the private room.  We will definitely visit again next time we are in beautiful Charlotte.  From California.

g0iKuquZY5bsavvvmDgJwg.text: Probably the best steak I've had in Quite some time. The service is impeccable and the atmosphere is really nice.

tnRB8S456D63GFU2Os2WRA.text: I realize I'm months behind on this review, but nonetheless it's time to hit "submit" and let the world know of my most recent experience. I save this upscale restaurant for special occasions. My husband and I stayed in Charlotte over the Christmas holiday this year and decided well in advance that we wanted to return to Del Frisco's for our special holiday dinner since it would be just the two of us.   The original server we had over a year ago got a promotion and went from server to manager (at least that is what it appeared)...too bad for us because I remember he was an excellent server. The guy we had this time had a pretentious disposition about him and it made us uncomfortable. Plus, our server had another table next to us of approximately 6 people and his attention was definitely focused on them. However, the rest of the staff were pretty courteous and attentive.   We ordered the special seafood for two course meal. It was okay, but for the price it really lacked the extra special holiday dinner feel. I was actually pretty disappointed and wished I would have ordered something more like a signature dish.   Needless to say this holiday dinner was quite the disappointment from service to dinner especially because we had already experienced fine dining and service from here before (so we know it can be done).

xLgflvcyhxxU1wyhg4J6nw.text: Went just left after queens feast and unfortunately the service was the reason for the three stars. We aren't drinkers and we felt when he realized that, he was finished with us.  As far as the food, our steaks were cooked beautifully and we couldn't have made a better choice

v8CfM3gywiGsbpRGXmlOpQ.text: Soooo yummy. Funny part my ex BF gf was my waitress haha. She was nice and sweet :) food and service was excellent. Best scallops this on on my top five with STK and Trulucks

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make sure you bring the leftovers home

DhJv3HujTceZN_9ewrnLQg.text: Restaurant Week Review  Del Friscos is beautiful. Make reservations, they fill up quickly. We snagged a table about 3 hours before we stopped in no problem, but it does fill up by 6:30pm.   They synchronize their hostesses in an all black uniform... and blonde hair. You heard it, blonde hair. Our waitress Rachel was very nice and the 2 boys at my table approved.  Wine. There are 2 huge lists but they have affordable ones that start at around $30.  Bread: Mortons-style. There is one huge, round piece of sesame crusted white bread in the center of the table that you can rip pieces from. The butter is whipped.   8 ounce fillet: YUM YUM YUM. So delicious.  Chateau Potatoes: Decent.   Garlic Broccoli: Their special side of the day. Very good garlic broccoli.   Chocolate Mousse: Very chocolatey, smooth, and generously portioned!  Strawberry Cheesecake: It's a lighter version of a cheesecake, not as dense. I kind of prefer the dense Cheesecake Factory style NY cheesecake =X   Great meal for a great price. I'm so glad I came for Restaurant Week!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate Mousse
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. 8 oz Filet

zrlnKmBwshx1rnQlM6qpYg.text: This is probably the most 'high class' restaurant I have been to in Charlotte.  The lighting and decor are very nice and the ceilings are extremely high.  This is the kind of place you would want to go to for a celebration or a nice evening.  On Sunday's you can order a 4 course dinner for $49.50/person, but I split it b/c it is a ton of food....so it is more like $24.75/person (not bad!). Plus you get delicious bread and butter which you will devour by the loaf.  Courses: 1. Del Salad- This is way better than you would think.  The bacon avocado ranch dressing is nice, but the giant piece of perfectly cooked bacon set on top of the salad is what makes it.  2. 8oz Filet & Lump Crab Cake - Self explanatory....both were really good. 2a. Steamed Broccoli - It had lots of garlic and some light balsamic sauce...I ate the whole thing...  3. Cheesecake w/ strawberry sauce - It is so light and tastes great.  Hybrid of cheescake and whipped cream.  The wine and service was great as well.  I do not like it as much as Ruth's Chris...but it definitiely surprised me.

joyzSsm0wQCQIHPVztz-5w.text: This is a lovely place to get together with friends or that special someone in your life. It looks like a fancy restaurant that you might see on your favorite daytime or nighttime TV soap opera. After the valet takes your car, you walk into the soft lit restaurant and are warmly greeted by the hostess. There is an impressive sweeping wooden staircase that commands one's attention. My sweetheart and I sat in an oversized booth with a linen tablecloth and candlelight. The waitstaff promptly addressed us.  I  ordered the salmon medium well. I substituted the regular tomato and capers sauce for the soy ginger and wasabi pea sauce with a side of braised red cabbage with goat cheese and walnuts. Absolutely the best salmon I've eaten! The cabbage was an unusual combination, but one I hope to duplicate at home. It's was quite tasty. My Hunny had the beef medallions, green beans and potatoes. It was also very good! I ordered one cocktail, which was perfect! Be prepared to spend some dough!! Our bill came to $98 before gratuity!! It was a wonderful dining experience. My Hunny warned me not to make this my favorite restaurant, but of course it is!!  :-)

z0qrzBcihYF9ePxJnu6uhA.text: I have been a fan of Del Frisco's ever since it opened in South Park.  IT HAS CHANGED.  We had a 7pm reservation for four for a business dinner on a Wednesday night.  We walk in to a bar crowd that was sketchy (kindest adjective I could come up with).  After waiting in the edge of the overflow bar crowd for 25 minutes, and constant prodding of the unsympathetic, excuse-filled hostess, we were finally seated (on a Wednesday, with a reservation).  They had a two server concept going on.  Both were friendly, but neither knew what the other was doing.  They pushed the Wagyu Tomahawk Chop, 32 oz. Ribeye Long-Bone.  We were told it was plenty of steak for two.  We took their advice.  When it came out, we literally said, "Wow, that's great that they went ahead and divided it into the two portions."  But that wasn't the case.  That was our entree to split.  After a few bites of the steak, which was half fat, we were still starved.  We ordered deserts all around.  After about 20 minutes, we had a server go find one of our two servers to bring the check, oh yeah, and the deserts. There is more, but I am tired of typing..... When we left and were asked about our experience by those at the hostess stand, we express our discontent.  No apology.  No empathy. NO RETURN!

VdX_jdmpH33NGC_35rWghg.text: I went on a tour and an awesome lunch , the salmon and baked chicken was awesome, the veggies was just right and to say the cheesecake and chocolate mousse was great.

HQcb52O4OjF7p9jIv0tO4A.text: Got the prime pair prix-fixe summer special.   To be honest i expected to leave this place with enough room for dessert in my stomach. NOPE, i was stuffed, if you get prime pair it will be plenty of food! Obviously teh steak was amazing but the sides were awesome as well. Probably one of the best, if not the best, crab cake i have ever eaten.  You will not be disappointed, service is excellent.

Wq93ShzS9-6VSvhGLPVzwQ.text: Great atmosphere and outstanding service, the food just pairs with everything! Del Frisco's is in line with Morton's and Ruth's Chris. Can't really pinpoint if it is better or worse but I would stay it is at least the same. I still think that the Dressler's Restaurant has a better steak though.  There are a lot of people complaining about the price... seriously? If you would like a $9.99 steak go to Outback. This is a prime steakhouse, prime steakhouse has prime service and prime food, that costs money and in exchange has excellent quality. If you are paying $40 in a steak and it stinks it is a different story, but with Del Frisco's you will have a much better experience than any other prime steakhouse I have been to.

bhDL0JLXexrg1r8etEZt_Q.text: My wife and I went to dinner on a Saturday evening recently. This was our first visit. After 20 min. wait, we were given a table on the second floor near the bar. Reservation was done two weeks before. The atmosphere was noisy with TV screens on over the bar. Wait staff were excellent. The steak was very salty and vegetables good. We felt the menu was over priced and food marginal. My steak was not prime, but choice. Ruth Chris is same price and far better food and atmosphere. This is an expensive high end sports bar.

W20aGM2N6yxYcMbBhftW_w.text: The steak was great! I had a 8oz fillet and it was delicious. I appreciated the server asking me to cut into my steak to make sure it was cooked to my preference. The meat used and cooking is quality. The restaurant, decor and service all ooze quality. I don't frequent many expensive restaurants, so I wouldn't visit often, but for special occasions. Our group definitely had a great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheesecake for desert!

DHaKSXXIWrRM4YMePirEVA.text: Girls' night out with a friend. Great food, great service, a lovely evning in all aspects.

0ImbHHNYSLrHbYIg4dGH8w.text: Wonderful dinner!  Del Salad, Steak and creamed spinach was outstanding.  Great service and atmosphere. I would highly recommend Del Frisco's.    I will definitely be back for dinner.

p7cGhJJc9oZiOeqZScMAQA.text: Del Frisco's is an upscale restaurant with EXCELLENT service.  Extensive wine list. The calamari was interesting.  Different take from a traditional appetizer.  Salads were normal...the Del Salad had slices of bacon instead of bacon bits.  Over cooked and salty.  I had the filet, my husband had the rib-eye.  He was quite happy with his choice.  Said it was as good as Flemming's,  better than Ruth's Chris. Chalet Pot. were too peppery for my taste.  Dessert and coffee, normal.  Overall, I would say the food were on the acceptable caliber for the style of restaurant.  It is in the South Park area, so the clientele was of THAT level. Service was outstanding.

Ev6a4jTrMW9CRgtVUrbI8g.text: My wife and I dined here last night. Our server Bobby was superb!!!! The food was cooked to perfection and delicious. Our first visit but definitely not our last.

BoBq2KJ01d97i4R0gccCng.text: This was one of the best steak restaurants I have ever dined in. I will not necessarily grade the beef higher than some of the quality Fleming's establishments I've eaten at, especially since I had a trio of 4oz. filets; however, the overall quality of each of our courses was stellar.  I absolutely recommend this in Charlotte for business entertainment or a nice formal dinner. Bring your checkbook, but it's worth it.

1Zjv_XVoOoJ_kP_mYE5i0w.text: The two stars are only for an exceptional steak.  Appetizers, customer service, and sides were beyond sub-par, particularly for the price.   We asked for a sommelier and instead were delivered a bottle of wine that we did not order.  It was fine, but not great.  It took nearly 30 minutes to arrive after asking for the sommelier.  The tuna tartar appetizer was swimming in a soy-based sauce.  The tuna could not be tasted.  We asked the waiter whether an empty oyster shell was acceptable.  Without speaking, he took the shell in his hand from the table, then delivered another after several minutes.   Our $50 steak and lobster combination with no sides provided a terribly overcooked lobster tail.  Had anyone asked how my meal was, I would have let them know.  Sadly, I was never asked.  The mushroom side was also overcooked and swimming in sauce.  The manager offered to let us choose two desserts as an apology.  We were never provided a dessert menu.  Two desserts that we would not have ordered arrived without comment. The list goes on and on.  This was a tremendously disappointing $500 dinner in Charlotte.

FC8nVUxRGh-A9_3RDxGLFQ.text: The hostesses seemed disorganized and confused. We had a reservation but they just sort of left us standing around in the front. It was pouring outside so we were stuck standing awkwardly with our drippy umbrellas. Good thing the service got alot better once we reached the dining room  Our waitress was phenomenal. She told us all the specials and was very attentive through out the whole experience. It was my dad's birthday and she made sure it was a special night. We even got dessert on the house. She deserves a raise.  Now the food was pretty great too. We shared the Caesar salad(nice zesty anchovy dressing) filet mignon(tender) ribeye(fatty and flavorful), Australian lobster( huge! 14oz tail of a monster) Seared tuna( didn't try this but my mom liked it) and sides ( mushroom and creamed spinach) The portions were huge. My brother said the croutons on his salad were as big as ice cubes! the waitress also told us to cut into the meat first before eating to see if the temperature of the meat was cooked correctly.   Very extensive wine list and 1/2 off glasses Fridays meant I got my fav napa valley cab. I also managed to tip over my glass which is a testament to the fact that I had one too many.   The chocolate lava cake they brought out at the end with my dads bday candle was so nice!   All in all it was a great experience. Now we just have to visit the one in manhattan.
