1JL4cM5aO4Un1UgyaKdR_A.text: My experience at Del Frisco's for restaurant week was nothing short of AMAZING. Sylvan was our server and he was absolutely the best. I had lobster bisque, with crab cakes and bread pudding... each part of the meal was delectable. PHENOMENAL. Worth every penny and more. The portion sizes were larger than expected, the aura was beautiful, it was just a fantastic time.  I'm recommending them to EVERYone for all their romantic steak house needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. BREAD PUDDING

ZEONzwWflWKyy4U6TVBbrA.text: Brought a couple clients there recently to lock a deal. It was their choice and I was fine with it because I have been to DFDE in Boston, NY and Philly and all great experiences. I ordered the ribeye medium-rare, as I usually do, and regret was disappointed. I understand that medium rare keeps the center not as hot as a more "well temperature" however, the whole steak was actually cold even the outside and I couldn't even enjoy the delicious crusting from the sear.   The potatoes au gratin also came out pretty cold which led me to believe that although the food was prepared by good chefs, they might have prepped some of it it a bit too early and maybe had no room under the heat lamp.   When I told the waitress about my steak, she quickly Tried to make an excuse instead of just offering to send a new one or heat it up. She said "Perhaps the steak was cool because the others in your party (my clients) ordered their meat well done and since their meat cooked a little longer maybe mine sat because the staff made an effort to ensure we all got served at once...  I was shocked! Correct me if I am wrong to assume but shouldn't an establishment of this caliber regularly be serving the food altogether as it is surely a common practice? Nevertheless saying that to me in front of my clients was completely embarrassing, especially after I spent $1300 on five (5) total people.  I really don't know but definitely not a normal experience at a DFDE.

lTNDpEZ_cqkp5GO8q2cjpQ.text: What can you say...it's Del Frisco's!  For those unfamiliar, DF is a chain steakhouse that is anything but your standard chain.  The food is immaculate and consistent whether you're in Vegas or Charlotte, NC.  There are two must-haves on the menu: 1. The crab cakes and 2. The VIP martini.  Fair warning, it's not cheap, but you definitely leave satisfied.  We had the pleasure of being served by Kevin, a short guy (sorry) with a big personality!  He was attentive and went above and beyond to make a special day, our 10 year anniversary, incredible.  Simply, DF is a place to go if you want a really nice meal.   Pro tips: 1. Be sure to let them know if you're celebrating something, they have a surprise for you. 2. Try going during summer or when they have the "prime pair" ( a limited dinner menu for $60ish that includes a salad, cut of meat, crab cake, side, and a dessert)

nHzEt0__DhPJTP3FXO8_eQ.text: Came here for my birthday with business colleagues. The waiter Thomas was very helpful and explained everything in details. The food was amazing and very flavorful. I has the octopus for the first time so that was an experience. The Anejo Old Fashion is a good starter drink as well. We got 5 appetizers all not pictured but everything was good. Presentation was more than I can ask for. Also the pound dessert cake was perfect. The ice cream topped it off. Thank You Del Frisco for another great Birthday experience.

IOoV0wesxilZTV-z4WJQRQ.text: 8/25 had another Great dinner  It was my friends birthday and they put a white rose on the table and a birthday card for her very nice touch  Our waiter Patrick was Excellent  Food drinks and dessert was excellent  A manager come over to see if all was right and it was This is a Excellent restaurant and they know how to treat their guests makes you want to come back and we will  Mmm13/18 Had Dinner here last night Excellent  Drinks Wine Food Service outstanding!!! Buddy Edwards the GM came over to make sure everything was OK Our waitress was Excellent  Will go back often One of the best Reataurant's in Cha  Had a Great dinner here tonight A Birthday celebration for my companion and her son  and daughter-in-law joined us Tyler our waiter was excellent and so was the food and wine and drinks A very nice touch was a Birthday card signed by the staff  for the Birthday girl And the GM Buddy Edwards come over to wish her a Happy Birthday and bough Desert a very very nice touch  Will go back as often a  7/13/19  Had dinner here with friends last night as always  Food drinks service was Excellent  Our waiter Scott H was very good  We will go back as often as possible  One of the best restaurants in South Park and maybe even in  7/26 had dinner here last night with friends  As always everything was EXCELLENT!!! It was part of Reataurant week and the choices were great Our waitress Tiffanie was also EXCELLENT and very professional  Food Drinks Service was Great And a very nice touch was that the GM Buddy Edwards always seems to have the time to come to the tables and check if everything is O K really makes you feel welcome and gives us a reason to keep coming to this restaurant as often as po  Had dinner here last night  Excellent!!!! Food Service were all Great our servers Eleanor and Sherry were terrific!!! However the valet staff was real bad Gave them stub and was waiting a while and then saw my car in front of the Taco restaurant told guy at valet he said "would you like it to be pulled around" I said Yes Then it disappeared!!' When I saw another valet guy he said he was told to re-park my car Took over 1/2 hr to get my car Really didn't do anything to make my meal bad  But someone should check on these guys!

oxhRuHsiKmUMnS5D_a3dLw.text: I was not impressed with the staff at this restaurant. I called to inquire about the happy hour food specials at the bar and they told me they have $8 bar bites from 4:30P until 7:00P. Cool.   When my friend and I arrived to the bar, we were informed they haven't had the $8 bar bites for 6 months. they do have bar specials for food, however, they are not $8. That is fine, but the staff who answers the phone should know this. Secondly, if someone chooses to get the bar specials and sit at the bar, they should not be treated differently than customers buying complete meals. I felt as if the bartender was not interested in helping us because we did not order a $40 steak. My friend and I were catching up, having some wine and wanted something to snack on. It has nothing to do with what we order or how we should be treated because of it.  The bartender rarely checked on us. We had to flag him down if we needed anything. He did not offer us water when our food came, I guess because we had wine. Well, I enjoy to have water just in case while I'm eating. He didn't even bother to follow up when we got our food (from someone else who delivered it).   I have no problem spending money on food. But seriously? If you don't want to care about customers who order something on "special" solely for that reason or because you're afraid you may not get tipped well, then don't have specials at all.   I was surprised and pretty disgusted with the customer service. The food was decent. I enjoyed the Philly steak eggrolls, so I gave 2 stars. I won't be back here again.

WV8QcY5zbThpqFJz6z8fbw.text: Made a visit for Queen's Feast. It's probably the best deal out there for Queen's Feast. Complimentary valet parking up front (but don't forget to tip). We had reservations at 7 on Saturday. We had to wait a little bit and the bar was crowded. However there is a bar upstairs that was empty. We ordered the lobster bisque which was a little salty but still good. We also got the 8oz filet and crab cakes. Our medium rare filet was melt in your mouth with the perfect amount of seasoning. The crab cakes were mostly lump crab meat unlike other places were it's mostly breading. We also got the strawberry cheesecake and the banana bread pudding with vanilla ice cream and caramel. We loved the latter! Definitely a nice date night place :)

8YrjcaF3o6pML2zyC8sRpQ.text: Super service and food! Went for restaurant week and had the crab cake dinner. We sat at the bar bc we didn't make a reservation. Classy atmosphere and all about the customer service experience! I wish other restaurants would take note to their business practices. Thank you to the Bartenders for a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake dinner.

CXOzba8IOVmQp0CmE_vu4w.text: I love coming here. It's about my 3rd or 4th visit and i fall in love even more every time. Of course I had the VIP cocktail and ordered off the restaurant week menu. Great selections on the restaurant week menu...the crab cakes were delicious, pairings-string beans and mash, perfect. Well worth the visit and certainly more than $35.  Definitely recommend, even if ordering off the full menu!

FfWmMNYvV1pD59gvFt91Yg.text: A bit disappointed with our experience tonight. The steak was 3-star at best. Service was 2-star for a restaurant in this class of restaurants . We were asked  at phone confirmation for the reservation and twice during dinner if we were celebrating anything special. We noted each time that it was our anniversary. We were asked to save room for a complimentary dessert to celebrate our evening. Nothing... I mean nothing came as we observed other tables with a card and really nice dessert plate. No big deal. We didn't chose this place for a freebie. I have a habit of a wanting a Coke with my steak. I reminded our waiter 3-times before the steak and he still forgot. My wife reminded him after the steak arrived after I opted to give up.   I had $500 in a dinner experience for two people that was not up to par. I have visited two other locations (Philliy / Dallas) and this was just disappointing. Too many other places in Charlotte that offer a better experience.   The highlight of the meal was the lobster Mac and cheese. The rest was pretty mediocre.

ibtsnuGrLzSjJ-Ue34RM2Q.text: My momma, her friend, & I went for Restaurant Week. My momma is very picky and rarely likes everything about a restaurant. Her friend was hoping they offered a non steak option on the Restaurant Week menu because she isn't really a steak person. I knew Del Friscos would please them both or at least I hoped. I was right! They both enjoyed their steak dishes! Our servers, Cassie & Scott, were very attentive which was impressive considering how busy they were!  Before leaving they were trying to decide when to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Three ladies out for a great evening!

-N4Y2ILOXBqtIoS4ecYVwg.text: This used to be our favorite steakhouse but.. Robert B was absolutely displeasing. He rarely came to our table and didn't even introduce himself to us or wish my boyfriend a happy birthday which the hosts did. Robert never once refilled our water glasses which were empty as well. He was short with us and when taking away our plates he grabbed the knife so quick he almost grazed me with it. He visited the table next to us frequently but made no attempt to make our visit memorable. He also forgot which one of us got which dessert. He really made our experience here disappointing because we came last year and had an amazing server so we decided to come back. In this case we lost our appetite and we wanted to leave more than stay.

tF4ayScRHfAzG3WNFbAHHA.text: Steak was ahhhhhmazing. Service was pretty good. Would absolutely return! Atmosphere was decent. Very high end.

hQFM0WAPPSQ0lL0MHGfbKw.text: Excellent steak house. Came here with friends for restaurant week. The atmosphere in this place is brilliant with the high ceilings and decor. Service is great, seemed like they had multiple servers serving one table or something because someone different would stop by to make sure everything was good. Lobster bisque was deliciously full of flavor but not overwhelmingly salty. The dry aged ribeye I ordered was flavorful and cooked almost just right. It was mostly mid rare but more on the chewy rare side as the further I cut into it. The oscar topping was delicious as well. Would highly recommend.

DeDCHWLAcK5qAKMRmj542A.text: Kevin and I normally go to Ruth Chris' for our birthdays as they are a day apart.  My sister got us a gift card to Del Frisco's to give them a try instead as they enjoyed it in DC.  We tried to call a week early for reservations on a Saturday and all they had was an early bird special or last of the night reservation.  We declined and waited probably over a year until we thought about it again earlier this year.  We decided to try them for our anniversary two weekends ago and this time called two months ahead in order to book.  When we arrived, we were a few minutes early but we were seated right away.  We were brought water and bread as we browsed the menu.  The bread was great, nice and light with spreadable butter!  I decided on a glass of wine, which turns out to be my new favorite wine.  It was awesome - and Del Frisco's almost made me upset as I could not find it locally and the big box wine stores would not order it for me.  Luckily I found a local store that would order it for me, and I am now happily enjoying more of it!  We decided to split the ribeye with two sides - au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach.  The steak was perfectly cooked and tasted great, although I have to give the edge to Ruth Chris here because I think it was almost too peppered down.  Chill out on the seasoning and just let the steak be the steak, and I think it may have had the edge.  Ruth Chris and Del Frisco's have both of the sides we had.  The creamed spinach wins easily here, it was wonderful.  It's hard to say which of the au gratin potatoes I liked better as they are very different.  Ruth Chris has more creaminess with sliced potatoes, while Del Frisco's isn't as creamy, just very cheesy with cubes of potatoes.  I think both are great for what they are.  Lastly, we ended with dessert - the chocolate molten cake with ice cream and the butter cake with ice cream.  This is an easy decision, the molten cake was awesome.  I think the butter cake would have been better if it were a soft cake warmed up with the ice cream melting on top.  Instead, it was a thick dry cake, and almost crunchy on the edges, as if the cake was overdone.  Would not order that one again.  My issues: The music was LOUD.  When I go to an upscale restaurant, it should be nice and pleasant, and people are having to talk louder because the music is so loud.  Also, it's not as if it is pleasant classical music or what I would call fine dining music, they were playing current music like Maroon Five.  My other issue:  I don't like how a couple guys come to the table to bring you your food, and then they start serving you your sides.  It just feels chaotic moving around the table.  Just set the sides down, let us have our peace and serve ourselves how much we want of each side.  Overall, very good meal.  Just wish the music and service was done a little bit differently and I would give them the edge over Ruth Chris.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate molten cake and butter cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. ribeye with au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach

1XFPQuzrCEFFJIrOo9BJ0w.text: Del Frisco's is my husband's favorite steakhouse in Charlotte. While I am not a huge steak fan, I can definitely say, they're doing something right here. He says the steak cuts like butter!  I typically opt for a seafood entree and of course, the lobster mac & cheese :)   Service is always wonderful. Food is always great!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. RW 2019. Lobster Bisque. Was just ok. Oily &amp; a bit spicy. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love spice. Just never had a spicy lobster bisque.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. RW 2019, crab cakes &amp; mashed potatoes. Crab cakes were underdone. Took it home &amp; cooked it more. Potatoes definitely needed seasoning &amp; love

vCMGZepO5__8I6xiBC33bQ.text: Went on a Daddy Daughter Date. Thanks so much for making my daughters 21st birthday special. The food, service and ambience were all Great! Thanks so much for a special time.

xKIYSR3Zc1XNREGrdBMS1A.text: My friend made reservations for a Birthday dinner, which happened to be Easter Sunday.  The restaurant wasn't crowded at the start of dinner around 7pm but by the end of the evening not an empty table in the house.  Complimentary valet is a plus.  Staff was very attentive, very friendly  & welcoming.  Very elegant restaurant with a nice ambiance.  Food was superb, I ordered a pre-fix option which started with ceasar salad, main dish salmon & 1 lump crabcake with a side of asparagus it was delicious. The  waiter was kind enough to advise that the side portions were shareable so we may all want to get something different so we'd have options which we did, so I also had garlic potatoes & creamed spinach.  When we first were seated there was a Bday card on the table signed by the individual staff members that evening and the end of dinner she received a complimentary dessert. Valet dude even took a group pic for us in front of the restaurant. Looking forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy salmon &amp;lump crab cake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sides plate of asparagus,garlic mashed potatoes and creamed spinach
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

SLGarKd7FWnsh69Rol7-hg.text: Fantastic service and well made food. My fav on Friday's. They will go above and beyond to customize their menu. In the photo is their sea bass and crab meat on top. It was very good. Grilled octopus was cooked to perfection. Tuna tartare and friend calamari are a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

Yv2NtrPgA_XMfJm4sOKhtQ.text: As always, Del Frisco's is a top notch place with best-in-class food AND service (thank you Pamela T)!  Was in for no reason other than wanting a good steak, lobster bisque and lobster mac n cheese. Not the cheapest place you can dine at but you pay for what you get; great atmosphere, great food, great service and extensive wine list. This place will not disappoint.

cPhCdCgAyIadzpzFEA-emw.text: Sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful weather before it started to rain. Great option... weather permitting! Cocktails: As a Hawaiian, picking The VIP was a clear choice! Svedka clementine vodka with fresh pineapple juice! Yum!  Starter: 1/2lb King Crab Leg. Came out with melted butter in a nice setup. The crab was already cracked and open, so definitely a convenient way to eat crab at a nice dinner. Dinner: The Sesame Seared Tuna steak was the best I've had! Loved the temperature and the wasabi creme was a perfect match!  Side: It felt like Thanksgiving picking the loaded sweet potato. Cooked very well and with the marshmallow top, dessert was not needed! Definitely recommend Del Friscos!

Alls81IfT9voqZzu0qo4JA.text: The food and atmosphere was perfect for a date night or business dinner. We had a cozy table and the noise level was on the quieter side. The food and drinks were great and other than our waiter, the wait staff was amazing. Our waiter was preoccupied serving the table of 4 beside us whom we tried not to but ended up complaining about on our way out for yelling and the incessant stumbling into our table and knocking my purse over and a drink. We didn't eat dessert because we were extremely fed up after 2 1/2 hours of trying to enjoy an intimate dinner alone. We were passed off to another waiter to bring us our drinks and food for the entire night. But when it came time for the check our original waiter was taking credit for the night. Im trying to stay positive because I believe we just had a bad experience due to the people around us. Might try it again in the future.

RKYO2PDoAvFpqUvOPfBN5g.text: I'm really very disappointed with Del Friscos.  My boyfriend made a reservation for Valentine's Day a month in advance, & we still had the only options of the 3:00pm or 9:15pm reservation. No big deal, we understood that this was a busy night for them. When we arrived the restaurant was half empty.....  The Valentine's Day menu did not offer much in the way of options. Steak, steak, & more steak. I get it, it's a steak house. I decided to go with the 8oz lobster tail. Which was surprisingly HUGE, I was not complaining. Boyfriend got a steak cooked to perfection. The table stayed dirty. If at a less expensive restaurant, I would never even comment on this, but this stands out to me when the check is going to be $150+. Drinks were very weak, but of course very expensive. So now is when things really started spiraling down.  When we received the check my lobster tail was $120!!!!! Jeeze!! I asked the waiter to explain & I guess he had rang in the 20oz tail. They did correct this, but blame shifted it on us. I WOULD NEVER EVER SPEND $120 on a lobster tail.. That's just bonkers. Before we got the check, my boyfriend went outside to inform valet that we were ready to go. I noticed a long line of people at the bar waiting for their cars. 30 MINUTES LATER! Still no car. 45 minutes later NO CAR! Boyfriend outraged spoke with the manager, who was sarcastic and had a serious attitude. Valet lied and said that they had pulled the car around, but reparked it due to no one coming to get it. Lies! The manager could only respond saying it was a 3rd party valet company.... Okay so what? If they suck this bad, get another valet company.  We will not be back. There are plenty of high end steak houses, with more class in Charlotte fortunately. Capital Grill remains my favorite.

Ckt--CQ-WcJGRPnCNJxYUg.text: Christmas Eve 2016 - Of course, extremely busy. Service was good, food was maybe slightly above average. Family dinner went reasonably well, UNTIL ..... I had to use the restroom. The men's room stall (1) was absolutely FILTHY!  This was totally repulsive. I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS NASTY MESS.

PKFlTXRzEjwCK7EF2r8R4w.text: Service and atmosphere was great. Very disappointed with the Tomahawk ribeye steak which is supposed to be the premiere dish and based on the price you would have expected that. Unfortunately there was so much un chewable grit and ligaments through out the meat that it was difficult to enjoy. Embarrassed with constantly spitting out the unchewables.

hDgItkUmDim_29jhLYRQPg.text: Upon walking in we were greeted by a very nice hostess who seated us to our table. That was the best part about our visit. We sat and waited for over 5 minutes and no one ever came to our table. I understand that you close at 11 but we are paying customers and to never have someone come over and greet us, offer us water/take our drink order is unacceptable. Highly disappointed. If I could give 0 stars I would

EI6D83MKqWxi0EWqyLrmzA.text: Very disappointed.  Had a meal there on Wednesday.  The tuna steak I had was terrible.  Very "stringy" and not a good grade of tuna.  I guess I should have been smarter and had steak but assumed since this is a high end restaurant anything on the menu would be good.   also, the cheesecake I had for dessert was literally the worst piece of cheesecake I have ever had in my mouth.  The texture was like firm cottage cheese.  I took one bite and got rid of it.  At least the asparagus and smashed potatoes were good.  Save your money and go to one of the other many good steakhouses in Charlotte.

M5_iCUt1LjqzNLhXq0ZDnw.text: Alone on business looking for a steak and chose DF. Waited at the table for 20 minutes and never even acknowledged. When finally recognized the server asked how I was doing and walked away. Never been so humiliated and left. Worst "high end" treatment ever. Save your money and your self worth and go where they appreciate every client.

4xwZryroTUAQK0UCEFXTQA.text: One of the best steaks in Charlotte without question.   Steaks are always top notch. Best cut I've had there is the bone in filet. Also best calamari I've ever had...with a great Asian sweet and spicy sauce. For sides, I'd highly recommend the mashed potatoes. They have a little chipotle in them that give a slightly smoky and spicy flavor.   Lastly, the service is top notch. Servers always have a smile on their face and very personable.

Eu0oCVc3oGGxfA1Hwu4aGg.text: What can I say,  I love this place. Been here a few times when out in Charlotte for work and I can't wait to go back!!!  The filet is awesome and the service is on point.

EIUOP_ITp14wIpO4DUYLtQ.text: We went for a BD celebration. The service we received was excellent. The potatoes were good but was very heavily seasoned with pepper. The fillet was high quality and tender and texture was smooth what you expect in a good cut. The only thing was it was way too salty, could actually see salt crystals on the outside of the fillet. If I return I would definitely ask the chef to hold back on salt. It is on the expensive side so for the price and over salty steak, and overly seasoned potatoes can't quite give it ...

PyyW07npCAXjoUKrCc5Neg.text: Seriously the BEST steak!  We went for our 40th Anniversary.  We were greeted with a hand signed card and best wishes all around.  Our waitress, Jennifer, was so charming and thoughtful.  Her service was the frosting in the cake to a perfect meal. And the manager stopped by to wish us well and complimented our dessert and coffee.  This is my place to go when I want it all!  We were very touched by our great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Anniversary wishes from staff

sMztYLgqaZRAmi1nruhSBw.text: Always a great meal. Never had a bad steak. Service is impeccable. Have to wait a little bit before being seated but worth the wait. Food is amazing. Last night they gave a a complimentary dessert for my birthday.

az3zv1iHSLHrrMcTNOhX9Q.text: This review is based on two visits here recently. I had never been here before and had heard great things from most people. I was a little torn with the 2 star review, as the service was definitely very good and attentive, but overall I have had equally good service and better food at many other steakhouses. The decor is nice and fancy, but I just can't get past the food.  For the first visit, I naturally went with a steak and chose the ribeye, which turned out to be an average cut and preparation of meat. It was marginally overcook past my desire for medium rare. My criteria has always been, if I can make a better steak at home, why am I bothering to go out and pay extra for it, and this steak fell into that category. The fried oyster appetizer seemed to be thrown together with poorly fried oysters. The best thing on the first visit was probably the calamari.  On the second visit, I thought that I would try a special for the night and I went with the scallops with ramps. This meal wound up being a tale or meal of two stories with half my dish being bland and the other half being over salty. By this I mean that half the scallops were under seasoned while the other half were over seasoned. I am not even sure how this is possible. I was halfway through the dish by the time I realized this was the case. Again the calamari was the star of the evening other than the fancy wines being ordered by others during this business type dinner.   One last thing, I just wish that one steakhouse had the guts to try and venture out with some new side dishes other than the tired same ones found everywhere. I guess the star of the show is the steak, so they can't or don't want to change the approach. I think based on all that I have expressed "meh, I've had better" is appropriate.

da87fhP-606Km4XuloEdlg.text: I am writing to make you aware of the poor service and food quality we received on Sat  September 30, 2017 at the Charlotte, NC location. We were a party of 10 that was in town for a work related conference. One of our customers suggested we give your restaurant a try. Our evening started out pleasantly. After receiving appetizers, it took almost 45 minutes for someone to return to remove our dishes . We waited at least another hour before our entrees were served. Our entrees and most, if not all, of the accompanying sides were lukewarm at best. Steaks were not prepared as requested. Some of the vegetable sides were cold. Upon asking for the manager, our host was told they would "comp" us a few bottles of wine. When one of the other guests suggested that the food was not prepared per NC food codes and in fact could have caused illness. Another manager offered to remove the food charges.  I'm am quite sure your company would be as dissatisfied w/the poor level of service as well as poor food quality. Unfortunately, as the meals took so long, we had time to talk w/other diners and we saddened to hear at least 4 other parties had experienced similar experiences that evening.  I'm very disappointed in the extremely poor quality of food and service for what is known as a top tier restaurrant.  Perhaps your corporate office should investigate this location,

au7gNt6Gdcg4cB9Vf0D-9g.text: Always a treat to come here!  Celebrated my birthday here last week and it was perfect.  The staff is so knowledgeable and friendly.  We decided we wanted to have seafood and shared crab legs and lobster tail.  Wow!  Perfectly cooked-and great portion size.  The sides were also amazing-had the onion rings and Brussel sprouts.  We usually get the lemon cake but went out on a limb for bread pudding and it was delish!

rlEyTleq1sKcG0aq4AGIBw.text: We were 4 of us for a business dinner! It was busy and crowded! We sat upstairs, and we were very well taken care of the waiter, he was the best thing during the whole evening! My stake, bone in ribeye, was more than OK, as well as the cocktails! Some of us had oysters, they were good! The crab cakes also passed the quality mark, but the scallops as an entree was sub par! Further it was noisy, very difficult to hold a conversation. Maybe we should have picked a table outside, instead!

SgihWDSnlDHpWzU3dSze5A.text: I've been here several times, this restaurant is high end, it's fancy, the atmosphere is really one to just enjoy, the interior design is classy, this's not your average restaurant, this is top notch, the service is awesome, friendly, above all the food is high quality and yummy, we had the crab cake and the sea bass, you can't go wrong with either choice, the sea bass is my favorite, good size and the best sea bass I had. Yes, this restaurant is pricy but for the decor, lay out, service and yes, the food, the price is right.

jloYa1ork5HVCaBNmhJqKQ.text: My first time to Del Frisco's and I am in love with this place.   The ambiance was great, and I have nothing but good things to say about their prime pair. The steak was cooked just right and melted in my mouth, the crab cakes side was equally amazing.   I would definitely recommend this place.

j2i2dKzs0_xKLrS0WZ2qrQ.text: Best dinner ever!! We had the lobster mac n cheese, crab cakes, Wagyu 32 oz rib eye medium!! Everything was perfect!! Seriously the best crab cakes... No fillers just yummy crab meat in a spicy malo based sauce ... Yummy. And the lobster mac and cheese had a good amt of lobster  and so buttery Mac and cheese... The calories were worth it!!! I have ever had... My new favorite steakhouse.  Also for dessert we had the butter cake dessert ... It was amazing. So amazing we got another one to take home!! It didn't last 2 hours at home lol... Must try ... It's seasonal !!! The Wagyu was good but better the next morning... The fiance wanted to try it and he probably would try something else or maybe medium well being it such a huge steak! But the next morning in the oven cured it well... Yummy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wagyu 32 oz bone in rib eye medium
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cakes ... Best!!
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster mac and cheese... Delish

5ftijYvh_usMWrqM3ywyPw.text: Del Frisco's is pretty tasty. It is in line with all the other high end steak houses. The fillet was cooked perfectly to order but I did not have anything that really knocked my socks off. One minor complaint is that cokes are the little glass bottles, which in my opinion, is awesome, until you realize that the coke is not chilled and it is poured over ice in a glass. Come on, who doesn't like a cold coke straight from the glass bottle.   I will say that the cheesecake's crust is very good. It must have some ground nuts and a bit of cinnamon and nutmeg in it. Most of us as the table took a few bites of the actual cheesecake filling, which was fine, (I prefer dense cheesecake rather than airy) and then ate all the crust around it. Now if they just served that crust crumbled over a housemade ice cream, that would have been worth another star.

M3SHoNtiDRVEIDa3i7rYAQ.text: Simply the best for steak and an upscale dining experience. Staff is knowledgeable and accommodating and the wine list is extensive.   Have been to this location multiple times for dinner and brunch and never been disappointed. Not pretentious like other high end steak houses can be.

sIY72-nXmlOstX7EMkEw6A.text: I have to say I expected a one of a kind experience and I was underwhelmed. Whether it's Tuesday or a Saturday, if you are charged top dollar you expect consistency. I was dining as part of a work function so I didn't make a big deal, however I will think twice before returning. I asked for a sparkling water with lime, the server didn't bring the lime on a plate and forgot to bring me a new one for twenty minutes.  Two other ladies at my table had to wait just as long for their wine order and had to remind the server multiple times before she delivered.  I was also confused by their explanation of how they cook their steaks. I was a professional cook in a kitchen for a year and if you tried to tell my chef that medium was essentially more like a medium rare she would laugh in your face.  Four of the steaks at our table were undercooked considerably, and I love a well prepared mid-rare steak. The last thing I will mention is that as the servers were coming around to take the plates of those who were finished, I asked that the remainder of my steak be boxed up. I was very disappointed that no one returned with my steak.  Maybe this evening was just a perfect storm of coincidental mistakes, the restaurant is beautiful and the steak seasoning is like no other.  I typically wouldn't take the time, however Del Frisco's is a popular destination in our beautiful city, and if the consistency becomes priority it will flourish even more.

LaoxxolzCjjXXRIXE3M9kg.text: incredible food and atmosphere. filet was prepared perfectly, and they offered a great deal on drinks for "winding down" on fridays. we will be visiting the other locations!

UYQUuHp668Fu0Wlw9QmRkg.text: We found this restaurant by searching Yelp and after reading all the reviews and looking at the website, it appeared the perfect place to celebrate our 23rd Valentine's Day together.  Indeed it was!  Beyond a doubt, it IS pricey.  We both ordered the 12 oz. filet mignon, shared a bottle of Robert Mondavi '05 Cabernet and thoroughly enjoyed every minute.  The meat was cooked exactly as ordered and was DELICIOUS.  My husband is certain it's the best steak he has ever had.  In addition, he tried their VIP Martini . . . pineapple infused with Vodka - WOW!  It was the tastiest martini ever.  (So tasty, we're going to try our hand at making one at home.)  Our waitress, Kenyatta, was delightful - personable and very efficient.  We observed all of the wait staff working seamlessly in unison . . . all of the employees seemed to get along perfectly and serving us was their foremost thought.  We were happy to tell the manager about our great experience, and he also was a delight, kind enough to come by our table right away, at our request.  We will look forward with great anticipation to our next meal here. WORTH EVERY PENNY!

WZnrvLF4QYnngkE2OVXrNw.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of dining out at Del Frisco's while all the golf Glitterati were in town for Quail Hollow. It was quite a sight! We had a reservation for 8pm and it took about 15 minutes or so to get our table - however, we pleasantly passed the time at the bar. Being 7 months pregnant the busy bartender whipped me up a delicious juice cocktail and only charged us for my husband's drink - unnecessary but really nice. Thumbs up from the start.    Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, making mostly excellent suggestions and even offering to split our salad knowing I was hesitant to order an appetizer and a salad before my meal. Our waiter suggested my husband and I share a crabcake and a 6 piece shrimp cocktail - each shrimp with a different sauce. Fabulous suggestion - great way to start the meal! The only hiccup at this point was that we were not served any water for at least 20 minutes after being seated. My husband had a drink so he didn't care but I was parched!    For dinner, I ordered the 8 oz filet and my husband ordered the strip.  Our waiter suggested the creamed spinach as a side dish. By far, my filet was the best steak I have ever had. Perfectly cooked, beautiful light pepper crunch in every bite. I savored every forkful! Unfortunately,  the spinach was kind of bland so I took one bite and decided to enjoy my pure-beef meal instead of lessening the experience with my mediocre side.   We opted not to have dessert - maybe next time we will skip the apps and give dessert a try. When our check came we were double charged for our appetizers but our server apologized and quickly returned with an amended check.    The service was truly seamless and never stuffy. Great food, great service. Fantastic place for a special night out.

W6HSk2H8MggmXgwdaHLzIg.text: Steak is fabulous, the best I ever had, but there is nothing really wrong with any other meats on the menu. Truly anything is excellent though. The best deal is a 3 course meal during the queens feast. $30 for 3 courses. Beat deal in town.

XtGZhuwWbjMGxkQsk0k6kA.text: How can anyone say this is the best restaurant in Charlotte...For starters it's a chain oh yea and a steakhouse SHOCKER people like it!!   I came here for a Christmas dinner a year ago and have not returned it left a bad taste in my mouth Literally!! They over season everything and ruined my steak!!   I didn't come here with high expectations and lets just say it lived up to that! our server was ok she was sweet from what i remember. However they're Sommelier kept pushing over priced bottles of wine onto my boss that he finally told him "we will just waive him over when we were ready"   Haven't been back and won't be. I'm sorry but there is food outside of chains and steakhouses in Charlotte why not support them!!

F4pp0dpDTS9y7dLaXeagwA.text: Always, always, always delivers great service, great ambience (for a steak house) and great steak.  Personally, I think the bone-in filet is far and away the best steak to be had in Charlotte.  For those who want to complain about price -- you don't walk into this place looking for a "deal" (other than during restaurant week).  Truth in advertising: this is one of the most expensive restaurants in Charlotte.  It isn't like they are trying to hide that fact and pull a fast one on their customers.

pVvrSrFvoWWpJULAmLJMYQ.text: Class Act!    I just took some customers out to dinner here, and we had a great meal and a great time.  From the moement we walked thru the door it was great.    I think what pushed me over the top for Del Frisco's, is they have specials.  I do not mean featured items for the night.  They had wine discounted for the night.  This is somewhere I could see my wife and I going on a Thursday night out for a nice relaxed dinner.  Bring your cc with you because it isnt cheap but they do have rewards program also....

qhT2N0ZSOQYd1Tgo9brwYA.text: I had the pleasure of dining here with the girls and what a time it was!  The atmosphere was nice and cozy, but busy at the same time.  The food was just splendid, as well it should be for the price.  I started out with the turtle soup, which was pretty good, but I think the salad would have been better.  The filet mignon was the real deal, unlike Ruth Chris(sorry)....it was tender and flavorful.  I really like this place, but I'll limit my visits to restaurant week or half-off coupons:-)

sn7oUXBE7MeNpRWfX_9lqA.text: Sure, it's a chain. But that doesn't make it any less delicious. And you cannot beat their Restaurant Week offering. Unlike some places that choose off-menu items for Restaurant Week, Del Frisco's features its 8 oz. filet (usually $38), a salad and your choice of chocolate mousse or cheesecake. Service is always top-notch and the decor gets high marks. The one negative is that they don't have any beers on tap; bottles only.

Z2VjXdHfMyHveO1e_Jj2hw.text: Love this place!!!  This is our go to place for dinks, appetizers, celebrations, etc.  Their pineapple martini is one of the best and the tuna sashimi appetizer is a must every time I go.  While the food is excellent, the service is what keeps us coming back.  We usually make a reservation and we have never been let down with our seating time even on the busiest of nights, but we occasionally show up just for drinks and apps and the service in the bar area is top notch as well.  The servers and bartenders are courteous, polite, professional, and always make you feel welcome. The bread pudding is also a favorite to go item for us when we have a sweet tooth.

Fk59fPQcpM38gRTtmSss7w.text: My family and I dined last night for restaurant week 07-22-15. We had reservations for 630 and were not seated until 645. A little annoying but not a big deal. While we were waiting outside the hostess gave us ice water and checked on our table which was very considerate. Atmosphere was great! Nice and open, floor to ceiling windows with a dining area on the main floor and upstairs. Very clean, organized, staff was welcoming and accommodating. The bread and whipped butter was amazing. I would have liked it pre sliced instead of whole. That way your party won't have to put their hands all over the loaf. Cutting the soft warm bread was a challenge with a butter knife that was not sharp enough causing the the bread to flatten and compact. My wife, daughter and I ordered the filet mignon medium rare with Ceasar salad and cheesecake or bread pudding for dessert. We did not care to much for the Ceasar salad. It had a slight bitter taste taste to it but was not horrible. Our filets were cooked and seasoned perfectly! The filet was extremely tender and in my top five of best filets. The mashed potatoes were slightly lumpy not the worst I have ever had and a little to much pepper. I recommend asked your waiter/waitress to hold the pepper on the potatoes and add pepper yourself. As far as the filets, they nailed it perfectly. For desert, my wife ordered cheesecake and my daughter and I ordered the bread pudding. Many posts on yelp say the bread pudding is amazing. This is the first time I ever had bread pudding and my daughter and I did not care for it. So I would say it's a personal preference. I did not order cheesecake because I'm one of the rare few people on the planet who does not enjoy cheesecake. I tried my wife's cheesecake and I was blown away. BEST CHEESECAKE I HAVE EVER HAD! The cake was not rich and tasted creamy like a very heavy whipped cream. Regular menu prices were pretty expensive. Unfortunately it's a place I would not attend on a regular basis and only special occasions but they are a good bet. I did feel a little rushed by our waitress maybe because it was restaurant week and they were a little busier than normal. Check was delivered before I was finished with dessert and bread was taken away toward the end of our entree without being asked if we were finished. Overall, I was very satisfied with their hospitality and the quality of the meat. I would recommend them and I go would back.

378Q001alUL6WKxkSzHGxA.text: I came to Charlotte for a business trip and wanted some steaks.  Looked up yelp and decided to pick this place.  Ordered the steak and had the tuna as starter.  Great service, awesome food, kind of pricey for Charlotte but definitely had a great dinner here? Will come back next time in Charlotte.

JbXiUtOt7Hig0Pj4JB5UKw.text: Had dinner now for the third time at this location and can definitively say this is not fine dining.  Apparently know one has ever been to a real fine dining restaurant as this place would have 2 stars consistently. This is essentially Olive Garden but more expensive.  Servers, you set with the left, you crumb every meal, you take with the right.  Serve the sides with tongs instead of two upside down forks.  Fundamentals!  Also, when I ask you the size of the scallops (U10), you should know that off the top of your head.  And scallops are cooked to temp so ask!  I don't want to know about your kids or have a long conversation with you.  You are here to be the backdrop to a fantastic experience instead of endearing me to your personality for a tip.  What a disappointment.  This is the most overrated place I have ever been to in my life.

tH0oSOlrr4W7cckVEn8jSw.text: For the past two years I have taken my son here for his Birthday. For that special occasion he loves it.  I travel nationally and have spent 30 years eating at every kind of restaurant imaginable.  Del Frisco's knows how to wait on a table. They bring out a server for each person at the table so you are all served at the same time. I have always thought this is a great piece of theater for any restaurant.  They serve good steaks - good quality meat.  They have an extensive wine list.  The food other than the meat is nowhere near the quality of the meat. I know this is a steak house and so maybe no one else cares. But over the past five years or so I have enjoyed watching restaurants  set themselves above their competition by paying a lot more attention to the rest of the meal beyond the meat.  We had mushrooms and creamed corn. I would guess that both came out of a can or jar from Institutional Food House. The mushrooms seemed micro waved. The creamed corn traded some spices for being actually creamed. No cream anywhere near my corn.  I would enjoy Del Frisco's much more if the sides were fresh and local.             Maybe from the local farmers market.  If the sides were as good as the steak it would certainly make this more of a destination.  At this point it is a place to take someone once to impress them with how much you spend, not with how much you enjoy great food.

WMV4-8OS4vbh6wHTRZ23tg.text: Went to Del Frisco's for a rehearsal dinner for a wedding.  Amazing ambiance - we sat in the wine cellar - great space, great lighting.  Staff was excellent - they knew the menu and options, served everything together and were quite friendly.  Appetizers were scrumptious - esp the tuna, and served in a great spread.  Dinner options were beef and salmon (9 out of 10 had beef).  It was perfectly done for each person (but a bit salty at our table).   Highly recommend.

1vE-pSuCzZCfgBH-24cAQw.text: This place is amazing.  The service was the best I have ever had in a restaurant in Charlotte.  Food was all top notch.  I had steak and wife had crabcakes.  Even the baked potato was mouthwatering good.  It was all great.  Ambiance is wonderful also.  Only catch is that it is very expensive, but it was so good its worth it.

qud_zAktO1JN189IdNgvjw.text: Love Del Frisco's - if you can swing it, one of the top places for a meal in Charlotte.  One of the few places that feels as grand as the prices.  Wine list is among the best in the city, but you definitely pay for it.  Great for special occasions or if you want to impress.  Servers are all top-notch and the food, practically perfect.

sSpNeiIjJbncQAQ_BrKKJw.text: A great date night spot. I have yet to have a bad meal here. Their steaks are always melt in your mouth, even their salads are some of the best I've had (Del's salad is a must try), amazing crab cakes, the best banana bread pudding, the list goes on. The only negative is the price. However, they do have a Prime Pair menu in the summer, and they participate in Queen's Feast.

7ZNLp_V5_279OFDrBvwotA.text: Made a reservation and showed up on time. I still had to wait twenty minutes while they seated five other groups before me. All without acknowledging me, I finally asked how much longer and the hostess had said they were waiting for a table to open up and again seated two other groups. Getting frustrated I told her I would wait outside since there really isn't any place to sit and wait besides the bar she then said my table was ready.             Mind you I went in for date night on a Sunday, ordered a steak and potatoes green beans. Green beans were crunchy and flavorless the potatoes were awful bland mixed with skins . The steak was the best thing on the menu. Lobster bisque Soup was salty I about died of thirst during dinner.  But here is the kicker : how long we had to wait for our food I watched people get sat down after us and their food had came out before ours. I am talking about at least four other tables, We waited 30 minutes for our soup and salad and an additional 45 minutes for the steak.  In which a manager comes with his flashlight to ask if it was cooked to our liking, Not I am sorry for your long wait. I mean this is an upscale restaurant we shouldn't  have to wait over an hour for our main entree.     The service: waitress never came buy to check on us had to track her down so we could get a refill on drinks. Even then she was a bit rude and acted as if we were bothering her. I had told her I wanted a glass of wine and with that she opened up the bottle section were they are selling the 2500 dollar wine bottles. I just wanted a glass of wine not a bottle or a 2500 bottle at that. She had taken our order and that was the last I would not see her again until the check, she didn't ask if wanted so nothing else or if wanted more drinks nothing. The service was awful do I have to buy a bottle just to get my drink refilled? Service is sub par and the food mediocre.

2I6GT4Xwmzoms3bTzRg6TA.text: Had a great time and a great meat at Del Frisco's!  We sat outside.  The weather was just right.  Our servers Alex and Mona Lisa were great! They really took care of us.  The Manager Buddy came out to see how we were enjoying our food.  I will definitely come back!!!

fPOkB2MTpF7CdN3EEvpvXQ.text: Del Frisco's was delicious. Went during restaurant week, which is the only time I can afford this restaurant lol.  Service was slow since they were busy but the steak was one of the best I've had.

JUmZCznrEgT-pAfJ07yIug.text: The standard for Charlotte steakhouses. In a city with many choices for a steak Del Frisco's clearly stands tall. Their steaks are second to none. They are well seasoned perfection. There's simply not a better steak in the city.  The service matches the steak. No other steakhouse does it like Del friscos.  If you want the best then look no further!

VUO8DqLkMaFUbFa4gHINMQ.text: Del Frisco's has a reputation for being one of the nicest steakhouses in Charlotte. That being said, I think it is a nice restaurant, but not the best. The steaks  are very inconsistent with how they come out. The drinks are way overpriced for what they are. Overall the food is tasty but not worth the price. Now the atmosphere is wonderful and it is generally a great vibe in there. And, if you're spending a lot of money, they would definitely tend to you great.  Del Frisco's, please consider this; If a customer is sitting at the bar and they order a cocktail or glass of wine, it would be so nice if you offered some complementary olives or chips as many other fine dining restaurant that I've been to seem to do that.        To pay what you charge for a cocktail and it's not even overly strong, you need to offer a little bit something more.  I stopped going here because of how overpriced they are. I would love for them to rethink about some fun perks at their bar to get a newer and more lively crowd in there.

f4eGt09bUX0psm_X6P_Zvg.text: Del Frisco's has a wonderful ambiance and the Christmas decorations were tasteful. The service was fantastic as our table had three staff taking care of us. We had a group of 10 so we split a number of the appetizers and sides. All of them were good but the real stand outs were the calamari and the lobster Mac and cheese.  I cant stress how good the lobster Mac and cheese was. I tried both the VIP martini and the bacon and barrel cocktail. The VIP martini was fantastic, that is a strong recommendation. For my meal I had the dry aged rib eye. The quality of the steak was of the highest quality and it was cooked well.  I have eaten steak all over the country and this was easily in the top three I have had.

KY4axiZhLUKx-Qyrnr1vGw.text: Shame on Del Frisco's  I eat here all the time but was very annoyed last week.  Three specific things, which need to be fixed asap and are inexcusable.  I must have picked all the wrong items last week.  First, the bar menu has a shrimp and scallop ceviche which sounded delicious.  On arrival it was clear that this is not a ceviche, but a mayonnaise based shrimp salad.  Upon inquiry, the manager admitted that the seafood was boiled and not cooked in citrus acid and the description was misleading.  Second, I was trying to choose between the heirloom tomato and burrata salad or the beefsteak tomato and onion salad.  The waiter recommended the burrata.  Upon arrival, the tomatoes were roma and cherry tomatoes, not heirloom.  Another apology.  Lastly, the wine I ordered was a 2012 Napa Cabernet (a fine year for Napa Cabs).  The waiter brought the 2013 because they were out of 2012.  Very sad.  A fine dining establishment like Del Frisco's should not be misleading its customers.  I eat here all the time but its going to be a while before they regain my trust.  Shame, shame, shame.

WU91h6_VWFH8xofGtdcnNw.text: Del Frisco's will always be an above average dining experience, but this particular location never disappoints. It's convenient location makes dining an easy ritual after a day of shopping at SouthPark.  From my experience, it's best to make reservations.  I've almost starved waiting during "high volume times" lol.  Their lobster tails are huge, tender, fresh, and cook to perfection.  Pricey for a normal dinner, but definitely worth sharing for special occasions.  The filet and ribeye are great, and the salmon on the menu is great.  The special I had this weekend was less favorable, but still good.  Crab cake has virtually no breading.  I'm not even joking when I say the wedge is noteworthy (I know it sounds retarded to mention, but seriously.  I think it's their blue cheese dressing I'm in love with).  They have family style sides, so show you care...share.  Additional thoughts: -I'm not crazy about the creamed corn; it's a little bland compared to others I've tried. -The sweet potato casserole is a must!   -The spinach is creamed, so for those carb conscious diners like myself should get the asparagus. -If you start on the bread you probably will never stop. -Creme brulee is **white chocolate** (OMG) -PRIME PAIR is an AMAZING deal, but theres significant up charges for some substitutions.    Oh, and the wait staff is a hit or miss, and the floor has been a little slippery at times so be mindful of footwear.  Ladies parts of the Barclay Downs shopping plaza is also hard to walk through in heels.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. This Salmon was featured as a special.  Not the original, which is IMO better.

Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is half of a starter wedge. It&#39;s a teaser really, but I have to be strategic when I eat here.  Everything is good.

K2KS0YGx3mSWquHP4w0tOQ.text: Want to love this...but always come up short. Service seems to be the biggest challenge: slow, order incorrect,...or something. Food is good. Atmosphere is good. Better values can be found in this category.

z7LmIWxUNjLeM9k8l4ksmg.text: First of all, the service was impeccable. Our server was extremely attentive, understanding, and helpful. He even shook our hands at the end of the meal which I appreciated. We started with the Beef Carpaccio. Highly recommend. It was so delicious. I ordered the steamed lobster tail... this is the only reason I'm knocking off a star. I took one bite and was overwhelmed by the taste of what seemed like cleaner or bleach. I could barely get the bite down. I asked my boyfriend to try a bite and he tasted it too. It was so bad that it burned my nose a bit. I had to send it back, which I have never done in my life. After we left I looked up "chemical taste in lobster tail" and it looks like an ammonia taste is a sign the lobster was not sourced from cold water and was not frozen quickly enough. I got an 8oz filet instead. Best steak I've ever had, hands down. The staff was extremely accommodating considering I was sending back a $120 item and replacing it with a $45 item. We will be back, but definitely won't be ordering the lobster.

PBogof1t6YOZ6tCJWpjT3w.text: This has been a regular spot for us but we have been very disappointed the last few months with service.  They used to have amazing bartenders and it was a pleasure just to walk in.  Now it's hard to get their attention to place an order it's  a whole different feel than it used to be they lost friendliness and welcoming atmosphere that used to set them apart from other restaurants. Yet the bar isn't any more crowded than it used to be. The bar menu hasn't changed in years the turnover of staff is apparent.  It's not the same and overall a disappointing experience after they had set the bar so high.

CCR6_xcD5qzz9qWoeeBUyQ.text: Horrible! First, we waited 45 minutes for our dinner to arrive. I order the roasted chicken which came with fingerling potatoes, oyster mushrooms and corn. The chicken was so small, there was only 2 fingerling potatoes, 3 little mushrooms and maybe a tablespoon of corn and it was $33.00! The whole plate was room temperature and took about three minutes to eat.  My husband ordered the lamp chops that cost $49.00 and that was all for that price. No side dish, just the chops and they were cooked to almost well done and he ordered them medium. His side dish was $15.00 extra.  My son enjoyed his 2 crab cakes, but for over $30.00, they were a small portion also. 3 domestic bottles of beer was almost $20.00? Why? We sat with empty dishes for over 15 minutes before someone came to clear them away and waited another 10 minutes before our waitress brought the check. It was my husbands birthday and I wanted something special, but it was a total disappointment. Never again. Lesson learned.

QetH38HxFI6LxWSI9LCuDw.text: So, turns out I forgot to write about this restaurant... Interesting. Anyways, my most recent at this restaurant was just this past week and this was my second time visiting this restaurant. Going inside, you definitely know that this place is a high class type of restaurant (at least going by the way it looks). Both times, I used the valet service because well, I'm too lazy to figure out where to park as the parking lots are a little hidden from the view. My suggestion is to go find it. Reserve your spot and arrive a little early to just do that.  The first time, when I ate at this restaurant it was busy. Our food came fast, it was good. No complaints there. If I did write my review then it would have been 4 stars, easily. This time though, lets just say as you can see my rating I wasn't so fond of it.  So sitting down we were given our menus and were told the prices of some of the specials they had. They had lobster tail specials, and were they expensive. $6/ounce and it goes up to $150 for I believe 24 ounces. Now, you must be wondering why so expensive? Well, they're "Australian Lobsters." Yeah, you heard it. Luckily my father had a mad craving to have lobster so he just bought an 8 ounce lobster tail for $48.   Now when they say just lobster, it seriously just a lobster. If you ordered it you would probably have went to go take out at a fast food joint right after this expensive meal. I mean, $48 at least they could have gave him a side dish or something to go with that lobster. Just a heated dipping tray of butter and well, an 8 ounce lobster. But, I guess that's something you sacrifice when you go to expensive restaurants. Money, for less food.  I ordered the special, pan seared scallops with basically mashed potatoes (which they named it a little different, something with "au gratin" which is actually just a way to prepare it.) The scallops weren't bad,  just nothing special in my opinion. I also ordered the Strawberry Romanov dessert which was actually just 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream with a few slices of strawberry and a piece of mint. For $8, that's really high class there Del Frisco, really.  Now, lets go onto the service. Note, my first time when I came here it was really busy and my food came out really fast. On top of that my party size was the same. This time, we got served an hour later. Within that hour, 30 minutes of that was with no bread, no asking of what we needed. Nothing. So, stupidly we just sat there talking and wondering where our service was. We had a table that sat behind us who came in about 30 minutes in and get their food faster than we did.   I think I have come to reason why this happened. When we were ordering our food we were a little picky on what we ate because of the price. So, I guess this is the backlash of trying to be somewhat reasonable to spend. Discriminating against those who didn't want to break their savings account for a meal.   I wish this review was only about the food, as I really don't like to complain so much on service. But, at the price we were paying for eating there I think everything should be perfect. Especially on a night when no one was there!   I won't come back here, unless someone else is picking up the tab and its a party. You can spend your money more wisely and if you do want to go to a high class restaurant I recommend you to go elsewhere. Big disappointment on the second time here, I guess this restaurant is one of those "One hit wonders".

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate Mousse, and Breaded Pudding topped with Cream and Vanilla Ice Cream (It also has a hint of banana in there)
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sautéed Mushrooms, Mashed Potatoes, and Cream Spinach

ScJtmDI_KBffKrqOpjjB6g.text: All I can say is WOW!  Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House is one great spot! It's located in South Park  in the Piedmont Town Center.   We arrived on a busy Friday night to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. We were seated right away and was given a nice card wishing us a happy anniversary - Nice touch!  We decided to forgo appetizers because we knew we were going to double up on some side dishes. I chose the salmon and my husband chose the shrimp scampi with pasta. Both of our entrees were great - cooked perfectly.  And the shrimp in scampi with pasta were gigantic! Now for our side dishes - we had the onion rings and the lobster mac and cheese.  Those two sides alone could make a meal!  The onion rings were down right huge!  They were crisp and hot.  And the lobster mac and cheese is the best in my opinion.... creamy and oh so decadent.with chunks of lobster - tails too, not just claws!  The service was very attentive and friendly. They treated us to a dessert for our anniversary and we chose the special butter cake with butter pecan ice cream.  Oh my! That butter cake needs to be a permanent fixture on the menu.  We'll be back - even just for onion rings at the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Butter cake!

nePAKuUcd4WA3tGsG0x3CQ.text: The steak was amazing and seasonrd to perfection. I am one of those people that have go have the streak just right with all the delicate extras but it was absolutely perfect. Now my husband and I went for a very special date night and probably would not frequent unless it is a special occasion but we enjoyed the atmosphere. The service definately complimented the price tag and doesn't limit the options at all. Our server had great suggestions and warm conversation. The service didn't lag during any point of the meal. Service in general was pretty seamless. Dessert was my favorite part I have never had bread pudding so moist that was so light with just the right amount of banana.  I will say to spend some time enjoying the meal and make sure you stop by the bar before the meal for some very tasty drinks.

uXe0F_NPq8k091JCO4r-CQ.text: Me and my Girlfriend made reservations for Del Frisco's and we were both eager to try it to see what the talk is. Unfortunately, we went during one of the busiest time of the year- Restaurant Week.  Upon arrival it was extremely packed. The waiting area didn't have any seating and was fairly small for such a popular restaurant. On a brighter note, there were no buzzers or any mechanized reminders to gold onto when your table was ready. The Hostess simply approaches you, asks your name for verification, and escorts you to your seating area. Not quite sure how they remembered which party was which but it was very unique. The upper lever was approaching capacity so we were taken to the lower level where they have another bar downstairs, a large area for seating, and a great view of all of the wines they have to offer neatly organized behind a glass wall. A sight to see for a first timer.  Our waiter immediately greeted us and began taking out order. We both ordered the Pineapple "VIP" Martini. They brought out a small sesame seed bread loaf with a small side of butter while we awaited our food.   The Chopped Ceasar Salad was simple, with lettuce, shredded cheese, and the dressing. Nothing too overbearing. My main entree was the North Atlantic Salmon. It was slightly bland in flavor but was cooked very well. Very tender and juicy. I came with some delicious mashed potatoes, a lemon for the salmon, and a soft cream sauce. For desert, the Banana Bread Pudding was absolutely extraordinary. Topped with whipped cream and drizzled with caramel, served at a pleasantly warm temperature. An absolutely delicious full course meal!  Of course the check can always bring disappointment at the end of a great evening. Overall, I would give this restaurant a 4.25 out of 5.0. Great ambiance, tremendous service, and delicious food. Definitely not a restaurant I would go to on a consistent basis, but the perfect place to celebrate any occasion. Just try not to celebrate it on Restaurant Week.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Bread Pudding
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. North Atlantic Salmon
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chopped Ceasar Salad

XO4kUgcUM_6Qh1dgJENw4A.text: I am updating my review for Del Frisco because I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. We went there this weekend for a special occasion and could not have had a better experience.   We showed up a few minutes early for our reservation and we were promptly seated. The hostess asked if we were celebrating anything special, information that she relayed on to our waiter so his first greeting was of congratulations, which was a small touch that went a long way to give the night that extra unique experience.   I started with the pomegranate martini, which was strong but smooth. We both opted for the prefix menu and I ordered a caesar salad, 8 ounce filet with scallops and the chateau potatoes. The salad was excellent, a rather large portion for a starter but I love the dressing and the extra-large croutons. The steak was cooked to a perfect medium, and the waiter who brought our food asked us to check the steaks before he left to ensure they were cooked properly. This was a great customer service experience that made me feel like the restaurant wanted to put forward their best on every plate. I am not sure how they accomplished it but the steak had that great chargrilled taste and crisp outside while the middle was tender and a perfect warm pink. The scallop pairing was sensational with a light drizzle of a delicious creamy lemon garlic sauce. The potatoes were creamy and well-seasoned and there isn't much more to say when you set them next to such an excellent steak and scallop combo.   We finished our meal with a decadent slice of cheesecake, and the manager stopped by our table to ask how our experience was and if there was anything else we needed. Del Frisco's definitely takes care of the diner from start to finish with excellent customer service and phenomenal steaks.

GKkeRK4km_KGJQTG5t5W5g.text: This place is always spot on. Wednesdays they have a special bar menu and drink specials which is great. The service is always great and the atmosphere is always busy and loud which i like. You have to give it a try and sit in the bar area for the best experience.

jYyBWtfRGFKWquiIQYyc1w.text: This is my third time visiting (bar area only). Bartenders are friendly and knowledgable and fast. There is plenty of staff nearby to take care of anything you need. I've had the pimento cakes - I cannot keep away from cheese and grits! - and this time lamb sliders.  Great wines by the glass, a little in the pricey but worth it. I'd like to see more craft brews but still a good selection of beers. The lamb sliders were perfectly seasoned and accented with I think goat cheese but I swear said tzaziki sauce on the menu in a yummy soft yet crunchy where it needs to be little bun.  The bar seats are actually comfortable. I can't stand wooden chairs or stools with no backs. A couple TVs showing sports and HUGE windows to enjoy the Piedmont Row view.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sam Adams summer seasonal and lamb sliders

akGNFHsMB_i--JlosbcXaw.text: To the Chef and Manager,   On your website the first thing I see is "...an Unparalleled Experience"  I've had some of the most exceptional and memorable meals at Del Frisco's throughout the years, (Dallas, Houston, Orlando) so it pains me to have to write to you anything but my utmost admiration. However, my disappointing experience happened during the dreaded restaurant week in Charlotte, NC between January 19th - 28th - our group of 6 came on a Thursday evening for an 8pm reservation.   *** Initial seating and ordering were as expected.   *** Some of our member ordered Ala Carte, some off of the RW (RW = Restaurant Week) menu.   The 3 men in our group, including myself, ordered the filet. The RW menu offered an 8 oz filet but I opted for the Ala Carte 12oz - Ordered Medium Rare.   All 3 steaks came out 2-3 minutes undercooked and lukewarm to the touch. The gentleman that brought the steak over to me asked me if I was satisfied after seeing me cut into the steak. I let him know I ordered the steak Medium-Rare and asked him if he thought the steak passed as medium-rare and his response was "it's very close, sir." (later in the evening the manager apologized to me and said the steak was indeed very rare as did one of the other servers). I let the server know I would not be accepting the steak as is and would like a new steak cooked. His response," Sir, we can re-cook this steak for you to your liking but normally we would not cook a new steak." This is honestly where I lost respect for not only the server but the restaurant as a whole.   No self-respecting Chef in the world would ever allow their staff to suggest re-cooking/heating up a filet mignon and reserving it to their paying customer. Once the cook is done, that's it. If you've messed it up - do it again with a new cut. This is why you pay the prices you pay at Del Frisco's because as a diner you are there to experience professionalism in dining. If the chef fails to deliver that experience on the first try I should never be asked to sacrifice the quality of the meal or the quality of my experience. I've held up my end of the deal. I've gotten dressed, I've put on some respectable dark jeans and dinner jacket, I've coordinated with the other 5 people in our party for transportation and timing. The culmination of events that led up to this moment is now in your hands. The experience and or lack thereof is now in your hands. You failed. Not me. Don't ever suggest to another customer that they should allow you to "warm" up their Steak because you and I both know that should never happen at Del Frisco's.   The manager suggested a 12oz steak would take 20 minutes to cook ( should be 8-10 minutes max) and that they had an 8oz steak ready to go that they could bring out to me. At this point I was so embarrassed with the exchanges back and forth that I just agreed. 4oz's of meat, whatever, just bring me what you have. I'd like to point out that none of our exchanges were ever heated or rude or anything like that but it was just embarrassing to have to ask for you to make things right by just bringing me what I originally ordered and to bring it to me cooked the way I asked for it to be cooked. I mean that's just like the basics of actually dining, right? All the rest of it like what color tablecloths and chairs are and color of carpet and what kinds of wine to stock, that's stuff sort of comes 2nd to actually cooking the steak correct, right? Correct me here if I'm off.   I will give some benefit of the doubt to Del's that RW is crazy and insanely hard to manage but this is still no excuse for poorly prepared food. If the food isn't perfect, don't serve it. I would much rather wait extra minutes for the meal and be satisfied with the Chef's accomplishments then to be sorely disappointed by a poorly executed cook.   Recap: (My fiance's Crab Cake were on the coldish side. She did ask for a new plate and they brought a fresh plate.  (RW Menu)  Gent's #2 and #3 filet's were undercooked and lukewarm (8 oz RW Menu). They did not ask for new steaks.  Lady #2 Sea Bass or maybe Halibut was delicious - well cooked (Ala Carte) Lady #3 Filet Medallions (RW menu)- I believe she enjoyed them but she did mention it was a bit on the cool side.

VNvOlV9y9tprCGfQi8CZsQ.text: We had fun and made the best of a bad experience.  We sent our steaks back twice.  We simply wanted well-done.  The first time we each had uncooked beef even though we detailed our desire.  The second time it simply felt like used food.  I didn't even taste it, my partner said it was not good.  Also, the shrimp appetizer was over cooked.  The bacon appetizer was good.  The $11.50 creamed spinach was cold.  They sell a baked potato for $10.50! Lol.  Must be one heck of a Spud.  They were all very nice.  The Manager came over and paid our whole tab (except we bought desserts we we're still hungry, and they didn't offer us an alternative). Naturally we tipped on the full bill as it wasn't the Wait Staffs fault, they were quite good.   The kitchen blew it twice... No three times.    We eat right across the street regularly at another well known steak house.  They never a miss opportunity for perfection.    We'll give them one more shot hoping for a meal worth the price and reputation.

SZJ7AVukAvTI3jmIOuFn4Q.text: My wife and I went here for my birthday and I was very impressed with the overall experience. While I would reserve to special occasions (unless your pockets are much deeper than mine), I will say that not only the meal was top notch for the price, but the experience is what would bring me back.  Upon arrival it was apparent they do some kind of pre-dinner meeting as every one of the wait staff I would randomly pass wished me happy birthday. It was a nice touch. After perusing the expansive book of wines they have in house, I settled on something that fit what we were looking for with the help of our knowledgeable waiter. From there I helped myself to too much bread (seriously, it was amazing) and an appetizer of a house salad for me and lobster bisque for my wife. Both were very well done and I was impressed by the amount and size of lobster chunks in my wife's bisque.  For our mains she did the 8 oz fillet and I did the 16 oz ribeye. Both were cooked perfectly to medium rare and I found both quite flavorful and not too drowned in butter like many high end steak houses tend to do. We shared a dessert and some after dinner cocktails, which the waiter heated my wife's frangelico with a neat apparatus that held a candle. Overall the pacing of the meal was very well done (you know it's good if you don't notice it until after the meal is complete) and we thoroughly enjoyed the evening.  Upon the ride home we received a call from the restaraunt as my wife had left her purse behind. I can say that neither of us have had a restaurant call us before, so it was a nice touch they figured it out and reached out to us. Small things like this along with the meal itself  helped me justify the price tag for special occasions. Thank you for helping to make our evening out memorable and I will certainly keep this place in mind for recommendations and future special occasions.

VhrpT4sYWbxx-1B59_VqSw.text: Great atmosphere.  The wine selection is very good with lots of folks who are knowledgeable and can help you pair it well.  The steak is very good with an nice sear to it.

4xO-wjvZpOn4DUWwd87TIQ.text: Fantastic atmosphere and wonderful staff. 2 steaks served almost cold. service was so slow I couldn't get help returning the second steak. I had to flag down another waiter. Ultimately the service was good until the steaks came, then it slowed down. Manager was very nice to comp a dessert. My first below par experience. I'll be back.

eUxRX0ZQ783BJztcsdNH3Q.text: We scored Friday night reservations during Restaurant Week. As expected the place was packed but we only had to wait about 10 minutes for our table.   The hostess was kind and quickly escorted us to our table in the wine cellar. It was a very nice space, but because it's so small it can tend to get very loud. However, our waiter arrived and was exceptional! He paid very close attention to our needs and offered great suggestions after we told him it was our first time dining there.   I started with the VIP Pineapple martini and it was delicious. Just the right amount if pineapple to compliment the liquor. For my salad I chose the Spring Mix which comes topped with blue cheese crumbles, onions and balsamic dressing. For my meal I ordered the Filet which come with the standard chateau potatoes and for dessert the cheesecake.   The filet was cooked as requested, very tender and well seasoned.
