The potatoes were a nice compliment. The cheesecake was classic and delicious.   I'd definitely return to try some other menu options....and to try the lemon cake....I hear it's amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet and Chateau potatoes
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spring Mix Salad

NjNcn7X_exlIPKQdhnimOw.text: "Words are just words when written but STEAK is DARN good when eaten" by BianKa Milton (ME) I'm a pescaterian so I don't eat any meat other than seafood however while pregnant I did enjoy a filet here (during restaurant week 2014) and it was DARN GOOD. I've returned on two separate occasions and was impressed by my other tryings. I just ate here during restaurant week 2015 ( I'm from Chicago so we call it restaurant week, however here it's call Queens Fest) and indulged in a great salad, a perfectly prepared salmon filet and enhanced my salmon for $10 to Oscar style (Lump crab and asparagus with yellow sauce which has a name but I can't think of the proper spelling so I won't attempt it).  The dessert was the highlight of my evening. I indulged in a banana bread pudding the only downside of this was the fact that there was no ICE CREAM offered. I was so SAD about this as that would've made the dessert PERFECT, instead it was GOOD and a couple of points away from PERFECT.  Since I've had dinner here several times my rating is based on overall experience from eating to drinking to hostess experience.  Be prepared to spend a pretty penny if you don't go during restaurant week.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Bread Pudding
Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon Oscar Style

ZG4CXQ19bRSDYeVRn5ntSw.text: This was my first time visiting and I was there for a networking event.  They had a cute little room that I believe they called the "Cellar".  Really intimate space with a bar.  I'll definitely keep this in mind when booking events or taking clients out.  There were two featured cocktails and the apps were amazing!  I haven't been here for dinner but looking forward to making plans soon! It's white cloth and has a very swanky feeling.  Great for date night, anniversary or birthday dinners.

EHO7fSQ5rZwhOwL1112qYw.text: This was my first time going & out waiter was amazing. Kept the whole table laughing and made sure we had everything we wanted/needed. Only bad thing was the food took longer than expected but it was well worth it. I had the Sea Bass. It's a must try dish

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. SEARED CHILEAN SEA BASS

EfUHsvMvI19XcmIsahl_eA.text: Atmosphere, service and steaks were excellent.   We gave this four stars as the lobster tail was very disappointing for the amount we paid; very little taste to it.   Servers were very attentive, personable, and knowledgeable about the menu.  Loved the decor and the setup was excellent as we didn't have to feel like we were screaming to talk to one another across the table.  Great date night location for us.

fRNtauAETyxyJOS7lzs0hw.text: We had a party of 6 and the service and food were both excellent! Scott was our server and was vet attentive introducing himself to each one of us. His recommendations were excellent and the service was outstanding!! Five of us had the filet which was cooked perfectly. I had Peppercorn sauce added to my filet which was delicious. The creamed spinach potatoes au gratin, heirloom tomato salad, sides were very good.

5nuDLAT0o1b_EJmQVY39qg.text: After doing some research and gathering advice from fiends and family, I decided to take, my now fiance, to Del Frisco's where I was going to propose. I called ahead to let the hostess know and she quickly responded with "is there anything we can do to help, and provided us with a beautiful table on the second floor. Everyone from the waiter to the manager were in the know and wanted to make sure they provided us the ultimate care. After dessert, my girlfriend went to the bathroom and our waiter, Scott, quickly came over and asked/gave advice on how to go about the proposal. He stated that he's got the Champaign ready for when she says yes as he has confidence  in me.  When she came back, I made the proposal and she said yes. Everyone was quick to congratulate and Champaign on the House was quickly brought to our table. A lot of the staff said congratulations and to make the already amazing night more of a blessing, a guest covered our tab. Thank you for the amazing night. I will be suggesting Del Frisco's to everyone for years to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States

HFMAewT9wKTpYqJkclo_Jw.text: This is probably my favorite place to get crab cakes. It was a delight and our server Amy may it even more pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. The view was spectacular

MmsSoqNSsPWjOah6CeKkNw.text: Just celebrated my grandpa's 80th birthday here over the weekend. I really love the atmosphere/ambiance and the food was delicious. My only complaint is that they seemed understaffed and there were times where we were wondering where our waiter was. I also had to send back my steak twice because after sending it back once it came back looking exactly the same, I wanted it cooked a little more. I also suppose they're so busy that they can't keep up with who ordered what because I ordered brussel sprouts as my side and our waiter served everyone at our table my brussel sprouts and not me. The sides are portioned in a way that is meant to be shared but I was like hello?? I ordered those. The food and atmosphere is good but for the price I do think there should be better and more attentive service.

1miBr161no-UBilgfr_Ifw.text: Not a good experience. First time and will be the last time. Made reservations for 8:30pm for a party of six Saturday. We were seated, our waiter came over, introduced himself to and gave us the specials. After that, about 15-20 minutes later, we had to get his attention to take our order. Once our order was placed, we waited until after 10pm for our food!! Out of the six of us, two of the orders weren't correct. The manager came over at our request and offered desserts to our table. It should not have taken that long for us to get our food. We won't be back!!

17WdmO5-6Irm7tIvMj5vuw.text: Great atmosphere, great service and great food. It was a busy Thursday night but not overcrowded. No reservation was needed. I and 4 colleagues were here to have dinner and talk business. We enjoyed the evening together.

WVc_6pfuo0R9Cic8g62XYQ.text: Always gooey food and fabulous service.  I love the VIP martini....FYI It's on special on Wednesdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse - Charlotte, NC, United States. V.I.P Martini

boE5d6_-7Uv3S_tY1xNawg.text: Great food, great service, great dinner. Very pricey but knew that before we chose this place. My wife's King Crab dish was so so, but this is a steakhouse. Our server Sasha was the perfect amount of attentiveness without hovering. Bread was nice and warm. Steak was cooked perfect and seasoned nicely, although no sauces such as Bearnaise were mentioned. Sasha treated my wife to dessert for our anniversary which was a nice touch. We will be going back to try the bar menu soon!

LTcn8rxBoU7DzUtwVIZU9Q.text: We had such a great meal last night! It was my first time, the place is awesome. Excellent service!!! Maggie I think was our waitress, she did such a nice job!  We sat upstairs it was quite and beautifully decorated for Christmas.   We had AMAZING calamari to start! And their wedge salad was   I had the scallops, didn't care for the sauce but they were cooked to perfection.  He had the medallions and loved them. He loved the potatoes augratin(I don't do bacon and they are cooked with that) we had a side of mushrooms too which were delicious!   Oh let's not forget the sesame bread!!!!!! YUM And we finished with mango sorbet which was the best I've ever had!   Great for special occasions. Too fancy for everyday but date nights or celebrations it's perfect!!!!!   They even have an event room in the basement that would be great for a get together or holiday party!

qOH7Vx3nJfGIqL6EOQxIqw.text: Years later I am back from California again and living in the QC. I still love this place but even though I live in the building next door to it I don't get to drop in here as much because all my friends live and work farther away now. Sad face. However, two years in a row it's been a little tradition to bring my Mom to their Thanksgiving dinner since I have been back. She loves not having to cook and I love being able to have DF Cabernet and the Del Salad with avocado dressing and of course my fave lemon cake! It's win/win.  She loves their full 3 course turkey dinner with all the trimmings including starting with a nice butternut squash soup and ending with the choice of pumpkin pie cheesecake or pecan pie. She says it's great.   Service as always was top level. I am always surprised how busy they are on this holiday. I guess a lot of people don't do the traditional thing or celebrate it or prefer just not to cook and clean up. Any other night of the year though this place is awesome as well.

OGDOvw8EzitVqN0ezTaHVw.text: We went here last night for Charlotte Restaurant Week and it did not disappoint! I love how this restaurant looks with its high ceilings and warm woods and lighting, and the metal detailing on staircases and railings were pretty cool. Everything feels very new, rich and comfortable. The food was very good, although it wasn't even a consideration that it would be anything but delectable given this restaurants reputation. I had the mixed field greens salad, filet, chateau potatoes and chocolate mousse. Everything was well prepared and delicious. I don't know if this is new, or something they always have since this was my first time at this restaurant, but they offer the Del Frisco's Power Couple meal (delfriscos.com/whats_hap...) that you can order even when it ISN'T restaurant week. The menu is nearly identical to the restaurant week offering, but is a little pricier at $99 a couple instead of the $60 restaurant week price. Still though, given the atmosphere, service and quality of the food I would consider that a pretty great value. This IS the type of place where they come by with the table sweepers to remove the crumbs every time they lift a plate, but not at any time did I feel like it was overly snobby or pretentious. If you crack a joke with the guy filling your water, he will most likely laugh instead of shooting an appalled look down his nose at you. Also, it's "dressy jeans" friendly during the week, which is nice, although the majority of the patrons were dressed in their "customer entertaining suits" or their "I came straight from work" khakis and button downs. I think we'll definitely make this a must visit at least twice a year during restaurant week. It's too good a deal at that time to pass up. Book early though, because those reservations go fast! *Favorite thing: that hunk of meat can't be beat.

kjt_i-sEYhASbkhDY_H07w.text: Pricy but excellent. My favorite is the filet. Sides are also very good... Potatoes, spinach, asparagus.

jQdiN8Ah-3UiYWCh3ui13Q.text: Celebrated a birthday there on Sunday- service was great, excellent wine list, good was great, had an awesome Sunday special that I was unaware of before I got there.  The lobster Mac and cheese was perfect, the crab cake was delicious but you only got 1 for $19.00, the steaks were wonderful, But I didn't like the BBQ shrimp, they were just two steamed shrimp with BBQ sauce poured over them.  It was expensive, but I expected that, I will definitely be back.

0JHDYI5CWsGwhTVjnGi3Jg.text: I have eaten here numerous times and unfortunately there is no consistency in food quality. I have been served great steaks and very average steaks. This evening steak was ordered medium well and served rare. I could not eat it and ended up bringing it home for my dog. Servers always tell you that plates are very hot but they never are. This is not the place to eat if you like vegetables. Vegetables are ridiculously sparse. Steaks served with mashed potatoes filled with butter. Desert are good. Caesar salads very average- 131 Main are much better. Be warned this restaurant is expensive for what you get a big steak. If steak is not great it is a rip off. You will not be able to leave there with a bill less than $200. Do not believe reviews that food is always cooked to perfection because they are not. Like most restaurants Del Frisco's is hit and miss.

zvheNM2rNU9Ansr2jatQZQ.text: I've been here twice and I can't rave enough about it! May I suggest going during happy hour or just eating appetizers at the bar if you don't want a huge meal. Eat your heart out Ruth's Chris!!

dcXMEH37BrS6rKfOlWO48Q.text: I cant believe Ive waited this long to come here. Everything was absolutely delicious.......Had an awesome crab cake for an appetizer & although for $18 I expected 2 cakes, they only give you one but it was wonderful. Its real crabmeat & its served with a very tasty cajun sauce that I absolutely loved! My filet mignon was cooked perfectly & seasoned very well. I was very surprised to see skillet potatoes & onions on the menu @ such an upscale place, they were very good and the amount they give you is plenty for 2/3 people. I ordered strawberry cheesecake for dessert & I was only able to eat one bite of it because I was absolutely stuffed from the bread, ceasar salad, filet mignon & potatoes! I cant wait to come back!

hoSCJnDV4b9TnDxlOkqcRg.text: I have eaten at several Del Frisco's and my experience at this location was really disappointing.  My husband has been raving about the DF ribeye that came sliced that he had at the NYC location.  We sat down at the bar since it was the two of us and he spoke highly of it to the bartender.  We mentioned the "sliced" ribeye several times with emphasis on this preparation.  He said no problem.  He recommended some wine, we each got a glass.  We added a lobster tail and he asked what size, we said just enough to go with the steak small to medium.  Steak arrives, not sliced and close to half was practically inedible with it's toughness/gristle/sinew etc.  We order MR so it wasn't because we ordered it well done or anything.  I had lamb, it was tough to eat as the meat was riddled with sinew.  They carry standard mint jelly, nothing special.  Had the creamed corn, almost no flavor.  Lobster arrived, it was good quality.  Finally, since I was still unsatisfied with dinner I got a dessert menu.  They had a chocolate mousse with brandy soaked lady fingers and pear.  I specifically mentioned to the bartender that I liked the flavor of rum and brandy in desserts and that I was excited to try it.  We ordered it to go.  When I went to eat it later, they didn't include the pear or lady fingers, just bland chocolate mousse.  The bartender was very nice but didn't listen to anything we said.  Wine was 18$ a glass, which I wasn't expecting and we had 2 each.  That is fine, because I didn't ask,  but it seemed a little high considering we told him we were just wanting a Cabernet.  The lobster ended up 96$.  Again, my fault because I didn't ask, but between that and the wine, I got the impression he was more concerned with running up our tab than actually caring about our experience.  We eat at lots of good restaurants and I have never been so disappointed in a $350 meal for 2 in my life.  At this price, I expect great service and attentiveness to the food, but I guess they disagree.  Will never return.

TQjgrzN4jO3nEKtz70kqTg.text: We loved it. The food and service were phenomenal. Looking forward to another opportunity to enjoy dining here again!

uFZQtvpnq1f2rKBOJDpg_w.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere.  Food was consistent with other Del Frisco locations.  I would suggest you request no or low salt on steak.

kARnoaKWZR04wwS3mCstJw.text: We had a great meal last night - We went for my birthday ... food was good, but the service was Awesome.  Our server hit it out of the park, but while we were there, we noticed all of the servers were on top of their game and all helping each other out.  We had 1 main server, but there were about 6 people that came to our table from time to time to remove plates, refill drinks, and the manager came at the end of the meal and talked to us and wanted to make sure that all was well --- great evening

2VVFialZXfBslK0gtFRNKA.text: Hold up, hold your horses, not another Del Friscos review! This one isn't all rainbows and smiley faces though. Well, all things considered, they're still receiving 4 stars and I can honestly say at the end of the day, the Del doesn't disappoint.   The stage is set once you browse the menu. It describes how to eat the bread, 'with your hands' and clear as day lets you know that YOU, "you mean me?", yes YOU control the pace of the meal. Maybe that's the reason for such limited reservations spots? Most definitely not a detrimental way of doing business.   Del Friscos truly is a "can't miss" for restaurant week. Their version of turtle soup was yummay. Perfectly seasoned and quite filling. The steak - even hooked on phonics couldn't educate me enough come up with adequate adjectives to describe it. Unlike Del's adopted stepbrother Sully, the steak here is seasoned just right.   The potatoes were good but nothing to call home to momma about. But that strawberry cheesecake...oh man. Do you like Strawberry Shortcake ice cream? This guy right here sure does and that's what that cheesecake tasted like. Now that's how you finish off a meal.   As stated, it isn't all praise and worship though. Upon our arrival, we didn't even get greeted. Wait, are we at the right place? Is this the Westin or Del Friscos? Can I get a hello, bienvenidos, aloha, anything? Nope. We had to approach the hostess and introduce ourselves and reservation. Our first cocktail waitress wasn't all that nice either.   Normally I wouldn't even give a rat's arse or give it a second thought but these two were almost, almost rude - at least by Del Frisco's standards. If it was any other place, I'd pay it no mind. But it's Del and let's face it, we all expect perfection. See what you guys have done Del Friscos? You're too damn good for your own good.

jIk9hlytcszcU5qTOmfkKg.text: OK, my steak was $65.  I was not paying, but still...that is just nuts.  It was a bone in filet, and it was outstanding, if a little undercooked.  Mac n Cheese side with bacon and jalapenos took this review from 2 to 3 stars on its own.  I am not a big steakhouse person, but McKendrick's in Atlanta/ Dunwoody is much better in my opinion.  Pittsburgh style and cooked perfectly.  Great service and a good place, just not my cup of tea...

6GwVG6TU7PXnWCdiubNN9Q.text: What was supposed to be a joyous celebration Saturday night quickly turned into a disaster with my party of six leaving Del Frisco's hungry, frustrated and unhappy.  Having dined at Del Frisco's locations in Charlotte and New York City numerous times, we looked forward to a nice evening with friends and good food. The weather was perfect for outdoor seating, but after awhile our server obviously forgot us and focused on her patrons sitting inside.  Repeated requests for water were ignored.  Our food was delivered from the back door 45 minutes after we placed the order.  Every entree and side dish was cold, not warm temperature, but cold.  Two of the steaks ordered medium were completely raw.  Our server never returned to ask if our food was prepared properly, so I went inside to speak with a manager.  As I was telling the manager what happened, another man approached, pushed the first man aside, and told me he was the manager.  (Who's in charge?) I explained the situation and the "manager" asked me what I wanted him to do.  It was 9 o'clock in the evening, our food was inedible, and he asked if he could buy us dessert!  Evidently, while I was inside speaking with the manager, our server finally showed up at the table and initiated a heated conversation with my boyfriend because I was inside speaking with the manager.  Did we pay for our meal?  No.  Was it worth the free meal?  No!  Thankfully, Charlotte offers a fine selection of restaurants far superior to the establishment we patronized Saturday night at Piedmont Row.  My next dining experience will be to a first-class restaurant where the servers are properly trained and my perfect steak will arrive sizzling in butter.  A message to the manager - I didn't take home the bag with the two slices of lemon cake that you had delivered to our table.  Lemon?  Really?  At least make an effort and toss some chocolate our way!

AuzJE7dKOpuvaHCv7br0FA.text: I only been to Del Frisco's once and I had one of the best steak I have ever had. The Wagyu "Longbone" 32 Oz. Ribeye with sauteed mushrooms was perfection. Spinach and Potatoes Au Gratin were good. It's a high end place so be ready to spend some money.

eGrM9R3FBJgLTQ0yNln-qg.text: The whole dining experience was excellent  Both the service and quality of the food could not be better!

tGZ6oNhkrcoRsn4MRzIKXw.text: Ah the high end steakhouses of Charlotte. This one is a tough one for me, I am from New York, the land of peter lugars and ben and jacks. These are some of the best steakhouses period. As far as Charlotte is concerned its so hard to compare this one is better than that one so on and so forth.   Ive been here once and I must say I ordered my fillet medium rare and it was incredibly dry. wasn't very impressed. sides were good, wine good.   My ranking of local steakhouses  1. Flemming's  2. Ruth Chris  3. Del Frisco's

xRcLbrAQvVXPfx_ZQXwCAw.text: Steak was good. A little on the salty side but did the job. I would go back but would look at other options first.

j6AFA_TiRq5m8JEcFcIsqA.text: Considering this is owned by the same group that owns Sullivans (one of my favorites) I had high expectations. Unfortunately on my two visits to Del Frisco's I was left with a "not-bad" feeling. I know everyone in loves this place and it is considered the best in Charlotte, but I just have to disagree. I'm not saying that it's bad by all means. I'm just saying there are better. I consider myself a man of steak and on my first trip here I had the filet. Prepared well, but a little under-seasoned. The sides were good and plentiful and the place is beautiful inside with a 2 story feel for most of the restaurant. Feels rich and the bar area is nice and open.   On my second visit I went with the lamb chops and they came out so hot, it was hard to imagine that they rested for any sort of time. I say this because my wife's scallops were lukewarm at best. My only assumption was that they didn't cook the "1st order" correctly and rushed to make the 2nd one while the scallops waited. I could be wrong too...who knows. The lamb tasted ok, but I couldn't get over how it was presented. We also barely saw our waiter and he walked by a few times when I tried to track him down. Wasn't overly busy either. Desserts were good. Nice wine list too!   Overall, this is #5 for me in Charlotte. Will I return...sure, but there are 4 other places I would go first. But that's just me. I have been by several times to enjoy some scotch at the bar!

KQ6OlqoGQVR_0Kr88QuGkw.text: This was such an amazing experience - the food (with one exception) was top-notch - taste, presentation, reality matching menu description!  The exception - my mom and sister each got shrimp appetizers and the large (!) shrimp were tough.  My app. of raw oysters was fantastic; the drinks were made well (our group had:  raspberry martinis, lemon drop martini, and margarita on the rocks w/salt) and the wine was good as well (pinot noir and malbec).  Everyone's main course was fabulous, and the side dishes were just as amazing - cauliflower gratin, creamed spinach, macaroni and cheese, and steamed asparagus.  And that last one - hot, tender-crisp and a lovely shade of green!  Our waiter (and the other staff we met) was excellent, attentive, friendly (but not intrusive), and helpful.    Just wish I had the income to be a regular visitor (on second thought, it's probably good I can't be - I'd weigh 300 lbs. in no time!)

-gE60T-qu841M8e492M9kQ.text: My mom, dad, husband, and I went here for dinner for my mom's birthday last week and it was nothing short of fantastic. We sat upstairs near the bar where we could still watch the Panthers/Saints game, but it wasn't the star attraction. Our waitress Erica was attentive, knowlegdable, but not too over-bearing. I had the tomato-onion salad with the blue cheese crumbles and vingarette dressing to start, and I could have eaten just that for dinner it was so amazing. For dinner, I had the seafood dinner entree special of a crab-stuffed sole with a spicy tomato jam-to die for! For a steak house, they out-did themselves on their seafood! My dad had a trio steak special, with 2 types of filet and a short rib that I kept stealing samples of. And my mom and husband had 2 of the most delicious rib-eyes Charlotte had to offer. The drinks were strong but not powerful, and the wine list was a novel with a selection for every palate. We love this place for special occasions and wish it was more budget friendly for more regular date nights!

7B-PI1l40nBFXWJy7fLM5A.text: Let me start with the service, it was great. My wife's steak was also wonderful, my steak was at best horrible, it had a bone in it and was 50% gristle. I visit Sullivan's quite a bit and understand that both are owned by the same company, however I will not return to this Del Frisco's

aOZX1CwkbqDWjiTDPv9d9Q.text: Best steak in Charlotte and very comfortable yet upscale ambiance.  'Nuff said.  And get the calamari, unless you're a purist that only likes it plain.  Actually I'm sure they do the plain kind too.  But that Shanghai style is mm mm good.

JHBPszNsXywv1I-5iE_pig.text: Great looking steakhouse, food is good and they are really proud of it. Although I don't appreciate the over the top push to try two or three appetizers.

YPjdsA4cwv5a5OgPZiRTdg.text: Ok! went to Del Frisco's during Queens Feast and now am spoiled beyond belief! Absolutely the Best steak We have ever had in a Restaurant. The service from the Maitre D, to the Bartender and the waitstaff were all elegant, professional in unison with the ambiance and the customers. Now! unfortunately I will have to set a Budget for every two weeks to return but careful not to get use to it. As it is an experience I never want to tire of.

Ppay0ptnCA3hTvZpaQI9Nw.text: 5 stars you say?!?! Absolutely I DO!!! There is nothing I didn't love about this place and that is saying a ton. This is not a place to go on a whim unless you have that kind of money to throw around for everyday dinner, I personally save it as a go to special occasion place. The atmosphere is everything you could want it to be and the individual attention you receive from the staff whether you had reservations or got lucky with a table when you got there is nothing short of aces! The wine list is extensive and they do not mess around on their knowledge of that wine. If you like to start with a cocktail I HIGHLY recommend an extra dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives, this alone keeps me coming back! As for dinner I started with the salad with avocado goddess dressing and what a treat it was! The 8oz fillet was by far the greatest steak I have ever eaten in all my life.... I have lived in Texas and Alberta where beef is key and though things I had there were great they still didn't beat Del Frisco's fillet! The sauteed mushrooms as a side were a perfect compliment. As for dessert.... Chocolate mousse! Heavenly and silky sweet! Please give this place a try, I promise.... you couldn't possibly regret it!

JpgjA-xGTN6xQfMptAPevg.text: We go out every year with longtime friends to celebrate their anniversary. Last year was a wonderful experience at the Palm. Not so much for Del Frisco's this year. Our friends were brought their steaks which were fine. My wife was brought a ribeye when she had ordered a filet. I was brought nothing and told there was a mixup on my order. Fifteen minutes later with others almost finished, I was brought a rare filet. I had ordered medium. It was taken back and recooked and reserved in a few minutes, but it was so dry and tasteless. Very disappointing all around. Our main waiter was excellent but one of the food servers had smart comments about everything. We did not find him amusing. The manager ultimately came over with extreme apologies. Apologies were actually coming from everywhere, but that did not make up for ruining a special evening. My steak was comped, which was fine, but I would have rather paid and had a great experience. We were brought desserts as well, but I paid for my wife's dinner and our friend's check was almost $200. It was embarrassing to endure this experience in such a beautiful setting. For the record, we have been there three times and had one amazing experience and two disappointments. It is not likely we will be returning unless something changes. My friends evening was ruined just like ours and it cost them a lot of money to watch this fiasco.

xANv61ufAARs15XeKr-85A.text: I had the best steak that I have every had.  The bone-in filet mignon had so much flavor and cut like butter.  I have to share this experience because of the fact that there are many restaurants with good steaks.  This was by far the best.  The restaurant is absolutely beautiful and elegant.  The staff was very professional and obviously well trained.  Del Frisco's is definately the restaurant to go to if you want to be made to feel like a king or queen.
